title: Thi√™n √Çn Hotel
address: 245A Tr·∫ßn H∆∞ng ƒë·∫°o, to 7, Y√™n Minh, H√† Giang 310000, Vietnam

reviews.content: Booked a room here as it had reasonable reviews.  However, we left after an hour because there was no heating.  We were staying in Feb(winter) and had didn‚Äôt the day in a bike so were cold.  We were told by the owner that no where had ‚Ä¶
Room was freezing cold and not as described.  Owner tried to tell us none of the accommodation in the area had heating.  We left and found a somewhere with heating and a more welcoming reception.

Made an unexpected stop in Yen Minh during our first day of the Ha Giang loop drive, and came across this place due to good reviews. We arrived and the owner with her baby were so warm and welcoming and showed us the different rooms she had available. We opted for one that was furthest from the main road. It was simple with a hot shower, clean bed, and a/c that worked perfectly. The bed is a bit hard as some other reviewers have mentioned, but my partner likes hard beds so it worked out nicely. In the morning she made us tea and we drank it together while showing her some photos of our trip so far. I highly recommend staying here and helping out this family. Thank you!

We had a great welcome.
The room is spacious and comfortable, well worth the price. And the location is perfect
The mattress was hard as rock, I had to fold the duvet and sleep on it

The staff cancelled our two bookings for the night without any explanation. As we arrived they told us it had been some sort of mistake. Instead we were given a big family bedroom with 5 beds on a row for a lower price as he put it. Not what we expected. Ok for the price, but the the service was poor. Number given by booking sites doesn't work either as we actually tried to call in beforehand the same day to confirm our stay. Will not come again.

Very bad hostel. The bed was really hard and uncomfortable. The worst I've stayed in all the area. The table had a glass broken, very dangerous. There was also a hole in the door to the balcony, and that caused the room to be really cold. We asked if they have a heater, but they didn't, so we were freezing there. Also, the room and bathroom were very dirty.

Reserved online through Agoda, but this hotel was completely overbooked.  We stood empty handed in the evening together with another 6 people.  They probably have multiple accounts on booking and agoda, which will make them overbooked.

Clean and spacious. THE OWNER is kind. We booked 2 queen bed for two persons so it's quite big for us. Down this hotel, we ate pizza (less than small 3$ , big 6$)and fried rice and fried chieken set(3$). It was delicious. Served with free coke.
We used that Hotel during our Ha Giang loop trip. For that one night, it has all you need price Value is fair :)
Comfy hotel. The owners were nice and we could park the bicycle inside. The price is reasonable. Good quality.
The Room was very spacious and clean.there were hot water and Wi-Fi works fine.
A few issues, check in not until 3pm, it was advertised as 12pm. Given a one bed small room, advertised as a larger one.
Friendly host who employ the right people to make sure your well looked after.   Hard beds.  Can be a bit noisey given the location.
Cyclist here. Nice place, clean and comfy. Bike secure in Lobby
My booking was cancelled unreasonably. Don't book at this hotel if you want to plan your trip in advance!
Clean, spacious, cheap en fairly quiet tv and wifi airco and fan. Good deal all around.
Massive rooms at a reasonable price. Very clean. Hard beds though.
Good Hotel to rest during Ha Giang Loop!
Nice place, good value for the money, wifi worked
Good stay. It's worth the price.

Good value for money. The room was adequate, with mountain views, but the air conditioning didn't work and the bed wasn't really a bed; it was just a wooden board with a small cushion, and you could hear everything. The owner's friendliness was completely absent. But it was fine for one night. One positive point was that she let us bring our motorbike inside.
Good price, but we had ants and a cockroach in the room. The Wi-Fi didn't work, and we only had one bedspread. The bed was very hard and uncomfortable.

Great for an overnight stay, we arrived in the evening without a reservation. Good price. Hot water was flowing. Nice view of the mountains from the window and the balcony in the hallway to the fields. Good wifi. Unfortunately, you can't heat the air conditioning, at least that's what the owner told us, so it was a bit cold in the room in winter. Hairdryer in the room. Only the cleanliness could be improved, that's a real shame - the kettle is dirty from who knows what, that you can't even pick it up so you don't get dirty, what's next to the bed for the dirt that hasn't been cleaned for a long time, you don't want something to fall there. Glasses, dirty...

The rooms are spacious, airy with wide views, have two large beds, are very clean, and fully equipped with modern amenities. The rooms are beautifully decorated, creating a cozy atmosphere. The sleeping environment is very quiet and ‚Ä¶

It's very cold in winter. The bathroom is ventilated through two large screened openings.
The room clearly hasn't been cleaned. Traces of poop in the toilet, ashes in the trash, hairs and stains on the sheets. The floor isn't very clean either, with dust everywhere.
Hot water, a toothbrush, and shampoo are available.

The rooms are spacious, beautiful, clean, and fully equipped, with affordable prices. The owner is friendly, cheerful, and hospitable. I received a lot of help from the owner during my stay here. This is an ideal place to stay when traveling to the Dong Van Karst Plateau in Ha Giang province.

Thien An Guesthouse is the guesthouse I have stayed at. I felt the service attitude was very enthusiastic, thoughtful, the price was very reasonable, the room quality was very good. If you have the opportunity to visit the Global Geological Plateau, you should stay at Thien An Guesthouse.

The air conditioning wasn't working, and the solution to keep us warm was to give us a blanket thinner than a sheet. ü•∂
They tell you that the air conditioning isn't working after charging you for the night... very clever.
Large, airy space, clean room, good room quality, reasonable price, enthusiastic service, I really like it.

200k/room/night, 2 double beds
nice, clean, friendly
facilities: air conditioner, hot and cold water, TV, hair dryer, fan
Spacious, airy rooms, perfect service, affordable price. An ideal place if you want to stay in Yen Minh.
Solid accommodation. It was clean, had hot water, and the Wi-Fi was okay. The beds were very hard.
Safe, clean, cheap motel, next door there is a very OK restaurant!

TERRIBLE!!! I had a reservation through Booking.com, and when I arrived I told the owner. He said the hotel was under renovation and I couldn't stay, telling me to go to another hotel. He didn't notify me in advance through Booking.com. Very unprofessional.

After making a reservation on Agoda, I arrived at 6pm and was told the place was fully booked... I was thinking of sleeping outside, but they told me to sleep in the house in front, so I guess I won't be able to get in if I'm late „Ö†„Ö†
All in all, it was good, just a few ants in the room. But for the price, you really can't complain!
I stayed here, the room was very good, the price was reasonable, the service was enthusiastic and thoughtful, very satisfied.
Friendly welcome, unfortunately no English but with hand and foot language it worked. Great room, really big, clean and tidy
It's okay, but the beds are so hard, you're practically sleeping on a wooden board.
Cheap price, good quality. Address must have directions from the owner.

title: homestay A Ki·ªát
address: P·∫£ Vi, M√®o V·∫°c District, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: So first of, it's not a homestay. There is no food and no breakfast. Also the owner pointed me to 2 locations where I could eat. But they refused to serve me because I was alone. So in the end I had to beg another homestay to please give me some food.for this money you can find way better places

House new and in good condition, the room was fine , need for sure to improve the quality of the bed, I'm not usually picky, but was very hard.
In the morning at 6.00 started the heavy noise, with hammering and carpentry work on the second floor of the house, just above the room.
The hosts seems not really happy to see you around, no dinner or breakfast opportunity while we were there, generally was definitely far from what you can expect from an homestay.

I‚Äôm giving two stars based on

900K VND, 3 separate rooms , one night.

The location of this, and all other accommodation within 500m or so, is in one ‚Äúhome stay‚Äù village. A purpose built cluster of home stays. They aren‚Äôt typical home stays really.

Steep staircase to take luggage up. Very hard bed (fairly typical of a lot of accommodation options across Vietnam if not accomodating for western tastes)
Toiletries ok.
Pillows are very thin and limited quality (for western  comfort).
The worst aspect is the neighbouring property (Clay House) which has a large outdoor venue which allows parties of western tourists  until approx 1am. This wasn‚Äôt expected for a ‚Äúhome stay village‚Äùatmosphere.
I suggest use home stay in other village or stay in a hotel in Meo Vac town centre.

Separate rooms are divided with doors and walls but no separate roof, so no sound proofing. Like a dorm with walls. One room door cannot be locked.

This place is not a home stay, no one lives there its more of a hostel. The rooms don't have walls that go all the way up but rather a weird plastic window, so there's no privacy and you can hear everything. The bed is really hard and uncomfortable, there is no window in the bathroom rather than a hole.
There is a party hostel next door so there's loud music. And to top it all of there was a fan in the room that you can't turn off (we even asked the staff and they didn't know how to turn it off) and it was COLD. All in all it was a horrible experience

The room was quite big but the bed was just awful, basically a very very hard foam.
Also sound insulation from other rooms is basically non-existing and there is only one toilet which is combined with a shower for the entire second floor.

But seriously what broke me was the bed... I had a horrible night
Really loud music next door, generally a loud place to stay. Room is nice. Host is rude and not welcoming. No food on offer and no hospitality
Located far away from town. Never had such a hard matrass before. You could better sleep on the ground. Lots of noise in the evening.
If you are young and like exciting vibe, then this is a good choice. There is a bar and a restaurant nearby. If you are old and prefer a quite place, choose another quieter homestay nearby
Cozy homestay, was our first stop during the Ha Giang Loop!
No staff could be found on site.
The room is very nice, the owner is very friendly and wonderful. Overall, 100 points, nothing to complain about. Everyone should stay here to have the best experience.

Our room wasn't cleaned after the last guests. There was hair in the sink and unused toothpaste still lying around. The hosts don't speak English and couldn't help us even after we booked a room with a balcony but didn't get one. The accommodation next door is making noise throughout the entire area, and the children scream into the night. We absolutely don't understand the good reviews. The hosts treat us like air...
We've been traveling through Vietnam for three weeks now and have stayed in some cheaper accommodations that were sooooooo much better :(

A practically new, very nice and clean house in a new homestay complex 2 km from Meo Vac. |Private room, good bed with mosquito net. The shared bathroom was fine.|The family who runs the homestay are very hospitable and the young man speaks ‚Ä¶

Great price for a private room in this village.
Hot water, good pressure.
Hard mattress, absolute audibility between rooms.

In the village, they start drilling, sawing, and hammering right at sunrise. I thought this was a place for relaxation.

That day, I was the only guest. There were other homestays around that had better service quality, but I still chose my homestay because of... the Manchester United bedding set. Maybe because the owner, Mr. Trung, is a MU fan :))

Located in Zone B of the village, the homestay is quite easy to find. It's a lovely place with restaurants and cafes right in the area, making it easy to choose from. In the evenings, tourists flock to the community area, creating a lively ‚Ä¶
Spacious room, good price, attentive and enthusiastic service... from the owner to the staff are all very nice.
Clean room. Wooden house so quite warm for winter. Easy going owner. Reasonable price for 1 person or group

Clean and beautiful homestay in H'mong cultural village, public toilet is not closed
The host is very supportive for tourists

Reasonable price, new, clean room.
Food is delicious.
The most beautiful homestay I've ever been to, the surroundings are both beautiful and natural, with lots of flowers.
The shared room is okay. The wooden floor creaks too much ü•≤ ‚Ä¶
Bad experience and service quality. Will never come back

title: AURORA ƒê·ªíNG VƒÇN Boutique Hotel
address: 07 T·ªï 2 X√£, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, 31000, Vietnam

reviews.content: We stayed here as a part of our ‚Äúhigh class‚Äù package, and it was one of the nicest hotels we stayed in Vietnam. Very clean, modern to even Western standards. Nice showers, hot water, good but basic breakfast, and really well located walkable to many bars, restaurants, and shops. If you‚Äôre looking for a nicer stay, this is it!!

I had such an amazing stay here the hospitality was amazing. Tuan provided everything that we needed. Rooms were well accommodating and very clean. I will definitely be back and it is located in such a convenient area In town. 2 minute walk to ancient street 2 minute walk to markets and also bar, cafes and clubs.
Great hotel to stop at on our Ha Giang Loop! Lovely rooms, hot showers, and a great breakfast to get us ready for the day!
Amazing rooms! Aircon, hot showers and beautiful beds! So happy
The best hotel we‚Äôve stayed in on the ha giang loop so far! Very modern, clean and comfortable. The staff are lovely!
Was a stop over for the Ha Giang loop and was just what we needed, comfy bed, good air-con, shampoo etc and nice fresh towels. Staff were absolutely lovely I‚Äôd definitely recommend
Great hotel. Very comfortable and convenient when completing the Ha Gaing Loop. Great views too from a balcony.
Amazing stay! Lovely clean hotel rooms with nice warm shower.
Nice hotel, very clean. Enjoyed our stay. The staff was lovely. In a nice and fun neighborhood
Loved my stay here, rooms and everything is really clean and everyone is so helpful!!
Very nice and comfortable room. Cleanliness was very good too.
Super nice hotel!! Rooms were clean and very spacious!
Super clean rooms, nice breakfast, and hot showers, what more could you want!
Absolutely brilliant hotel. Great service. Would highly recommend.
Stayed here during the ha giang. The hotel is great
Great stay. Cheap and very nice
Clean, comfortable and welcoming. Good breakfast roll too.
It was an amazing place. Very clean and nearby the oldtown.
Thank you, the bedroom was perfect !!
We spent one night at the hotel as part of the Ha Giang Loop. Great hotel. We had a lovely, well-equipped room. The hotel is also well located.
The hotel is very nice, the staff very friendly, everything is very clean, and the shower was great too. The only downside is the much too hard mattress. It felt like sleeping on a carpet.

The room was beautiful and comfortable. The service was excellent. The staff and the receptionist were very enthusiastic. They even made tea and fruit for me, which was wonderful and a memorable experience. I will definitely return to this place when I come to Dong Van.
Great time at Aurora Dong Van Hotel! The hosts were very friendly and welcoming, the rooms quite comfortable and modern and the location very close to the center! Thank youüôè

Nice hotel, clean, enthusiastic and polite staff, reasonable price
Will come back if I have a chance to go to Dong Van again

üè£ Aurora Dong Van Boutique Hotel would like to send our sincere thanks to you for choosing us on your journey to explore Dong Van. üéâ We are very pleased to welcome and accompany you, wishing you a complete and memorable experience! ‚Ä¶

reviews.content: Very clean hotel located on the Ha Giang Loop route. Staff always very friendly and helpful.
We slept very well and the hotel was great! Thank you
Very clean and beautiful hotel. Friendly staff!
I would like to call to book a room
Perfect, the staff is very friendly! I recommend üôåüèº

title: Serenity Ha Giang Bungalow
address: 357 ƒêT182B, T·ªï 1, H√† Giang, 20506, Vietnam

reviews.content: We stayed at this place for two nights during our Ha Giang Loop tour. As we were travelling with children, it suited us well to stay in one place for two nights rather than changing accommodation each night. We enjoyed being away from the main part of town, as it was quiet, and the evening walk into town was much appreciated after a day on the bikes. We had the best dinner, but agree that a bit more variety or additional breakfast options would be a good addition. The team was very attentive, and our children enjoyed the larger space downstairs. Bring warm clothes for the loop at this time of year, but you can look forward to a warm room and a hot shower in the evening. Thank you for a wonderful time and your company‚Äîit was perfect for us.

I stayed here during my Ha Giang loop tour with Serenity. They own this hotel, Hoang Kim, and the tour itself.

The bungalows are absolutely wonderful. They are very roomy and comfortable. The property itself looks very nice visually.

For breakfast they fed us banh mi with egg. I wish they provided us different food on the second day. It shouldn‚Äôt be the same breakfast both mornings. A hot bowl of ph·ªü would have been great since it was freezing inside the building. They don‚Äôt have heating in the main dining area. If management is reading this, please consider this idea.

The hotel is a bit away from the old town where all the action is. When I say a bit away I‚Äôm saying it‚Äôs about 15 mins walk.

If you‚Äôre coming here in November, bring warm clothes.
Super clean rooms with everything you could need. Beautiful place and lovely host. Probably most comfy beds in Vietnam.

Don‚Äôt book this place via Airbnb, apparently they have an inactive account and the price rates are not accurate.

I wasn‚Äôt able to stay there because they were charging double then my Airbnb booking rate.

Please make sure you take your Airbnb rooms really offline, so people like me don‚Äôt book last minut looking for a room!

We initially booked just two nights at 1982 Bungalow Homestay in ƒê√° ƒê·ªìng ‚Äì but ended up staying five because we loved it so much!
The place is modern, spotlessly clean, with super comfortable beds and a beautiful large window front. It's located in a quiet, peaceful area, perfect for relaxing.
The staff was extremely kind, helpful, and welcoming ‚Äì we felt truly cared for.
Highly recommended if you're looking for a stylish and calm retreat with wonderful hospitality. We'd come back in a heartbeat!
The lady at the reception desk was so lovely and we had such a nice breakfast in the morning. Highly recommend!

Incredibly friendly receptionist.

Lovely clean and well designed rooms.

Comfortable beds.
Great hosts, breakfast was included. Would stay there again.

The room was really beautiful and clean. It smelled really nice and had everything we needed.
You can sit outside and enjoy a beautiful view.
The lady at the reception was really nice. Even if we didnt speak each othera language, she was very friendly and asked if we slept well.
We would come back and can highly recommend it!
We got offered to the room with a better view at the front, which is an absolute plus from the host. Overall, the place is new, modern and clean

Did the Ha Giang Loop in February, and it was the most comfortable place to stay at. Since the weather was still pretty cold, it was a pleasant surprise to have a heating in the room. The owner was more than helpful and shared their contact data for any questions or problems.
The rooms are really great with view and totally clean! It serves with AC and ready hot-water before your arrival!
reviews.reservation_recommended:
Hotel highlights
Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Great value, High-tech

reviews.content: It‚Äôs a nice experience to stay here for two nights. The views, the service and the location are great.

I was planning to choose a homestay in the Old Quarter for convenience, but the facilities weren't new. I switched to this one; the room is brand new, has a beautiful view, smells like cinnamon, and the staff are very pleasant. It's quiet, which is perfect for someone like me who has trouble sleeping. Highly recommended!
The rooms were very clean and we received a friendly welcome. Highly recommended!
Nice accommodation with good breakfast, friendly staff, more than adequate value for money.
The room is okay, nothing to complain about but the soundproofing is very poor. You can hear everything the room next door says, very disturbing to sleep.

The room view is so great, even from the room it's still beautiful, from the room you can see the mountains and forests, very clean and fully equipped, the parking space inside the house is very spacious and I give it 5 stars with peace of mind.

A beautiful, super-friendly, and very clean place to take a break from the loop. It's a bit pricey compared to the rest of the area, but it's worth it because the bed is softer than the other accommodations, and my body appreciates it for a good night's sleep after so many hours on the bike.
The room is spacious, airy, fully equipped, clean and beautiful. The staff is friendly and enthusiastic.
The room was beautiful and the owners were friendly and enthusiastic. Thank you so much!

title: Epic ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn Hotel

title: ToTo-Chan Hotel

reviews.content:
The best stay ever!
A kind father and son run this hotel, and they‚Äôre incredibly friendly.
The air conditioning works great, and they provide two free bottles of water.
My boyfriend got hurt while riding a motorbike, and they even gave us some medicine‚Ä¶ ü•π
The breakfast was delicious, and there‚Äôs also an adorable cat! ü©∑
Had a great stay. Rented some bikes saw some sights and came back to a good meal. The room was warm and clean.  I recommend staying here.
Super comfortable and clean room. Very nice, helpful receptionist. Recommended. Great option for a stop on the Ha Giang Loop. I would not hesitate to stay here again

We had a brilliant stay here. The room was clean and perfect for a one night stay whilst doing the Ha Giang Loop. We ate dinner and breakfast there and both were delicious! They were very thoughtful the entire stay and on check out we were gifted a free big bottle of water and some sweets - a lovely gesture.
A great place to stay in! Host are considerate and really nice
Great hotel for nice prices. The owner is really kind and helpful. It's a big advantage, that there is a restaurant downstairs. I would definitely recommend:)

Stayed here for 1 night while on the Ha Giang Loop and I was so happy. The place is nice, clean and convenient, it comes with great breakfast and the staff is absolutely outside and very friendly, highly recommend if you're passing by and need a place to stay

Recomended! ü§©
New hotel, very clean, tasty dinner and breakfast, very nice staff.
BIG PLUS FOR COLD NIGHTS - airconditioner can be also used as heating üå°Ô∏èüß°

This hotel is truly amazing!

I booked a room and paid a deposit here, but for some reason I couldn't use it. I contacted the hotel and they refunded my money quickly and were extremely friendly. 100 stars!

Excellent value for money for this hotel run by a friendly English-speaking person. Clean and large rooms, very comfortable bedding. I recommend it. The manager's brother has an excellent restaurant a few hundred meters away, I also recommend going there!

reviews.user_name: ƒêi·ªán t·ª≠ ƒëi·ªán l·∫°nh Hi·ªÉn Minh

reviews.content:
We arrived in town during the loop. The boy who greeted us at the entrance speaks English which is a wonderful bonus, he was kind and helpful.
The rooms are small but clean, in new condition and pleasant. There is a good smell at the entrance to the room, and they provide new packed toothbrushes. Personally I didn't like their shampoo so much so I switched to using my own.
There is a ten minute walk to the city center but it didn't bother us at all.
Please note that there is no elevator.
Affordable price, and excellent value for money in all opinions.

I just happened to pass by and stopped by, but it was so clean and cheap!! The price, which included breakfast, was incredibly affordable, and they even gave me a discount when I said I was only using one bed in a two-bed room. The inner room also had a great view~ There were about 7 different breakfast options, and most importantly, all the staff and the owner were so friendly!!

A true cocoon that comforts you after days spent sitting on your motorcycle.
The rooms are spacious, with very comfortable mattresses and blankets.
A perfect welcome.
A big plus: a quality breakfast with a wide selection.

The host is a young man who speaks English and is very involved in providing a perfect welcome! He showed us the points of interest and helped us with the next bus. He upgraded us knowing that a better room was available, the included breakfast is very good, there is a choice. They offer a catering service with vegetarian options. The room was well decorated and very comfortable, everything was perfect during this stay. Thank you for all these little attentions

We spent one night and were very comfortable. From the moment we arrived, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. The room was brand new, very nice, and has stunning mountain views. The beds are very comfortable, and there's a very relaxed atmosphere, a welcome change from the hustle and bustle of the previous night. We would definitely recommend it.

I really liked it! It was cold outside when we were driving along the Ha Giang ring road, but the room had air conditioning, which warmed us up. There was hot water too. Clean and quiet. The price/quality ratio is excellent. The service is very good.
Great hotel for a stay during the Ha Giang Loop. Friendly owners and clean rooms.
Clean rooms and bedding. Delicious food. The young friends' passion and Mom's cooking are the best!!
The only thing we liked the least was the toilet.

The rooms here are simple and pretty, everyone. The beds are soft and comfortable. The owner and his wife are very cheerful and enthusiastic. If anyone intends to book a room here, I recommend it üòä ‚Ä¶
Clean rooms and nice staff. Not many amenities in the room, some rooms without windows and the hotel is quite far from everything. But overall a nice hotel.
Excellent hotel, large rooms and kind staff who took care of everything we needed. The hotel also has laundry services, massage and a restaurant. Clean room and amazing hostess!
New hotel, nice decor, clean room. The owners have a very pretty daughter.

Clean room, not far from the center
The owner was helpful, and the included breakfast was good and varied
Room heating and a hot shower
Everything is correct. Great price-quality ratio!
Clean room, comfortable, friendly, cheerful and enthusiastic staff
Good location, clean and well-equipped room. Very friendly staff. Thank you very much!
I highly recommend it. There's absolutely nothing to complain about.
Beautiful luxury rooms, good service attitude

New hotel
Nice and clean rooms

reviews.content: I had a very comfortable stay at this hotel! Hot shower after a long day of riding was just what I needed!
I highly recommend this place. The price is very reasonable, I‚Äôve rarely seen hotels this clean for this prise in Vietnam. A very pleasant stay and a warm, lovely welcome.

Wonderful hotel on a side street in the bustling town of Dong Van, on the Hs Giang Loop. Rooms are decent, presumably recently renovated. Functional and reasonably priced. Beds are comfortable. The shower is hot and plentiful.

Advantages: The hotel is relatively new, and its location is close to the city center; it's very close to the market and the Old Town.
Some inconveniences: The bathroom is small.

The hotel was brand new, incredibly clean, fully equipped, and conveniently located for accessing the Old Town while avoiding the noise from the Old Town. Overall, for my husband and me, Linh Chi Hotel was one of the right choices and made our Ha Giang Loop trip even more worthwhile and memorable.
Newly built hotel, everything from furniture to electricity is new, I am very satisfied with the quality of facilities and service attitude here.
New hotel, enthusiastic staff, delicious coffee and food at cheap prices. Will come back.
The rooms are clean, the space is particularly quiet and clean, and the staff are especially cheerful and enthusiastic, able to advise guests remotely on the most convenient itinerary.

The room is beautiful, clean, luxurious, and the receptionist is pretty and lovely...she also sells agricultural products. She also sells pretty scarves. Anyone who stops by to stay should buy some for their ex.

The hotel's location near the town center is very convenient, the rooms are nice, the hotel has a restaurant, guests can eat and drink at the hotel restaurant, the staff is enthusiastic and friendly, I really like this hotel
New, clean hotel, friendly and attentive staff. I stayed here for 2 nights during buckwheat flower season in Ha Giang and was very satisfied with the service here.
Modern, clean hotel, affordable price and the owners are super funny and enthusiastic ü´∂ü´∂ü´∂, the food they cook is also super delicious =)) ‚Ä¶

I stayed at the hotel on November 15. It was a great experience: clean room, quiet, enthusiastic and hospitable hostess, convenient location for traveling and having fun. I give 5 stars and if I have a chance to go to Dong Van, I will come back!
I only stayed here for one night but was very satisfied. The hotel is newly built, the rooms are spacious, the owner is enthusiastic, and the price is reasonable.

The hotel is spacious and clean, the owner is friendly, enthusiastic and thoughtful. Everyone who goes to the temple doesn't know where to go. Ganoderma is also a choice. Plus, the lake is also doing air conditioning.

I stayed at this hotel for one night and was very satisfied. It's a newly built hotel, so it's clean, and the staff were very friendly. I'm planning to return to Hajang Loop next spring, and I'd love to come back then.
New hotel, enthusiastic and attentive staff. Convenient location to tourist attractions around the district.
The hotel is clean and convenient. I ordered rice here. The vegetables are homegrown so they are clean and delicious.

Nice location, near the old town center, enthusiastic receptionist, beautiful new and clean rooms.

New hotel, clean, friendly, cute and attentive receptionist!

Beautiful space, clean room, beautiful!

title: KH√ìI PANORAMA
address: ƒêT182B, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang 310000, Vietnam

reviews.content: Khoi panaroma is an absolute gem! I can‚Äôt stress enough how breathtakingly beautiful every part of this property was. Right from the collection of the most incredible bonsai plants , the wooden furniture carved to perfection, yummiest pumpkin soup , lovely red wine on offer, and the most unreal view early morning from your bedroom balcony. None of the above though can compete with the warmth shown by the owners of the property. I truly felt at home, safe, comfortable and absolutely taken care of. The only bad thing about the place was the fact that I had to leave it. I‚Äôm definitely coming back over and over. It‚Äôs a dream home stay you should not miss it.

A little paradise in the middle of nowhere with stunning views either from the first floor bedroom or the terrace. The owner loves bonsais and has a vast collection of them, one more beautiful than the other. Both owners, husband and wife are very pleasant. We had dinner and breakfast and it was very correct. I highly recommend this lodge.

Kh√≥i Panarama was by far the best place we stayed in all of Vietnam. We stopped only one night on our Ha Giang self ride excursion, but I felt like I could have stayed much longer. Peaceful atmosphere and exceptionally beautiful architecture with lovely people. (And gorgeous dogs.)ü•∞

It was a very beautiful spot! So Many bonsa√Øs front a wonderful view
The building is ao beautiful with lots of personal touches
Host is super friendly and products are very goods
O would have stayed there month to do a helping project if it was possible

The house is so beautifully designed. I love the architecture of the house & the many details.

The views are spectacular, the owner is very kind.
We where planning 1 night & spent 2.
One of my favourite homestays of the trip.

Beautiful place! We came across this place in the last minute when we looked for a place to crash for the night. The room and the house is absolutely gorgeous. The view from our balcony was incredible. A lot of details are taken in the architecture and interior. They serve delicious dinner and breakfast. The only thing to keep in mind is the bathroom is shared and separate from the room, and is quite basic. However, overall really love our stay!

If you‚Äôre into architecture/interior design, you will love this place! Beautiful wood and stone construction full of tasteful details. The view is breathtaking as well.

Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for somewhere quiet and clean.

KH√ìI PANORAMA offers a truly unique and memorable stay! The all-wood construction of the building is not only visually stunning but also adds a rustic charm that sets it apart from other accommodations. The wooden structure naturally keeps the rooms cooler, which is a refreshing change, and the thoughtful addition of electric heaters and blankets ensures that you're comfortable even on chillier nights.

It's the perfect spot for those who want to immerse themselves in the beauty of nature.

One aspect to note is that sound does carry between the rooms due to the wooden design. However, the quiet hours policy from 10 PM ensures a peaceful night‚Äôs rest, and I didn‚Äôt experience any disturbances during my stay.

Overall, KH√ìI PANORAMA is an ideal choice for anyone looking to enjoy spectacular views and a unique wooden retreat.

The best stay in all of Vietnam!!

I can‚Äôt say enough about the incredible kindness of the family. I reached out to let them know that it was husband‚Äôs birthday, and they gifted him the most beautiful cake and flowers.

The house is so so beautiful. It felt like a movie! The area was so peaceful, with amazing balconies on the room and the best views. The property had the friendliest dogs, and even a guitar which could be played while watching the sunset.

Some reviews said it could be loud, but we found the exact opposite. It was the most quiet and peaceful place ever!

Definitely one of the most memorable hotel stays of my life!!

Amazing location and beautifully decorated building. The rooms have their own bathroom, but you have to cross the alley so do not forget your pyjamas üòâ. We had a nice local dinner with a good glass of wine and some happy water. We had a lovely evening with the friendly owners

Should‚Äôve read previous reviews, because this definitely feels more like a business as opposed to a homely, friendly homestay. The same owners aren‚Äôt so welcoming and ignored our food requests. Please AVOID the food here, it‚Äôs terrible and costly as per the town centre. Same goes for accommodation, although the room was nice. If it was more central, we would‚Äôve stopped eating and walked into town for food, but were too tired to. There‚Äôs definitely better closer to town.

What an amazing experience we had at Khoi Panorama! If you are looking for an authentic accomodation with the best view ever at the Ha Giang Pass, stop looking and book this homestay! It is designed with a great eye for detail and I loved the heated blanket for the cold night. Most warm welcome from the owners and had a little drink at the bonfire after a great dinner.

Beautiful house built in HMong mud walls and massive wood style, very rustic. Great view and little walking footpaths in the forest. For anyone complaining about the lack of sound insulation, remember, you're travelling in Vietnam. Get some earplugs.
Had the best sleep here! The owner is very nice, tbe food is good, and the 2 dogs are very friendly.

I recently stayed at a place that was marketed as a "homestay," but it was far from that. It‚Äôs clear that the owners are using the term "homestay" to deceive guests, as there‚Äôs nothing homely or family-like about this place. It‚Äôs purely a business, not a genuine homestay experience.

The price was incredibly high, much more expensive than the Hmong Village Resort where I stayed just the night before, which offered far better value for the money. The accommodation here does not justify the exorbitant cost.

The food was terrible‚Äîhonestly, some of the worst I‚Äôve had during my travels. I ended up going to a nearby town where I found much better food at a fraction of the price.

I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic or good-value experience. Save your money and stay somewhere else.

It was noisy at night due to poor sound insulation and construction! You can hear guests talking in the rooms next door as if they are in your room! You can hear people walking in room above you. Dogs barking loudly during the night.

There‚Äôs no safety door lock. How do you feel if people can open your door disrupting your privacy?

The room has a small wood window but no glass to block insects from flying in!

I give a generous 2 stars for its view of the beautiful mountains of Ha Giang!

Bottom line is I don‚Äôt recommend this place!

Very nice place the furniture the view is fantastic, BE AWARE! it could get very noisy the acoustics at least in the bottom room (where I stayed) is really bad, there was a group of people who woke up at 5:00 and till 9:00 o‚Äôclock I was bombarded by there talks and walking around. In my taste the price doesn‚Äôt justify the amount of noise

The worst service and customer support I‚Äôve ever had. The electricity went out in -1¬∞C weather, and we were only given a $4 discount on a $100 bill, without any apology or further support. The view is fine but it wasn‚Äôt worth it at all.
Family-run wooden homestay in an incredible paradise in the mountains. Highly recommended for the hospitality and kindness of the family, the food and the panorama.

Great view from Khoi Panorama which is located on top of the hill. We really enjoyed every single moment with the cold November winds in Ha Giang. Beautiful flowers, fresh air, clean rooms, and friendly the owners‚Ä¶.This place made our trip to Dong Van become unforgettable. Will comeback!
Probably the most beautiful place that I've ever been. The views are incredible and the room and dinner was amazing. I would recommend you to stop here if you are doing the Ha Giang loop.
Super amazing! You must be here once in your life.
everything was nice. they made us feel like home. the host really friendly and supportive. if you are still wondering whether or not, this is a right place.

Vietnam.

If you stay here, try to arrive at least an hour ahead of sunset to make the most of the garden/terrace and the views.
Haven't had a chance to stay here yet, but reading the review and seeing the way the owner responded to customers; it's unacceptable : rude and uneducated!
The room is too basic and feeling is cold, not that cozy
Superbe view, and very nice atmosphere and staff! I definitely recommend!

Well-decorated wooden house, which can be noisy if your neighbors are noisy, as the walls are made of thin wood.
Very warm welcome with a pleasant dinner.
For chilly nights, the beds are equipped with electric blankets, which is pleasant.

The view from the balcony is exceptional, the decoration of this all-wood house is authentic, with great taste: we were transported to another era! The bonsai collection is also impressive. Beautiful place, we took the family room, there are no glass windows but a heated mattress and a good duvet. We were not cold despite the 10 degrees outside. Downstairs we found ourselves by the fire and had a great evening. The all-wood building is magnificent.

During our Ha Giang Loop tour, we spent a night at Kh√≥i Panorama, and it was definitely the best accommodation we booked in Vietnam. The view is indescribably beautiful, and the hosts are very friendly and prepared a wonderful breakfast for us.

Thank you for the great time! :-)

title: Ha Giang Aya Lodge

reviews.content: This place is just magical! I just spent 1 night with my family there and i can higly recommend this place to stay. Location is incredible, especially if you are arrive by bike. Staff is great and rooms are very beautiful. Heater was good enough for very cold days... shower is very nice too. We would love to come back again, thank you!

I had a wonderful 2-day-1-night stay at H√† Giang Aya Lodge, and it was truly a memorable experience.

The lodge features a strong Vietnamese cultural atmosphere, from its architecture to the interior design. Everything feels warm, authentic, and well thought out. The rooms are spacious, clean, and fully equipped, offering great comfort while still staying close to nature.

One highlight I really enjoyed was the food. The menu is surprisingly diverse, featuring both Asian and Western dishes, all prepared with care. A must-try is the bread dipped in mint honey ‚Äì a unique local specialty that perfectly represents H√† Giang‚Äôs flavors.

The air in H√† Giang is incredibly fresh and cool, making it an ideal place to relax and recharge. Waking up surrounded by mountains and quiet scenery was incredibly refreshing.

What made the experience even more special was the staff. They are local people ‚Äì simple, genuine, friendly, and incredibly kind. Their warm smiles and hospitality made me feel truly welcomed.

Overall, H√† Giang Aya Lodge is a perfect choice if you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful retreat that blends comfort, culture, and local charm. Highly recommended for anyone visiting H√† Giang üåø
Beautiful place to stay overnight! The room is beautifully decorated, and attention is paid to every little detail. Loved it here!

‚ÄèOne of those places that you have to find.
‚ÄèGreat rooms, excellent food, amazing view.
‚ÄèThe only thing I regret is that we didn‚Äôt stayed more.

Oasis of peace and relaxation.
It was wonderful to spend a night in this magical place!
The place is beautiful, the rooms are clean and meticulously maintained, as is the restaurant (very good, by the way), and the view speaks for itself.
Everyone was extremely attentive to our every need, even helping us find a mechanic for our broken motorcycle and accompanying us.
Everything was perfect, I absolutely recommend it.
Highly recommended! The room was beautiful, modern, and clean. The view of the surrounding countryside was breathtaking. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. It was a wonderful stay.
We stayed here for one night during the run. The accommodation is very nicely decorated and clean. The location is also perfect with a beautiful view. Definitely recommended.

I was returning to Hanoi without staying overnight at Meo Bac, and I was so disappointed that I was looking for a place to stay nearby. A local guide recommended this place to me. Construction is currently underway, and the resort is being built in a state-of-the-art, luxurious style. There are approximately 7-8 buildings under construction, with about 3 completed. Because of the ongoing construction, I was able to find a cheap one-night stay. The entrance to the resort is easy to find, but if you're looking for the La Resort on Google Maps, it's located under the road, so you'll need to look carefully. Parking is available above ground for about 3 cars.

The resort entrance is luxuriously designed. However, keep in mind that construction is ongoing. According to a staff member, it's been underway for two years. Because it's a rocky mountain, equipment couldn't be brought in, so the work was done by hand. This gives the resort a well-organized feel. The Chopin furniture has an antique feel, reminiscent of a luxurious medieval design. The guest rooms are clean and the view from the window is particularly beautiful. The surrounding area, with few villages nearby, is incredibly quiet and peaceful. Evening The food and menu are reasonably priced, and each dish is incredibly luxurious and delicious. Eating outdoors while taking in the scenery was a truly new and wonderful memory.

After finishing your meal, you head down to the first-floor lobby, where you'll find a perfect spot to unwind. Time flies by as you chat around the fire. The beds are incredibly comfortable, and the quiet surroundings make for a peaceful night's sleep. However, the roosters crow loudly in the early morning. This, too, is a nice touch, a testament to the country atmosphere. Breakfast and lunch are also excellent.

reviews.content:
Super cute homestay! The architecture is inspired by traditional Vietnamese houses, they‚Äôve beautifully rebuilt a typical old-style home with so much charm and character.

The bathroom was definitely our highlight ‚Äì stylish, spacious, and thoughtfully designed.

It can get a bit noisy due to the traditional construction and lack of insulation, but honestly, it‚Äôs totally worth it for the unique experience and beautiful atmosphere.

Great Hmong homestay just on the edge of town. If have own transport, this should be fine. Turned up after long journey from Ha Giang. Was welcomed with a fantastic family meal and hot bath/shower. Just what I needed. Breakfast was ‚Ä¶

This Homestay is a beauty: the design of the space, the courtyard, the decoration in the rooms feels very rustic and warm. Its location is also ideal, since it‚Äôs not in the centre of Dong Van, yet it‚Äôs in walking distance. Most important point: the genuine warm welcome from the whole family. Even with the language barrier, they were very keen to connect, exchange, and I truly enjoyed this positive attitude. The dinners they prepare for me were also a delight. Thanks again so much, I hope we see each others again :)

Lovely homestay. The owners were really nice. It was a bit pricey at first, but we got an offer for the right value, and that made it really enjoyable. Clean, high quality rooms. No heating, but there are heated blankets. There is a bath, but not enough hot water to fill it unfortunately. The bathroom looks amazing. The food was enjoyable and breakfast was included.

Guys, highly recommend this place for culture lovers. Cozy and beautiful rooms, wooden furniture and beautiful fireplaces. Their hospitality is definitely worth the visit. We had dinner and breakfast there, you guys should try the food they cook! This homestay owner is trying to preserve the ordinance and value of the Hmong ethnic group's house and that‚Äôs why we supported their business. They also have another homestay in Meo Vac - Ha Giang named Chung Pua House (try both of them and you will get unforgettable experience).

We had a lovely stay for 1 night. The family is very welcoming and will make sure you have everything you need. Dinner was served for us in the evening and it was delicious!! The old style of the hotel is really nicely done and everything is clean and tidy.
An authentic homestay in a friendly place. Nice place, nice home, nice people, excellent food. Quiet and so pleasant! A really out of the ordinary place to visit a'd stay!

A beautiful and well designed place! I 100% enjoyed my stay there. The staff is friendly and helpful. I didn‚Äôt have a booking and they received me on short notice. And they helped me getting back something that I had forgotten at their place. Thank you!
Highly recommended ‚ù§Ô∏è

Great Hmong homestay just on the edge of town. If have own transport, this should be fine. Turned up after long journey from Ha Giang. Was welcomed with a fantastic family meal and hot bath/shower. Just what I needed. Breakfast was excellent in the morning; in terms of a chicken pho. Accommodation looks simple, but great attention to detail in the rooms; from heaters to electric blankets. All taken care of. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return
Everything was great. Staff, location, hotel facilities.
Felt better than being at home! Absolutely recommend this cozy Homestay. Much love to you guys, C·∫£m ∆°n!

Dinner and breakfast were delicious, the owners are very friendly, and the rooms are lovely. Overall, it's a very authentic place. We went when it was cold, and the room wasn't very well insulated, but they have good duvets and electric blankets. If you're looking for an authentic homestay, it's great.

A beautiful Hmong house, tastefully restored by its owner, the son of an officer who participated in the ƒêi·ªán Bi√™n Ph·ªß campaign and was involved in preserving Hmong heritage. A very welcoming, simple, and warm family atmosphere. Located on the Ha Giang loop. A lovely market is held on Sundays.

We were kindly invited to dinner by Mr. Ogura, a pioneer of Dong Van, and the owner of the inn. The outdoor dining in front of the fireplace created a wonderful atmosphere, and we enjoyed local corn alcohol with Vietnamese food.

It was a time to really feel like Vietnam.
Accommodation slightly more expensive than others but much more authentic! And excellent advice for sightseeing. The building was renovated according to old plans of a typical Hmong construction.
I haven't stayed here for a night but I like taking herbal baths here. You really boil the leaves to bathe, not pour them from a can. The owner has a very cute wood stove kkk
Very clean room, it's new, close to the city...!

title: Dong Van B&B Resort
address: Alley 2 19/5, Street, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: My favorite place on the loop.    Is.   I The staff is awesome and very cheap. Good price. Ended up staying there 3 days in a row

Great place for stopover at Ha- Giang loop. The room was spacious, clean and great views. There was a little pool and hot tub right in front of our porch, but we decided to get some herbal bath and massage instead, after a day of winding roads. It cost us 350,000 dong each for sauna, herbal bath and 60‚Äô full body massage.
The dinner was fine, but we didn‚Äôt expect much anyways.
Overall, good place for stopover in Ha- Giang loop and would def recommend getting a bath and massage to relax.

Beautiful stop on our Ha Giang Loop tour. We got a couples room which had great AC. The shower was a bit weird and flooded the bathroom at first, but we fixed it. The food was delicious and was quiet but also a quick walk into town. I really wanted a massage there but sadly did not get one.
Great little B&B - wellness centre and cold plunge a great touch. Food was good too.

Perched above the winding streets of Dong Van, the Dong Van Bed and Breakfast clings to the hills of Ha Giang like a quiet lookout. Run by T√∫ and her cheerful staff, this hideaway offers a respite for the road-weary.

When our scooter gang, The Pho Bros, rolled into the courtyard, we were greeted by sweeping views of mountain range, covered with lush jungle and a breeze that cooled the grit of the ride.

The beds strike a firm balance‚Äîl - enough to keep the spine straight but comfortable enough to drift off after a day of winding roads. Some rooms come with the quirky charm of a hand-held shower head sharing space with the toilet, turning the whole bathroom into a splash zone. If you‚Äôre particular about your showers, request one of the upgraded rooms.

The main street is just a short walk away, alive with bars, local joints, and the hum of a town tucked at the end of the world. Don‚Äôt miss the massage at the B&B though - 150,000 dong for 45 minutes of muscle-melting relief that works out the road‚Äôs aches.

The sauna, also offered at the B&B is a steamy escape, an electric experience that wraps you in waves of heat, loosening every tense nerve. It‚Äôs a place to sweat out the dust and feel alive again. Mornings bring a simple breakfast of eggs and rice, or a steaming bowl of pho - a fitting start to the day in this mist-laden town.

The Dong Van Bed and Breakfast isn‚Äôt just a place to rest; it‚Äôs a mountaintop stopover that captures the wild spirit of the journey.

Pay for the location, nothing else.

Location great, but nothing else particularly good about this place. When I checked in, there was no-one around and no obvious check in desk to go to ask. Eventually I asked someone, who turned out to be the owner. The room was basic, with bad lighting; the shower didn't drain properly so you end up with a pool of water where you use the toilet. Both nights we were disturbed by events going on. Breakfast was unacceptable ‚Äì a fried egg on cheap white bread slices, with instant coffee. They offered a lump of condensed milk from a carton, because it had gone solid in the fridge. When I checked out, I told them 3 times that I didn't want breakfast, and just wanted to pay and leave, but they still got busy with the frying pan. Pool water was brown.

I came resort few days ago, the staff and the resort owner was really kind with us, she gifted us some keychains. We stayed in a bungalow with a nice view to the rice field, it was be perfect when we woke up and enjoyed coffee in the morning. The room pretty good with full modern comforts but the wifi connection was not stable, we didn't watch tv show so we had to use mobile data Instead. I highly recommend to anyone come here, you must bring some creams to protect you from mosquitos. After all this is a good place to anyone want have a great time after driving in hours.

Overall the room is decent. The only complaint is the shower pressure is weak maybe due to the way it is connected to the tap, just beside the WC. The drainage in the shower area is bad too, always a pool of stagnant water.

I only came up with a tour for the herbal bath, sauna, and massage combination package, so I‚Äôll only comment on that.

In my experience, the resort is not suitable for the winter, especially if you have a sensitive nose. The town‚Äôs burnings are quite different from agricultural burnings that reset their fields. I got mildly sick with upper respiratory tract inflammation as a result of the particulate matter in the smoke coming through the resort.

Second, I‚Äôm not sure why the resort‚Äôs service quality is still at such a low level after so many years. I‚Äôve traveled to 11 countries, and consider myself very experienced with different foods, drinks, and service standards. Even though the cost of the spa here is comparable to Thailand or Indonesia, the facilities and masseuse skills are very subpar. The details are as follows:

- On a winter night, at 8 degree celsius, none of the floors were insulated or heated. Nor were we directed in any way by the clearly underaged staff milling around. The first time you step into the bath & sauna room, the floor is wet and mucky. It is 8 degree Celsius and very very cold. You strip off your clothes in that temperature, bare feet on the cold floor. In contrast, even tropical countries ensure they have a raised plastic floor to insulate against the cooler tiles.

Mind you, even tropical countries have that.

- next, the young staff did not even reset or clean the rooms. For the price paid, you get cheap soap and shampoo sachets that were not even cleaned up. I counted 6 empty sachets on various places and had to clean them by myself.

- third, the only instruction for operating the sauna also did not warn you to stay FAR AWAY from the metal box on the floor. I scalded myself when turning on the lever. For first time sauna users, It‚Äôs important to note that once the smoke fills the room, it smells and feels dry. So it is up to you to use the shower head to blast some humidity into the adjacent room; this is not machine operated.

- fourth, for reasons unknown, the bath and sauna rooms have plainly exposed electrical sockets. Should you be using 120V chargers in a wet and moist environment with water splashing about?

- fifth, some might argue that it a ‚Äúcultural experience‚Äù, but even the Thai and Indonesians long ago adjusted their bathtubs to be LONGER and more ergonomic with a proper upper body and neck support.

- sixth, before the massage, apparently none of the staff spoke English, and nobody wanted to proceed with service until my vietnamese friends volunteered to be translators.

- 7th, for reasons unknown, the massage oil used had menthol despite it being winter. It was advertised as a hot ointment, so I was expecting something appropriate. Instead, once the initial heat from the menthol was gone, my friends and I were shivering in the aftermath cooling effect. Still, at least the young staff brought in thick blankets and a tiny heater?

- 8th, the staff I had simply went through the motions of the massage, not understanding that her fingers were supposed to be applying direct pressure on muscle, instead of friction rubbing across my scalp.

- 9th, to add more pain to the experience, my staff had long nails. Long nails. She clearly did not understand that she was scratching me either, since I had to remind her 3 times to be mindful of any motion that required her finger pressure.

All in all, would not go again.

Oh, did I mention the hotel lobby is exposed to the elements? Yeap. It is. Look at the pictures.

After 4 days on our motorbikes we desperately needed a massage. We asked the hotel and was recommended to Dong Van resort because they own the only spa in town. Their shuttle promptly came and pick us up at our hotel. The resort looks quite ‚Ä¶

Booked to stay and the receptionist tried to scam us for an extra 500,000d for a permit to stay in the city. Walked away from us mid conversation while trying to get proof of this obvious lie and showed us to our cold, uncomfortable room.

There‚Äôs a lot of really cozy hospitable places to stay in this town, this isn‚Äôt one of them

Enjoy your trips
üòä: We stayed 1 night in dong van b&b in a private bungalow. The bungalows are very nice. The park was very nice with a very nice swimming pool.. ‚Ä¶

üòä: Location great, but nothing else particularly good about this place..
üò¢: When I checked in, there was no-one around and no obvious check in desk to go to ask. Eventually I asked someone, who turned out to be the owner. The room ‚Ä¶
Came here for a spa package with steam, shower and bath plus a massage. Quality construction and amenities tucked away above Dong Van. Great photographer has some good stuff on display in the lobby.
My wife and I only came for a massage. We both agree that it‚Äôs one of the best massages we‚Äôve ever had. We paid 150k dong for 45 minutes.

Perfect Accommodation in Dong Van
Nice room compared to other Hotel in same Town
Reasonable price
Double Room cost 450,000vnd
Twin Room cost 550,000vnd
Located high and nice hill. Nice building, small room yet comfortable and clean. Nice staff. Have spa and bath, which using ethnic people ingridients
Had an amazing time with the locals on karaoke night. Friendly and incredibly helpful staff. Had relaxing herbal bath, sauna and massage at very affordable rates.
The place was ok and clean.The owner welcome us in a nice way and we drank tea with her at night. it is one of the cheapast place to stay in Danang.If it is kow season ypu can negotiate a bit.
Great place to escape from main town Dong Van. Privacy is the first priority
üòä: Very nice location, friendly staff, try the massage üëçüèº. ‚Ä¶
Nice, but no breakfast include even if it is called Bed and Breakfast ... towel, toothbrush, toothpaste included though, there is a nice spotfor karaoke and play pingpong
The rooms where big and clean. Staff was kind and could speak basic English. The massage was okay, don't expect to much of it.
Simply amazing. Clean. Friendly.  Great location.  Steam bath   karaeoke and massge all good and cheap.
The dorm was good. But the karaoke is right next to it and it gets loud until late...
They tried to make us pay 240 000 dong for a pass to visit dong van as a border country. This is fake, there is no pass
Good price for a warm tea bath after a long day of riding in the rain.
Not friendly, expensive for what it is, nice view though
A wonderful place! Great homestay and very good SPA.
Good coffee and sleep well for one night
The best place. Everything is perfect!!!Everyone is very kind!!!
Clean and comfortable. Staff are very nice.

üòä: Convenient location, quiet, friendly, ample parking, and a cafe/restaurant serving delicious breakfast. A great place to stay for travelers exploring Dong Van, Lung Cu, the local market, Lo Lo Chai, Meo Vat... ‚Ä¶

Many types of rooms, there are rooms for up to 10 people, there is 1 bathroom, but there is a shared bathroom so it's okay. Parking is quite comfortable. But the entrance is a bit small, big cars can get in but it's a bit difficult.

A few minutes' walk from the center, we had actually booked this stay to escape the honking. Unfortunately, there's karaoke and a dance performance here (probably every night) until late into the night (2 a.m.!). It's hard to sleep. At ‚Ç¨18 a night, however, it's relatively inexpensive. The room is small but otherwise good.

üòä: Nothing.

üò¢: The reception is handled by a 10-year-old girl, no explanations, no ‚Ä¶
You should stay here if you want to find a comfortable place to rest after a long day of driving :D There is even a massage service until 12am

A very bad experience with this establishment. The staff is aggressive and rude. The water was cut off without warning the customer. The customer took the checkout without giving change and acted as if nothing had happened. The price was high compared to the quality provided.
The hotel is beautifully designed, the staff are enthusiastic and friendly. However, there is a very noisy karaoke program until 11pm so it is impossible to sleep after a long day of driving.

üò¢: It was very kind of you to find me a bed even though I hadn't booked and it was a long weekend in Vietnam with lots of people.
These people were very helpful and assisted me in finding a taxi.
Thank you again. ‚Ä¶
Quite nice with private grounds. Dormitory and standard rooms to choose from. I heard there is a separate VIP area with 6 rooms, the price is very reasonable.

The restaurant serves delicious food; however, the shared rooms are only suitable for solo travelers sleeping in bunk beds and don't meet resort quality standards. It's located deep within the old town, but there is an electric shuttle service to the city center.

reviews.content:
Large, beautiful campus.
Rooms are quite spacious, clean, reasonable price
From the owner to the staff, everyone is extremely enthusiastic and hospitable üòò ‚Ä¶

Ancient architecture, delicious hotpot, beautiful space, romantic peach garden, impressive when coming to BB during Tet,
Au Tau massage cream is very good
Beautiful, clean location, reasonable price, suitable for family groups or backpackers... Clean rooms, delicious food (especially grilled food)... enthusiastic and funny owners üëç ‚Ä¶
Very clean and spacious, there is a kitchen, anyone who needs anything can contact to book in advance, reasonable price, comfortable stay

The hotel is 500m from the old town, a bit difficult to find, the road is uphill, but there is a parking area, large dining area, beautiful VIP rooms, large rooms, clean, fully equipped, there is food service inside but must be booked in advance.

Although at first it seems fine, they put me in a room where you have to turn off the light switch to turn off the light, so the fans don't work. They don't provide towels, soap, or anything like that, and after a long day, no one tells you there's going to be a party that night, and it's after midnight, and I can't sleep because of the noise.
Very nice, enthusiastic, good kitchen... except the bathroom has no exhaust fan, stairs are easy to fall on, railing is too low causing danger...
Location, beautiful view, reasonable price, enthusiastic staff, suitable for young people or backpackers to stay overnight
Ecological resort with steam river, massage, sleep... Traditional architecture combined with modern, quite beautiful, with campfire and floating stage for music...
The manager and staff are very enthusiastic and friendly, the rooms are beautiful and new, the food is delicious, free karaoke, the campus is large and airy. Reasonable price
Massage service is very good, there is a shuttle from the old town to the resort if you are not a guest at the resort
üòä: The homestay was peaceful because it was a little off the main road. The room was comfortable and the meals were very generous. ‚Ä¶
Nice resort - the entrance is a bit narrow. The day I stayed in Dom room, there was no 2-way air conditioning so it was a bit cold.
Homestay is very good, good service from food, transportation to rest and relaxation! Will make this a stop next time.
üòä: It was great to be able to park my motorcycle in a safe parking lot. It was clean and quiet, so I slept well. üò¢: None. ‚Ä¶
Spacious, airy space, friendly and cheerful staff, suitable for teamwork activities
good good good üòâ sauna massage fun comfortable cheap but high quality. Plus they pick up for free. ü§ó ‚Ä¶
The VIP room is cold and drafty. The spa area has a double room that is not very clean.
Remember to bathe in Dao leaf water, it's really cool and cheap. After a long day, come back and take a bath and you'll feel refreshed.

Clean accommodation, friendly staff but not really professional.
Acceptable if in this area
The first time the bed was a bit dirty. The second time was better. The massage therapists were very honest.

üòä: Everything's okay. Quiet location.

üò¢: Hardly any English spoken. Breakfast was rather meager. No atmosphere. ‚Ä¶
The best place to travel with pristine natural landscapes and many strange things
Friendly owner, full facilities, ok staff. Good view
Beautiful resort, worth coming to stay and experience the service
Beautiful scenery, very cheap price, unfortunately the way up is a bit difficult
Fresh air, mountain view, beautiful! What a great experience.
The location is very good, clean and airy. Only wifi is a bit poor.
It's quite nice, the room is clean and beautifully decorated.
Beautiful, comfortable, great winter red Dao bath
Clean accommodation. Enthusiastic hostess. Dao herbal bath is also available, very convenient.
Beautiful, view of high mountains in the distance with floating clouds is very OK
The owner was cheerful and enthusiastic, promising to see me again next time üëÑüíû ‚Ä¶
Clean guesthouse, friendly host, reasonable price, you can go up to
We had a wonderful night here.
Very good service, and I like that the staff is friendly...
The room was clean and nice. The space was beautiful, and the price was reasonable...
Good place to stay, but need more WC area
Spacious campus. Room is a bit old.
Had a wonderful experience on Nho Que river

üòä: Clean and friendly staff.

üò¢: A rather dreary and cold place. ‚Ä¶
Spacious, friendly, many amenities, reasonable price
A good resting place for backpackers
Has bunk beds like college days

The service has not received adequate attention.
