title: Huyen Tram Guesthouse
address: S·ªë 60 T·ªï 3, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
This place is truly awful. The town was quite busy when we arrived and so we took a room here for 3 nights. What a mistake. I had Room 206. It smelled of damp and even worse - of sewage. The bedding and towels were not very clean. There was no drinking water or toilet paper provided (very unusual in SE Asia). There was no air conditioner worked only occasionally. The fan didn‚Äôt work at all. The owners have 4 little boys that run around the halls screaming all day. And here‚Äôs the funny part. I gave them a bag of laundry to do and they lost my socks. I kept asking her if they‚Äôd been found. As we went to leave she asked for payment for the washing and I politely said I won‚Äôt pay if you‚Äôve lost my socks. We were prevented from leaving; she had padlocked our motorcycles! A forty-five minute stand-off then ensued and the lady from the laundry showed up. She had CCTV footage from inside her laundry on her phone and claimed no socks were in my bag. But she messed up. My socks were clearly visible on her cameras. They had no choice but to unlock the bikes and let us go with the laundry bill cancelled. But it took nearly an hour to get there.
Avoid this place at all costs!

Dirty blanket, a lot of trash on the balcony, dirty room, the leftover water from the previous customer is still in the glass. The staff was not ethusiastic. And the room is very noisy, we could hear clearly what the guest in the next room said, even the sound they peed. Terrible!!!

We stayed in a room with beautiful mountain views. The place was clean and quiet. we did the check-in earlier and had no problems at all. The only thing is the towel, they gave us some very small ones üòÇ but it was clean and smelling good.
***There's a delicious restaurant in front of the hotel on the other side of the street, cheap and really good!

Overall not a very clean place to stay. Initially we were taken to a room which was in poor condition. The room smelt strongly of sewerage and upon inspection the pillows and sheets had huge stains. We requested another room. The owner apologised greatly and was accomodating. He took us to another room, which was a little better but still had unclean facilities. Beds were very hard and didn‚Äôt get a wink of sleep. Whilst the owner gave us 50,000VND return, we still paid 850,000VND for the room.

Our stay at Huyen Tram Guesthouse began badly as when we arrived our rooms,booked through Booking.com were not available. We had altered our booking to arrive a day later than planned and received confirmation from Booking.com but ‚Ä¶

I booked through booking.com but when i arrived, the receptionist altered my booking with a really unacceptable excuse. I felt so unpleasant and angry about such a poor excuse but tried to accept.||||The place was VERY BASIC with few ‚Ä¶

Nice place to stay! The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is also quite cheap for the type of accomodation we had, very comfortable! The owner help us when we has trouble with our bike and everything ended well.

Very good guesthouse.
The staff is very very friendly and upgraded us in another room because the place was empty.
The view is truly amazing and location is great
The bathroom has a problem, the motel owner seems to be uncomfortable when repairing. It's cost 200,000 vnd / 1 room for 2 people vnd 1 night !
The place is good but why they're is like 100 peoples going up and down the stairs like elephants. Really too noisy

The room didn't look clean at all. We asked for a change of pillowcases because they were obviously dirty. Out of four pillows, they only changed two and left the dirty ones on the bed. The bathroom wasn't great either... it wasn't worth the money we paid.

I planned to stay for just one day, but I liked the Murphy Lang location and the accommodations, so I stayed for three days before heading to Cao Bang. It's run by a friendly couple: a teacher and a police officer. They also have cute, mischievous children. I forgot my wallet at the accommodation, but they contacted me ahead of time on the Cao Bang bus and sent it to my Cao Bang accommodation the next day, allowing me to complete my trip safely. I'll be back in Dongbang someday, and I definitely want to stay here.

I think I got the best room.
First of all, the view was amazing.
The room was spacious.
The hot water quickly became lukewarm.
The fluorescent lights in the room didn't work, but there were bathroom and night lights, so it wasn't a major inconvenience.
Overall, I'm satisfied with the price.

Superb guesthouse, clean and well located! There's hot water, and even air conditioning/heating. It's one of the few places in Vietnam where we found that!

The managers are very kind and helpful.

The mattress was a little hard, though.
Room with a view of the mountain and rice fields, magnificent! Small balcony. Avoid rooms without windows, it would be a shame. Scooter secured by the owner during the night.
Spacious, clean. About 100m walk to the old town. I chose a room overlooking the rice fields and hills. The scenery is very beautiful.
Hotel 300k Delicious, cheap, clean, nice view, 100m from the old town

The owner is very hospitable!!!
Reasonable price!!!
Clean and airy room - nice view!!!
Service style is ok, but room does not have refrigerator
The host is very hospitable, the room price is reasonable!
Clean. Lovely owner. Will come back next time in Dong Van.

title: Lam Tung Hotel
address: ƒê∆∞·ªùng Ph·ªë C·ªï, k√©o d√†i, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
The only good thing is the location.
You can hear all the noise from around, one of the room had no window and the bathroom tap wasn't working good.

We were put in this hotel by our tour of the Ha Giang Loop.  The first room the sheets were filthy. Stained everywhere.   This hotel is really gross.  We changed rooms to a tiny room. I actually cried that night. We were so tired that we ‚Ä¶

when I found I would be in Dong Van for a couple of nights I immediately returned to Lam Tung Hotel. First The welcome from Owner and the staff was brilliant and wonderful. There is nothing they will not do to help. Many folks available, ‚Ä¶

I have been here for many times  but only this time I have time to write this review! First I would say thank you very much for the welcome and hospitality, the owner and staff here super helpful they will help you everything if you need. ‚Ä¶

Hotel room was good.  Location was good.  Ok for 1 night doing Ha Giang Loop tour.   Bottle water provided and electric tea kettle but no tea or coffee provided.   Bed mattress very hard and not comfortable.   Bathroom shower water did not drain well and floor stayed wet after shower.

Check in was super easy. We were asked to show the permit. So please take note of that. One of the few places I stayed in Vietnam that gave some bottled water free.

Rooms were big and clean. Comfortable beds for a good rest. Everything works well so no complaint at all about that. We rented motorcycles and rode to this hotel from Ha Giang. They even covered our bikes during the night.

My room had a nice view of the mountain. So that was a plus. Staff was friendly and helpful. There are eateries just out the door Located off the main road. Please take note about that. But is easy to find.

A Walk to the main street in the morning to check out the morning market. Nice coffee places just across the Main Street.

Great Place to stat.

Got to this place because it was the one offered by the tour agency. ||Our room was in floor 6.  Room was normal size for Vietnamese standards, with enough light, clean and decent to have a rest.||It has bars in its windows that give the ‚Ä¶

Pros: hotel room is basic and simple, with nice, clean and comfortable beds.  That's important.  Location is convenient, good restaurants close by.||Cons: hotel is located on 2nd floor so we have to climb a flight of stairs.  Not an issue ‚Ä¶

Lam Tung is a good option for a night in Dong Van. The hotel is very central, next to the market and several restaurants. Our room was small and basic, but sufficient for a night. The bed was comfortable. Internet and TV didn't work. The ‚Ä¶

Stayed for 1 night. ||||Great location to explore Dong Van town. The Dong Van Sunday market is literally at the hotel's doorstep. The lively town square and the small hill the top of which contains an abandoned French fort with amazing ‚Ä¶

Best  hotel in Dong Van town.
Just stayed for 1 night. Lovely hotel, located right in ancient town so it's very convenient to walk around in night. Rooms are spacious, very clean and comfortable bed. The host is so helpful, always available to help. Thank you for a lovely stay. A greeting from Toannb!

Room was clean with comfy bed and air conditioning, location is close to the market and good food places. The hotel breakfast means they will take you to a local restaurant next doors where you can choose one of three options but it was nice.

Had the pleasure of staying here three weeks ago. Reception was very friendly and helpful, even if English was a bit difficult to communicate with. The room was spotless, well priced, and quite comfortable, including a water and a little Twinkie-like pastry. I highly recommend this place.

The hotel is very nice on the market and still very quiet! The rooms are well equipped with very comfortable beds! Everything is very clean and the staff helpful in all matters! Be sure to try the Black Chicken HotPot in the next restaurant up the street! Thank you for the nice stay!

Great hotel recommended by QT. For 300k it‚Äôs a comfy bed, shower and free cake upon arrival! Nice restaurant across the way, just order the Vietnamese food. Don‚Äôt order western and get disappointed when it‚Äôs ‚Äúnot like home‚Äù

Some things seems to be constant about the hotels in Ha Giang. Hard beds, dirty kettles and the occasional blackout.

When I asked if I could change my kettle to a clean one, the hapless staff realised that all their kettles were plagued with the same layer of unknown white muck. After which they suggested me to get my hot water from the lobby drink directly. The lobby was just a short walk from my room so I did just that a couple of times. During my stay in Dong Van, the power went out two times in quick succession. Both times, I heard some shouts in the lobby and the sound of a generator starting up, a good sign that at least the hotel is on top of blackout situations.

Even though they speak little English, the staff are always ready to smile and ready to help. The hotel is actually situated on top of a mini mart so you have to go up some stairs to reach the hotel lobby. Sharing shopfront space with a shop on the first floor, bike parking tends to get a bit squeezy at times. For snacks, just walk out to the main road and turn right to find some good BBQ street food!

My room is big and have a heat insulated bathroom, although it can get noise from any commotion in the lobby, a nearby ktv at night and a construction site in the morning. Okay, that is actually not as bad as it sounds XD

Hotels in the first place of the country but very clean, comfortable and modern. The bed is very quiet, the room is beautiful, the staff is very enthusiastic. Especial The location was terrific being central and right next to the market.

I'm not sure if I'm happy that there's a seven floor hotel right next to the traditional hilltribe market, but to be fair, the location is absolutely perfect and the rooms are good, too. 270k on the weekend for a spacious room with a view, friendly management

350k for a double room. It was clean, hot water running.
There was a lot of noise from the outside - karaoke at night and even early in the morning (~6am). Yeah and we could hear a dog whining every morning, a streetfood guy was slaughtering one every day.

This hotel was perfect!
Budget friendly, clean, neat, kind staff, great location. No complaints from me!
Highly recommend

Good location. Just next to the Sunday market. Clean room. Clean bathroom. Hot shower & constant pressure water. Free roof top access. Good reception.
Good hot√®l in the very small town!

Exellent value for money. Spacious rooms with soft mattresses. Stayed here during a cold spell and the aircon doubled as a room heater. Helpfull staff. Good internet. Clean. Near restaurants with good food.
Pleasant enough room of floor with 5 rooms. Noisy disrespectful customers of other rooms on our floor arriving back well after midnight, noisy and drunk. Otherwise hotel good
Lovely hotel. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Great restaurants just next door. Perfect place to rest up before exploring the incredible local scenery.

Very nice host with warm water, hair dryer and free water upon checkin.

They also have a restaurant called Ethnic house with dormitary and a bar (bar is not open yet)
Hotel named after the owners son. Very friendly owner and staff. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Very cheap for what you get! Highly recommended.
The weather is too cold but there is no hot water to have bath. When I raise this problem to receptionist, I have hot water in nearly 10 minutes. So bad!
Very nice place to stay in Dong van. Front desk staff speaks some English. Clean room.

Nice hotel, clean and comfortable
Nearby Sunday  markets
Close to old quarters nice to stay here
Good place in the small town, near the border of Viet Nam & China. New & morden furnure. Stable wifi.
Nice staff , no English, comfortable rooms , good location, well presented will stay again.
Great room at a great price. Very clean, all the necessities. Staff is very friendly.
Lam Tung Hotel was a fantastic find. Clean, comfortable rooms and friendly staff.
Conveniently located near the Dong Van market and the travel agency/restaurant Green Karst, clean, friendly, I would stay here again.
Simple setup done well. Best hotel in our trip to northern Vietnam.
Simple, budget friendly and in the middle of town. Basic but clean.
One of the best places to stay in Dong Van. Room is small but cozy.
Clean but small. Hot water sporadic, heater works great.
Lovely hotel. The owner and staff are very friendly and professional in service

In the heart of market. Well equiped and clean with reasonable price.
A very good hotel and cheap.

Good place to stay for a night

Staff who don't care about customers, charmless hotel, outside the old town
On the other hand, the room is clean and decently literary.

We felt like we were in a cell, with a nice bed, certainly, but still locked in. Thick bars on the inside of the window, which could only be opened slightly with considerable effort. A very unpleasant feeling of confinement. Needless to say, there was no view with such a tightly locked window. No breakfast. You have to go elsewhere. In short, a very bad experience.

A lovely little hotel. They offer single, double, and triple private rooms. The rooms are clean and air-conditioned, and some have a small balcony with views of the market and mountains. The bathrooms are clean and well-equipped (hairdryer, ‚Ä¶

We were disappointed by this hotel, especially considering the reviews. The reception was informal, and many things were malfunctioning: the kettle (we asked for it to be replaced), the window that didn't close completely (resulting in some ‚Ä¶

I planned a year-end trip to this region, which is not well-known in Japan, and stayed at this hotel in Dong Van for just one night. ||||It was cold and the area felt a bit lonely (sorry), so I was relieved by the hotel's cleanliness and ‚Ä¶

The hotel is clean, centrally located, yet quiet. The staff is very friendly and helpful. When we had problems with one of our scooters, we were immediately offered assistance. The restaurant below the hotel is also highly recommended, especially the hot tub.

A warm welcome, clean, free unlimited water, a simple but comfortable hotel, and very well located in relation to the Sunday market, which is not to be missed. | Two drawbacks: air conditioning is an extra charge, and breakfast is served in ‚Ä¶

My boyfriend and I were advised by the agency we booked our scooters with for the Ha Giang loop to stay at this hotel during our time in Dong Van. We received a warm welcome and the location was great (just steps from the market). We were ‚Ä¶

Very well located, right next to the market. It doesn't have a restaurant or breakfast service, but everything is on the same street (a restaurant is directly across the street, for example). The staff is professional and very friendly. We paid $18 USD for a comfortable double room with air conditioning and a fan, satellite TV, and a hot shower in a bathroom with a toilet, as is common in northern Vietnam. Very clean.
We stayed there during our moped tour. The staff was very helpful and took excellent care of our motorcycle's security. The room on the 7th floor was clean and spacious. Highly recommended.

The hotel was really great, the rooms were clean and well-equipped, and the bed was very comfortable. The price was very reasonable. We received a wonderful welcome; the manager even treated us after an unfortunate motorcycle accident. I highly recommend it!

We stayed at this hotel for one night. The room was spotless, comfortable, and clean. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful with all our questions, and offered to obtain our permit to visit the area, which we also got ourselves. The ‚Ä¶

This small hotel has only been open for three months, so all the furnishings are brand new. At least one person speaks good English. The rooms are rather small, which is an advantage in winter ‚Äì and because the windows are very well insulated, the room could be heated comfortably.

I can't imagine a better place in Dong Van to visit its Sunday market, don't miss it, and the surrounding area. |They were like family to us, always attentive and solving all our problems.|The rooms are new, soundproofed, and spotless. ‚Ä¶

A perfect little hotel to relax in after a day of riding. They look after your bike, there's air conditioning, and you have your own room for less than ‚Ç¨10. Breakfast isn't included, but there's a nice breakfast spot right outside. The owner is very friendly and speaks (good) English.

The hotel is small but clean and ideally located right next to Dong Van market, surrounded by many restaurants and eateries. Breakfast is served at a homestay 30 meters away in the old town. In the morning, you can stroll through Dong Van ‚Ä¶
Outdated hotel, cramped room, dilapidated bathroom, very meager breakfast

The room was ok, just a few steps to Dong Van old town. Great receptionist. But remember to remind them to turn on the hot water or you'll freeze to death! The receptionist was extremely friendly, carried luggage, and held the elevator door so no minus stars.

The hotel is new and beautiful. The rooms are clean, spacious, and I really like them. The owners are also lovely and very enthusiastic. Another great thing is that they have a convenience store in the basement, which is very convenient. I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I have the chance.

The room was very clean and well-equipped, the bed (king size!) was very comfortable, and it was literally steps from the main market. But above all, the staff were incredibly kind and provided very attentive service. Thank you for everything!

The hotel is very well located, right next to the market, so it's a bit noisy on Sunday mornings, but very picturesque. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is decent at the little restaurant next door. The staff are friendly.

Beautiful new hotel right on the market square. Rooms very clean and tidy, but also not very soundproof. Friendly staff. Market view from our room. Seating in the lobby. Elevator available. Close to the river.

The rooms were clean and spacious, and there was a supermarket right on the ground floor, which was very convenient. The owners were very kind and lovely. It was very close and convenient to get to the Old Town. We will definitely return to this hotel when we come back to Ha Giang!

Friendly staff, clean rooms, high-quality and modern amenities, reasonable prices, and a convenient location right next to Dong Van Market (one of the largest and most unique markets in the Northeast region - only open on Sundays). In short, I always stay here whenever I come up here.

Time has stood still in this region for 25 years | Luxury is nowhere to be found here | That is why the hotel is also a very good hotel in the town | Very friendly staff | The beds were great, everything clean and a nice shower | In the evening there is little to nothing to do in the town | Excellent for a few nights

The best hotel in Dong Van. || Friendly, enthusiastic, and professional staff. || Clean hotel, reasonable price. || Central location. 50m from the Old Town, 50m from the market. || Extremely convenient transportation. || I will definitely stay here for a long time.

The service was attentive, thoughtful, and enthusiastic. The rooms were clean, and the layout was very reasonable and meticulous. Here, you can feel right at home. I hope that anyone visiting Dong Van will stop by Lam Tung Hotel to experience the same feeling I did. Good luck!

This charming little hotel is conveniently located right in the center. The rooms are small but clean and have very airy windows. There's a supermarket on the ground floor for easy shopping (from the outside, it looks more like a ‚Ä¶
The attentive and friendly staff are the highlight and lovely. The hotel is clean and close to the center. I am satisfied with this location and will definitely come back next time.
Simple but functional room, bathroom and toilet combined, but okay. Good mattress on the bed. Friendly service. Ideal for a short stay. Quiet area. View from the room is a bit poor.

The hotel is well located, close to the market and restaurants. The staff were dedicated, attentive to our needs, and spoke sufficient English. The room was very clean and comfortable. Excellent value for money...very affordable.
I called to book a room but the hotel was full. Luckily the hotel receptionist was very enthusiastic in helping me find another place to stay. Thank you, I will definitely stay here next time.

350,000 dong per night. There is a refrigerator, very good hot water, a large kettle, a large bed, 4 bottles of water, 4 towels, no passport storage, there is an elevator, near the restaurant, but the wifi is very bad.

Centrally located hotel in this small town. Very well situated above the Sunday market. ||Cleanliness questionable ||Noisy ||No breakfast available ||No charm but functional. ||You have to sleep somewhere... ||Meh...

The hotel is located in the heart of the beautiful town of Wies, the rooms are fully equipped with TV, hot and cold water, private bathroom, clean bedding, prices suitable for all types of guests, the hotel owner is friendly and close to customers.
The hotel room is very nice, near the old town market, opposite there is also a very delicious Gree Karst restaurant. Reasonable price

The hotel is very well located, the staff are very welcoming and friendly, and the room on the fifth floor was very clean with a window overlooking the market. Breakfast is optional and can be enjoyed in the adjoining restaurant.
Excellent hotel, close to the incredible market (not to be missed on Sunday mornings). Very good value for money. At the reception, ask for Tiep. He speaks excellent English and is very professional.

In this small town in northern Vietnam, there are decent hotels at very reasonable prices. ||I wouldn't spend my holidays there, but it was a perfect stopover during a trip.||Clean and the breakfast was simple but adequate.

Room at Average level

title: Dong Van Panorama Homestay
address: Th√¥n X√≥m M·ªõi, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
Honestly not sure how this place has so many good reviews, the short version is you can find better accommodation for less in this area of Vietnam.

Pros: Appreciate the heating pad on the bed (since no ac or heating in room) and the bed itself was fairly comfortable. Good views over the valley and town albeit with trees blocking some of it.

Cons: The main critique we have of this place is the service. Couldn‚Äôt find someone to check in when we got there but even more so, the ‚Äúincluded‚Äù breakfast was probably the saddest we‚Äôve had traveling SEA. The coffee seemed like the dregs at the bottom of the pot that were scraped off and then had lukewarm water poured over them (not exaggerating), we left it and went into town for actual coffee. They didn‚Äôt have any sort of breakfast menu and just brought my husband some very sad ‚Äúcrepes‚Äù with white bread toast when he asked for breakfast. He managed to get me instant ramen noodles with one fried egg and greens by asking and pointing to others eating it.

This seems like a place riders in groups take their tourists, and it shows with them getting super drunk (one fell asleep and was snoring either his head on the table outside by 10:30 pm) and preferred treatment. My husband asked if he could get eggs in the morning like the ones the local guides were eating and they laughed in his face and walked away. The room was also incredibly NOT sound proof which mattered a lot because of the extremely loud karaoke (they seemed to cut people off at the actual hotel at 9:30 which was appreciated, but other places down the valley could easily be heard in the room until much later). The road in was pretty rough and broken up and if you didn‚Äôt have a scooter, there‚Äôs no way you‚Äôd be able to go into town. The front porch/sitting area by our room also seemed very unstable and swayed when walking across it.

All in all, not the worst place and feel bad for the lady who checked us in once we found her as she seemed a bit worn and overwhelmed. But again, can‚Äôt understand the reviews raving about this place unless we just happened to have a bad stay or the other reviews were asked for. Id recommend you go elsewhere if staying in the area during the Ha Giang loop.
Lovely homestay with panoramic views over the village.  Clean rooms and bathrooms with great service.

What an incredible accommodation with breathtaking views! The service was exceptional, and the owners went above and beyond to ensure the comfort of all guests. We stayed in a private room overlooking the mountains, and waking up to that view was truly wonderful. Despite the absence of heat in the room, the heated beds provided a cozy night's sleep. The highlight of our stay was the enjoyable karaoke session after dinner‚ÄîI simply didn't want the night to end. This is a memorable destination that I highly recommend to anyone traveling the loop.

We stayed in the panoramic room during our Ha Giang loop and it was amazing. The views are really good, the food was delicious and the host was very funny and kind. Loved our stay here, would definitely recommend!

A must stop on the loop. Me and a mate came through on our own and it was refreshing to be away from the sheer mass of tour groups. Like the name suggests the view is unreal, especially if the sun pops out for sunset. The owner is full of energy and help - sorting us with a trusted mechanic - and loves joining in for the karaoke post the delicious dinner. Beds and facilities were more than satisfactory. The happy water goes down mighty smooth here

Staying at Don Van Panorama Homestay was an absolute delight! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed by the warm and comfy beds that provided the perfect retreat after a day of exploration. The food served was not only delicious but also reflected the local flavors, leaving us craving for more. The hosts were incredibly kind and accommodating, always ensuring our needs were met with a smile. And oh, the view! Waking up to the stunning vista of the mountains enveloped in clouds and fog was simply magical. What‚Äôs even better is that all this came at a great price, making it an unbeatable value for the experience offered. Don Van Panorama Homestay truly exceeded our expectations in every way possible. We can‚Äôt wait to return!

After reading the review I had too high expectations unfortunately the room were really dirty (probably never cleaned) and there was no towels or anything. The view is great only if you are lucky and it is not misty‚Ä¶
My friend did not pay for her coffee and I got charge 2$ because I asked for milk.
Seems homestay are here for max profit now
Stayed during dragon tours ha giang loop. Super friendly team with one of the best locations! Most incredible view and really comfy beds!

The best view you can get in Dong van.
The host was so welcoming i had one of my best stay‚Äôs in Vietnam here!
Will recommend to everyone doing the loop to do the night here.

I‚Äôve really enjoyed my stay here! one of the best homestays! the atmosphere from the host and staff is impeccable and the beds are nice comfy and clean. couldn‚Äôt recommend here more! The view is also one not to miss!

The best place to stay in Dong Van. The owners are so accommodating and caring, the shared dinner was delicious and very fun with karaoke all together at night. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the views are spectacular.

Really panaromic the view! The owner, a good cook for the guests here whereas his wife also manages n cook at another homestay nearby ....And after cooking,the boss will join the guests for dinner enjoying the food and wine ...We had a good room which had a window facing the town and the other window facing a padi field..

Favourite homestay of the loop! Stunning views, great food and beautiful, welcoming hosts. I left my passport there and didn‚Äôt realise until i had traveled over 2 hours, they were able to get them back to me the next morning

Beautiful view overlooking the whole town of Dong Van, fresh nature, enjoy delicious mountain food, interact with Western guests from all over the world. The homestay owner is enthusiastic, cheerful and friendly.
Great stay with them! Great and plentiful meal, you will leave with great memories, the family is incredible, authentic, great evening with karaoke, you feel at home, don't hesitate!

The views and location were spectacular! I 100% recommend this place in Vietnam.
3 exceptional days in this homestay where Phuc and Mua were adorable, they showed us this magnificent region, the atmosphere is warm and the panorama is breathtaking

This homestay has a beautiful view of Dong Van. The host is friendly and the room is great.

reviews.content: Poor wifi, small room, expensive. Never come back again.

reviews.content: The hotel is very well located in a quiet street at walking distance to the very center of Dong Van. Good price and clean and comfy room. Plus the staff was very friendly and helpful

Small, private Hotel. Great location to walk around the City / Market / Ancient Town etc. but also very quiet, having had a room facing the Road, it was still very quiet during the night. The Host / Boss / Owners and Family are very accommodating, helping organise things like laundry and giving great suggestions as what to do. A place where one feels comfortable and wants to return

This is a very good hotel for that price. The management team was so pleasant and friendly persons. They don't speak English but it was very easy to communicate by Google translate.
We were cheering for Vietnamese national team together. Ahaha
About room. It was clean and has good sound protection from street noise.
Also there's a small parking for motorbikes. You can reach the city central square for 5 minutes of walking.
Good value for money, small and clean, friendly staff. Close enough to walk to town and right near the market that happens on Sunday.

We arrived the hotel was quiet- super clean- perfect big room- very happy!

Sadly there were either guests , staff or the family running the place yelling from about 10pm-1am. It was so loud I didn't sleep and i tried to contact owner.

In the am they did apologise and reduce room which was nice but a shame I had no sleep. The only other thing was the very very hard matress- maybe this was just my room though.

I would definitely stay here again as my events were likely a one off-the location was excellent and the room was great.

They also don't take visa as it states on booking.com. lucky I had cash.

This motel is 2 years old and run by the young owner Mr. Quang Trung himself. He was super helpful from the beginning till the end. Assisting in every way he could. The room is clean and comfortable. We even had our take out dinner on the balcony. Beautiful memories of 1 night in Dong Van and thank you for the tips enroute to meo vac.

Superb host, very friendly and helpful!
The hotel's location is great and quite, good price for very comfortable room with fan, AC, hot water, kettle and duvet!

This hotel has everything you need to spend one night during the Ha Giang Loop. Basic & clean. There is no breakfast though, but the main / busy square is just a few minutes walk with all the restaurants and cafes. Was great value for the price.  I would recommend it to anyone.

Great hotel for the area, and the front desk staff is incredible!!!
Guy moved my motorbike so that I could leave early the next morning. (There were 5 other Motos blocking my bike!!!)
He also wanted to tie up my bag on the moto so it was secure!
Young woman at the desk was helpful and also and got my laundry sent out & returned within the day. Doesn't get better than that!!!

Great place for a little stopover üëåüèº everything in our room was brand new and the room was super clean üëçüèº

The host is very kind, he gave us a lot of information, help us with the baggage and we even get an upgrade room for free.
I will definitely recommend it !

The motel Its located in the center of Dong Van town, the host is very friendly and the price for 1 bedroom with 2 beds is very reasonable, one of the cleanest motel in Dong Van, Highly recommended for all travelers. The host speaks English so there is no trouble with the booking and assisting check in

Great stopover on our Ha Giang Loop trip, however the only issue was the rooms heater was broken apparently. This made the room so cold and unfortunately this is not what you need after being on the cold roads all day.

Pleasant stay after a long day on the motorbike. Safe and comfortable accomodation. Dong Van seems to lack food options though - dog is on the menus in town which is not my cup of tea. I stared accusingly at the meat in my banh mi the next morning.

Horrible experience, even though the rooms seem decent at first glance for the price. The water in the room cut off during the shower, the toilet clogged, and the air conditioner broke. reviews.content: We visited this guesthouse but didn't stay there. It's so beautiful that I felt compelled to share my opinion. The guesthouse is magnificent, both inside and out. We spent a very special night at Sung Home. The cottage is adorable, maintaining its old-fashioned, traditional feel while still boasting everything. The bathroom is very comfortable and clean with hot water, a large bed, and plenty of cozy nooks.
Dinner at the cottage was delicious, and breakfast at one of the village's restaurants was very authentic. If you're doing the Ha Guang Loop, this is a must-see! The village is very pretty and preserves many traditional houses. We loved it! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Vieille Maison de Ma L√©
address: 8929+JH, M√° L√©, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: I‚Äôm traveling solo across Vietnam and stayed at Vieille Maison de Ma L√® during my Ha Giang motorbike loop. My experience was excellent, and I highly recommend this place. The homestay is surrounded by rice fields and mountains, offering stunning views. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and very comfortable. The entire building is unique and beautiful, full of character thanks to its history and traditional wooden architecture. The family is friendly, welcoming, and always helpful. Both dinner (a delicious vegetarian rice dish) and breakfast were abundant and tasty. Even the family dog is adorable, you just need to earn his trust little by little!

A truly authentic homestay experience in a 200-year-old traditional house of the Gi√°y ethnic people in Ma L√©, Ha Giang.
This place completely blew me away, the house has been beautifully preserved, and every detail, from the old wooden beams to the stone walls, carries a sense of time and care. The host has done an incredible job keeping the ancient charm alive while adding just the right amount of warmth, comfort, and modern convenience.

The owners are wonderful people. Mr. Thai is an excellent cook, every meal was delicious, beautifully presented, and made with heart. Ms. Kim is not only kind and charming, but she can also take you on small local adventures, from exploring village culture and gentle hikes through the forest and streams to more challenging treks up untouched mountain trails.

The homestay is also conveniently located, just a short distance from the Lung Cu Flag Tower: the northernmost point of Vietnam.

And there‚Äôs also Em ∆†i, their lovely dog, super smart, affectionate, and impossible to forget once you meet him.

Highly, highly recommended!
Incredible old house in a beautiful mountain village! The house is the original wood and clay. The staff is amazing and so are the views. I loved the dog!!!

Very good experience at this homestay. Staff is really friendly and able to cook nice dishes. Not every day that you can sleep in a 250 years old home. Off the main road so great place to observe local life

We absolutely loved our stay at Vieille maison de male. We were passing by and liked the feel of the village so we decided to stay for 1 night, which turned into 2 then 3 then 4 nights! Our host, Kim and Thai were such wonderful people. We felt like part of their family , we came as strangers and left as friends. We love this place so much, it‚Äôs like stepping back in time and in to a fairytale and it‚Äôs really authentically Vietnam. We will definitely be back. Thank you so much to all at Vieille maison de male for making our stay unforgettable.

Thank you so much.
I've finally seen some of the real Vietnam. üòÉ Thank you for helping me so much, for letting me stay in your beautiful house, for Thai's wonderful food & for all the fun & great hikes we've done together. It's been a lovely few days. Highly recommended.

This ancient 250 year old building is truly amazing and the hosts were super nice too. My experience was not so great though, the rooms are not super well isolated and I was cold during the night, even with the heater on. The bed is also super hard, making it difficult to sleep.

Lovely hosts
Facilities require improvement
Price isn‚Äôt justified
It was a great experience. The house is beautiful and the host was friendly and helpful. The village is really peaceful. I had many precious moments with kids around here.
This is a beautiful place to visit,the food is so tasty and the owner‚Äôs lovely highly recommend !

My Korean husband and I set out on a trek from downtown Dong Van to enjoy the natural scenery and cultural experiences along the Dong Van perimeter trail. We wanted to relax at a cafe with a great view and a comfortable atmosphere. That place was Em Oi Cafe. We rested here for about two hours. The view was beautiful, the atmosphere was pleasant, and the owner was so friendly and welcoming. I'd love to visit again!

This is a truly beautiful cafe that I stumbled upon while trekking with my partner.

Once you step inside, the magnificent and majestic nature unfolds before your eyes.

The interior is also impressive. I was surprised to find such a sophisticated and sophisticated cafe in such a rural area.

I enjoyed chatting with the humble and elegant owner. The salted coffee was also delicious.

If you're traveling with a partner, this is a must-visit. I highly recommend it.
Suitable for chilling guys. Every time I come, I have interesting stories to tell.

title: Laco Homestay
address: Th√¥n L√†i C√≤, TT ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, Huy·ªán ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, 310000, Vietnam

reviews.content:
It was a very great stay! We were welcomed by the family and they immediately invited us to eat dinner with them!! We booked two single rooms because nothing else was available, but they asked us if we wanted a double room and made everything ready really quickly. They also only charged us for the double room.
Breakfast was really good, they made us a warm breakfast even though we were the only ones having breakfast!
We recommend this Homestay and would come back any time!!! 10/10

Lovely, kind family. Peaceful surroundings, clean accommodation. The beds are in one large room separated by curtains, the space is clean and compact but has everything you need. The layout makes it easy to meet others and we even enjoyed family dinner with them. The dinner was tasty and big portions. The road was a bit precarious if you‚Äôre not confident due to a landslide a few months ago, but we heard there is another road that Google does not take you on - so maybe contact the hosts for directions to avoid this difficult road. :)

Favourite homestay do far! Favourite hosts especially! Great unique food each day, out of the way peaceful spot, great views.
Only thing to worry about is the road to get there can be quite muddy, especially in wetter weather which could be a bit difficult if not confident riding.

The family hosting us were lovely! The view to the mountains was so dreamy, we really enjoyed our meals, big portions and so delicious. Also they grow their own mushrooms (how cool is that?). It was also our first time sleeping in a hard mattress and it was surprisingly comfortable for us. We were doing the Ha giang loop and this was the best homestay we stayed on thank you for the stay and the hammocks!!
Nice experience! Very friendly hosts, fresh cocked dinner, clean an cozy room and bathroom. We recommend this homestay in a quiet area besides the crazy traffic of the Ha Giang Loop!
I enjoyed my stay here, it's quiet and a few ks out of town. The family is very lovely and the food was good. Great view on the Chinese border/hills.

This Homestay is a real gem! We had the best time staying here when we did the Ha Qiang loop just the two of us. The service is amazing, the family is so friendly and the views are great. The place is also very comfortable. Would highly recommend it if you want to stay in a peaceful place away from all the tour groups!
Super charming and quiet place. Owner is really friendly and eager to share. Cooking is delicious. Highly recommended if you want something authentic and closer to nature.

We ventured out to the Laco Homestay in the hopes of getting away for the tour groups, and boy were we not disappointed. The family here is so nice and welcoming. We had the whole place to ourselves, and the family cooked for us for dinner and for breakfast, super yummy food sourced from their own farms! A real diamond in the rough, especially if you're a self-rider
This is an authentic homestay !!! Far from noisy eazy rider groups, real traditional food of Vietnamese people, a heartwarming welcome by the hosts, we litteraly live at their home as real guests‚Ä¶

We have stayed here for one night as we are doing the self driven Ha Giang Loop.
We were looking for some place calm, trying to avoid the big groups, and we were very lucky to find this family and their 6 months new homestay. We were the only guests that night, and we really liked that. The bedroom is separated by curtain as you sleep in the same area as the family.
We were also provided a fan and a mosquitoes net.
Homemade food was delicious, and we paid 500 000 for dinner + breakfast + bed for 2. The area is very quiet with a beautiful view on the mountains, and the family has 2 dogs, cat, and chickens on the property. The evening ended with a small karaoke (they have professional equipment), which was a lot of fun.
The only negative I need to mention is the mattress, which was very hard. It is a personal preference, i guess. My partner was ok with it, but for me, it was too hard. That's the only reason that I can't give it 5*

I had a wonderful experience staying at this homestay. The room was clean, airy, and fully equipped with everything I needed. The host was incredibly friendly and helpful, always ready to assist whenever needed. The location is very convenient, close to the city center and popular attractions. The price is reasonable, perfect for both solo travelers and groups. I would definitely come back if I have the chance! üíØüíØüòç

Authentic homestay in a newly-built traditional wooden stilt house. The very kind hosts speak little English but are very keen on exchanging by translation app to share moments of everyday life and to help with anything. Beautiful views, quiet and isolated area, no shops/restaurants around, transport needed.

What a hidden gem! A genuine homestay experience where you stay with the family. Everything is very clean and the house is beutiful. Owners were also very kind.

100% would recommend for anyone looking to eacape the city and stay in an authentic homestay.
Very nice owner and funny kid. Food was also very delicious :)

It's a quiet inn with a view of the Chinese border right in front of you. The family was friendly and helpful. I walked around the area and met several villagers, who all greeted me with smiles, which made me very happy. Both dinner and breakfast were homemade by the wife and were delicious. The rooms and bathrooms were clean.

We received a warm welcome and were invited to have dinner with the family. The food was delicious and was followed by a few rounds of Happy Water. The dormitory and toilets were very clean and tidy. Thanks to its secluded location near the border, we had a beautiful view of the scenery in the morning.
Fantastic stay! Breathtaking views of the mountains and the Chinese border! Very warm welcome! Be aware that the road to get there is a bit tricky, so just pay attention :)

We received a very warm welcome from the whole family. We were able to have dinner with them. There was a wide selection, and everything was delicious. The beds and bathroom were clean and very modern. Overall, we were all very satisfied.
The host was really friendly and treated me like family. This is a great homestay. I highly recommend it.

title: Ancient Town 29 Ph·ªë C·ªï
address: S·ªë 29 t·ªï 3, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: Location,location, location! It‚Äôs very well located in a square that has nightly entertainment. Bed was clean and comfortable. Bathroom wasn‚Äôt the best. It was value for money - because it was cheap as chips‚Ä¶.
The young guy was awesome. He took his time to explain a few things about the cool spots to ride a motorcycle. Clean rooms, excellent location.

Good place to rest your head, a little run down but always felt secure and the room was comfortable enough.

Stayed in a private room in off-season so can't speak for other rooms or times of the year.

Shower and toilet combined which is very common but not something I like. Location fantastic.

Very nice quiet accommodation. Shower was hot, ac and fan in the room. If you book a twin double room then you get a room with a window, the other rooms didn‚Äôt have windows.
Oh and downstairs they have a very busy hot pot restaurant that seemed very popular.

Not cheap, not clean. Dusty. Smelly. The water in the shower can easily burn you in seconds, take care.
Very very noisy, you can hear everything. The family living here was screaming at about 5.30am and again at about 6.30 am. They woke everyone up. Insane.
The rooms are not dark in the night as the light from the corridor makes the room bright.
Bed linen feel very bad on the skin and so the bed is uncomfortable. We did not get much sleep.
Free water bottles.

Located right at the central of Old Town, tho the Oldtown is pretty small so it cant go anywhere wrong. A private room is quite small. For 1 night stay its ok with its price, you want to hang outside anyway!. Overall is quite noisy since they have a restaurant as well as the loud music from oudside.

I spent one night here while doing the loop.  Hands down one of the best hostels in 3 months.  I was looking for quiet, comfortable, and convenient.  This place delivered!  The blankets were the nicest I‚Äôve ever had in any hostel anywhere.  Loved the lighting too.  Definitely stay here if you‚Äôre looking for a good place to stay.  Price is definitely for budget travelers.

The hotel is located in the centre of Dong Van, easy to go. The room was so clean and comfortable.
The owners and their sun was super kind, friendly and helpful. They helped me a lot when I had an accident. They brought me to their sister who is a nurse to wash my injury and gave me medicine, I was extremely emotional about that.
Nice hotel, nice people. Highly recommend!

At first thought we thought this would be a comfortable sleep as we were doing the Ha Giang Loop and needed to wake up at 5AM in the morning. But we thought wrong, as there was also a whole school of kids staying in this hotel. That is all fine, but they kept on screaming and running for hours and hours until late in the evening while not the teacher said anything nor the staff. Not recommended as we barely slept.

We stayed a night and it was really good. Rooms comfortable and clean, hot water in shower, friendly and polite owners, everything OK and reasonable prices. Only some private rooms are without a window. Hotel just in the city centre!

This place is perfectly. Located right in the center square surrounded by cafes, eateries, and souvenir shops. They don't speak much english but it wasn't an issue. The water gets very hot and the pressure is very strong, which was great! Clean place and just overall a good location.
Clean room. Helpful and kind staff. Hot water for limited time. Room a bit small but overall enjoyed the stay here. Convenient as restaurants and cafes are all walking distance.

I stayed at dorm for one night, very friendly staff and in the center, you just wake up and get outside to see beautiful acient town. The bathroom and toilet is quite clean and new
But the smell in the room is not good.

Nice quiet and clean rooms, helpfull stuff (altough a little language problems, which of course can be solved with translator), located in the very centre next to the old town. Indoor parking for bikes. Definetely can recommend.

Nice people, the room was clean and big, the owner very helpful too, if you want a night in the ancient town then you have a good place here. Next door is a very good breakfast place run by an old woman, you should have a try too.
The room is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful.
Excellent mattress, very clean, good location.
Good place to stay and nice host.
best service! we will come back.
Clean room with a comfortable bed. There are plenty of bars and restaurants on the street, but the room was still very quiet. Definitely recommended.

I went on a seven-day, one-week motorbike trip to Ha Giang. I stayed in a shared dormitory here for three days, and I visited the Northernmost Point of Vietnam, exploring every nook and cranny. Dormitory and Individual Rules
Room ok, doesn't seem to have 2-way air conditioning, I went in the cold season, has private motorbike parking, best location.

Although we had booked a room with a view, they gave us one without a window, even though the hotel was practically empty. But apart from that, the room was fine for one night. And they even stored our motorbike in a garage.

It's located in the center of town, making it easy to find meals.
The room has air conditioning, heating, and a hot water shower, but it's so cold outside that it doesn't warm the entire room. If you use too much hot water, it stops working, so be careful not to use too much.
The futons and mattresses were clean and comfortable.
The room is clean, the owner and staff are very kind, friendly and enthusiastic. Please note to book a room and contact the owner directly to avoid being overcharged!
The landlord needs to fix the door lock of the room he booked for 2 rooms but both locks are broken.

Clean and conveniently located in the heart of the Old Town, guests can easily travel anywhere. The rooms are fully equipped with amenities, free Wi-Fi, and friendly staff. There are many rooms to choose from, and a beautiful space where guests can sit and enjoy coffee while relaxing in the Old Town at night.

Old town frontage, friendly owner, many restaurants and cafes around, opposite Dong Van square in the old town, room is quite ok, 300k/night, view overlooking a high mountain, can go up this mountain to watch the sunrise or sunset, however the road up that mountain is quite difficult and dangerous.

The hotel is clean, the price is reasonable. Located right in the center of the old town, from here you can walk around the old town very conveniently. The hotel has a balcony for guests to see the whole old town. The experience here is great. Next time I come here, I will definitely come back here.
The room is relatively clean but small. Not reasonable for the price compared to rooms in Meo Vac area.
Room doesn't have hair dryer. Hot water is quite little, runs out after a while, takes a long time to boil.
The hotel is located right in the center of Dong Van ancient town. Room rates are reasonable, rooms are clean, and fully meet the needs of backpackers.
Small room, clean, strong hot water. Family style service. Located in the middle of the old town
Located right in the center of the old town, airy and clean room, friendly owner
Clean and comfortable guesthouse, located right in the center of the Old Quarter, will come back here :)
Ideal location near famous restaurants and cafes of Dong Van town
The accommodation is right in the old town so it's easy to choose suitable places to eat.
Fully equipped, friendly staff, located right in the heart of Dong Van Old Town. Will recommend to everyone.

Okay, so-so.
Next to the hotel on the right, there's a very delicious multicolored sticky rice stall.
A small old town but beautiful and quiet, especially at night.
No complaints. Friendly and helpful host.
Great location for anyone who wants to explore Dong Van ancient town
Location right in the center of the old town. Room quality is quite good.
Beautiful, worth going, but just one night is enough

Well located in Dong Van
Beware of poor bedding.

Right in the old town very convenient
Everything is fine
Right in the center, clean, reasonable price
Great location, really cheap and clean dormitory

reviews.user_name: BSNT. D∆∞∆°ng Mai - Khoa Ph·∫´u Thu·∫≠t Nhi

reviews.content: Lively location. Convenient to get around.
Very decent room for the price
It's just livable. It's worth the price.

title: Ho√†ng B√°ch Homestay
address: t·ªï 7, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn District, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: Long C·ªï Tr·∫•n - Homestay & Tea
address: L√¥ L√¥ Ch·∫£i, L≈©ng C√∫, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang 310000, Vietnam

reviews.content: The food was really good and i have enjoyed. They help you if you want something more or else. I really advice people to eat here

We had an amazing experience ü•∞
We spent a holiday night at Long Co Tran and were totally impressed by the vibe and the hospitality of the house keepers. Although we booked close to the hour, we were still well welcomed.
The meal was quite good, it tastes like home üòã
Absolutely delicious meal. We enjoyed the spring rolls so much that we were brought more.
Had a beautiful lunch in a nice quiet spot, owner was super friendly. Can walk up the mountain next door and see into China!

I was lucky enough to spend several days in Long Co Tran. Many travelers only stayed for a few hours while doing the motorbike loop, and left feeling nostalgic. I shared lunch with the staff, exchanging words in different languages and stories about the ups and downs of our countries. I‚Äôm left with a beautiful version of Vietnam after my time in this lovely village.
Gorgeous views while having a delicious lunch! The homemade buns were lovely.

I stayed at Sister's House for quite a few days during my Vietnam trip and I had a great time there! ||The staff was very welcoming and kind. Their English level is great and they were always very helpful to me and other guests.||I ‚Ä¶

What an amazing place to stay, the views (and especially the sunset) were incredible!  The couple who runs the place are so lovely and welcoming, and the dinner they cooked us was some of the best food we've had in Vietnam. Lots of nice seating to chill out, nice bedroom  and good shower, one of my favourite stays for sure!

Comfortable lighting and thoughtful decorations within the common spaces inside the homestay.  The couches, pool table, and stereo system lend to a fun atmosphere during the early evening after returning from viewing the sunset from Lung Cu flag point.  The hotpot dinner really hit the spot.  Lean beef, pork belly, chicken, green vegetables and pumpkin.  Yummy!  The hosts were friendly and accommodating.  The bed and bathroom/shower space was clean and comfortable.  The surrounding area is quiet and peaceful.  I hear nothing but crickets as I write this review.

We were the only guests that day, so it is a bit difficult to judge. In comparison to other home stays on the loop, we just had the impression as we were the only ones, they were not so keen to make a lot of conversation. The food was good, though there were not so many different dishes. It was also not as clean as we found it elsewhere. For example there was quite some dust in the rooms which could have easily been swept. The surroundings are lovely with great views and to be fair, it could all really be related to the fact that we were the only guests... Breakfast was good.

Fantastic stay surrounded by amazing scenery. The peace and quiet you're surrounded with really gives you a chance to get a glimpse of the village everyday life and makes you appreciate the views (especially the sunset!) even more.
The hosts were lovely, very welcoming and helpful, and the food was  delicious. The rooms were cosy and clean, the overall atmosphere was just great, definitely recommend!

We stayed here during our Ha Giang Jeep tour. Mary and the staff were so helpful and nice and really tried to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We also liked dinner in the evening. Thanks a lot.

one of our favorite stops on the loop! the sunset view was fantastic and the surroundings are peaceful. the staff was very friendly and provided a mosquito net for us. The dinner could have included one or two more veggie options.

Located in a Lo Lo Chai Village, a little out of our way but definitely worth the detour.||Very friendly people & nice dogs (Coca & Strawberry).||Amazing food.||We took the dormitory beds, super confortable with big soft blankets! ||A ‚Ä¶

Delightful homestay tucked away at the back of Lo Lo Chai Village. Great service and friendly owners. I stayed in the private double room which was tastefully decorated and came with a private ensuite. The bathroom was a bit odd - astroturf flooring with rocks on top but I guess it‚Äôa rustic?

My favourite place in Vietnam! Genuinely.

From the calm vibes, brilliant hosts (who speak English), to beautiful views and great food!

Was a perfect way to spend my birthday!

Thank you Chung and Thu

Sisters has two shared bathrooms for the whole property and it‚Äôs filthy. Trickle water for shower, sink is stopped up, flor is grimy with who knows what.  No mosquito netting, and it‚Äôs an open air property, meaning no windows.  Beds are not ‚Ä¶
We had very good time in Sister's house. We join them for local dinner, room was nice and very comfortable mattresses. There in nothing you can complain about the place at all.
Lovely food and lovely people, thankyou!

After a long days riding the loop ,I detoured to see lung cu monument and came across this little gem ,great views including the monument, I arrived late in the day ,good priced room..a bed ,power sockets, toilet and shower everything you need to recharge,
The lady then cooked me up a 2 local meat dishes with rice ,served cold drinks also  didn't charge too much ,I would recommend here
Very good host in new homestay on hill top just outside the village. The evening dinner was very  tasty and views from the hammock over to China with sunset are lovely
It was a very calm and nice place. The couple that runs the homestay are also very nice and easy going. They just opened some weeks ago so everything was clean and new.
I had an awesome stay here tonight with some friends. It‚Äôs a great place to have a good sleep, great food (I mean the dinner) and enjoy the friendly staff. I thank you for your great hospitality.
Amazing homestay with a great owner who made sure we were all well looked after. The food was the best I‚Äôve eaten at a homestay and I would definitely recommend this homestay to others!
Beautiful people, a stunning view in a magical place near the Lung Cu flag point. Clean rooms, perfect for the ha giang loop üëåüèª ‚Ä¶

The best homestay at Lung Cu! I and my family were so enjoyed it!
thanks Trung and Thu for everything!
What an amazing place to stay. Owners are awesome. Highly recommend to any traveler wanting more that a hotel room.100%
Best place to stay in Lung Cu! Super nice stuff, great food, good beds, hot shower :)
Was a nice place to stay. Good food, good drink and he good speak English. Highlight to recommendation this place

If someone walks in the house it‚Äôs super loud.
Beds are ok, bathrooms could be cleaner
They have a fire for cold nights, and cozy blankets.
welcome to Lung cu and extreme the north of üáªüá≥ ‚Ä¶

We visited for lunch during our Ha Giang Loop tour. They served delicious Vietnamese home-cooked meals that even our Western friends found enjoyable. What was a bit unusual was that, perhaps because it's located right on the Chinese border, the dishes served were similar to Chinese food. Our Western friends enjoyed the flower buns so much that they kept asking for refills. The owner, seeing our guests enjoying their meal, was pleased and offered us more.
The homeowner knew the water heater was broken but didn't tell the guest anything. It was 10 degrees outside and had to take a cold shower.

I booked a dormitory room through Booking.com and stayed there for one night on April 29, 2025. The advance reservation fee was 131,000 VND, but upon check-in, I was asked to pay an additional 250,000 VND because the hotel is located at the border with China. In the end, I paid 381,000 VND. Perhaps because of this, my room was automatically changed from a dormitory to a private room. Dinner was an additional 80,000 VND. At night, there were rats running around on the ceiling above my room, making a lot of noise. In the middle of the night, I could often hear the voices of the family and children living there. I don't know if this was just one night or if it's like this every night, but they seem to be sleeping and waking up on the same floor as my guest room.

The food is delicious and the owners are very friendly! Perfect location.
I recommend it.
A very cozy place, you can see China while you eat, and you have very beautiful mountain views.

Amazing meal!
And the little banh bao were delicious üòãüòãüòã
The staff was incredibly attentive.

Excellent homestay
Very welcoming
Vietnamese fondue for dinner

The Banh Bao are incredible!
Very good, cam on

The hostel is located approximately 800 meters from the Lung Cu Flag Tower. Upon arrival, I received a very friendly welcome from Ngoc. Around 6:30 p.m., we had a communal dinner (a family dinner with very tasty home-style cooking). All in ‚Ä¶

We arrived here after a long day of motorcycling on a recommendation, but unfortunately, it was fully booked when we got there. Even so, they helped us find another homestay in the same town. Even after our trip, we contacted them to help ‚Ä¶

We came here at the end of January to stay there during our motorbike tour around Ha Giang province, and our stay was disastrous.
Let me explain:
- We arrived in the late afternoon, and the main room was dirty, very, very dirty. I'd never seen anything so dirty.
- We weren't invited to dinner. We were the only two foreigners, and it was noticeable. Once night fell, no one came to see us to ask if we needed anything.
- Before going to sleep, we tried to shower, but the showers/toilets were also very dirty. Furthermore, there was no hot water after 3 minutes in the middle of winter.
- While sleeping, we had to mention the rats running around (it wasn't our imagination; we saw them) and the accommodation was so poorly insulated that it must have been 0 degrees Celsius in the room in the middle of winter. No heating. - The next day, for breakfast, I found plastic in my instant noodle soup...

However, I would like to acknowledge the kindness of the man who welcomed us and compensated us for the cut at breakfast. However, apologies aren't everything.

A very welcoming place, we received a warm welcome, the food was excellent, and Lolo Village is a must-see on your itinerary. | If you visit Northern Vietnam, I definitely recommend spending a few days here. Thank you so much, Sister's Homestay, for your hospitality.

If you visit the Lung Cu flagpole, stop by for a cup of corn wine, then drink a few more cups of tea at night, and then go to the Cuc Bac cafe to drink coffee in the morning, it's a truly wonderful experience.
The owner is enthusiastic and friendly. The accommodation is good, hot water is always available. The food is okay. If you come in the summer or fall, you can enjoy many other types of tea.

It's a relaxing place with delicious food and a welcoming host!
The hot showers are also great, so I'd definitely come back.
I've been to many places, but this is the first one where I found the food truly delicious, the hosts were enthusiastic and friendly, and the restrooms were clean and well-equipped.
If you want to get diarrhea, come eat at this place. Complete lack of hygiene, filthy place.
Rooms with authenticity. Comfortable bedding. Near China.
delicious rice, tea and the restaurant is very delicately decorated by the Lo Lo owner. <3
Friendly host, delicious food, quiet, ideal location
Beautiful homestay, hospitable and enthusiastic people. Delicious food
The owner is very happy and enthusiastic, the view of the house is really beautiful. It is worth the experience.
View of the mountains and valley. Pickup truck access.
The host is friendly, funny and handsome. The view is amazing. ^_*

The homestay owner is friendly and enthusiastic
You should come ‚ô•Ô∏è

The owner is young, very enthusiastic & friendly! 
The facilities are good.
Friendly host, quiet, suitable for watching sunset, great
Homestay: Stay and eat with the host. Very friendly
Great! Support the host very enthusiastic and hospitable
A place that reminds me of my country home. Thanks to the kind staff and friendly neighborhood kids, I had a great time.
Very nice. Will come back many times.
A beautiful place to relax! I highly recommend it!

title: Kh√°ch S·∫°n Ki√™n Th·∫£o
address: QL4E, t·ªï 8, Y√™n Minh, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
Low experience (2/5 star)
- Receptionist (a girl) is not friendly and seem to be angry anytime. Not a good attitude/ manner.
- TV is out of service
- Hot water available but 50/50, up to your luck.
- A/C not working
- Not comfortable bed (harden)
You better make a good consideration, I recommend to make this hotel as B or C plan for your trip.
Hope that owner can improve these circumstances.

Stayed for one night only as a rest stop. For a Two Star Hotel there are toiletries, hot shower and water bottles available in the room. I just found the bed so hard that it wasn't a comfortable sleep. There are restaurants nearby.

Walked in and got room 302 for 350,000 VND. They don‚Äôt set the water boiler in room but I can borrow from the Reception. I had to place the garbage box on the tea table to use the boiler as the socket is too high. There are 2 sockets at the ‚Ä¶

Stopped here for 1 night during the Ha Giang loop (solo). Very good Hotel at a faire price. Big room with all you need (AC, fan, hot shower, towels,...). Only negative for me is that the mattress is as soft as a plank but that's how  Vietnamese like it üôÇ.

It is difficult to put into words quite how execrable this hotel and it is perhaps for this reason that no one has previously attempted to do so on tripadvisor. I wish that they had, as it may have saved me a visit to the pit latrine of ‚Ä¶

The room was very unclean. There were gnats and bugs all over our ceiling and room. We had condoms in the nightstand next to the bed. The bed was very, very, VERY hard which I understan is normal in Vietnam. This one was extremely hard. We asked for another blanket so we could put it down and sleep on it. When it arrived there were fleas all over it. Very gross. We were put on the 5th floor and in the middle of the night someone tried to come into our room. Not sure if it was an accident or what but our door was definitely rattled. Very noisy hotel as well. Stains all over the walls. Would not stay here again, nor would I advise anyone to stay here.

In addition, after I left, I noticed my wallet was no longer in my possession. Being that we were doing the Ha Giang Loop, I did not notice until about 60 km's down the road. We called the hotel and said they would have the wallet sent to our hostel in Ha Giang. 2 days later the wallet was never delivered and the hotel gave a "wrong number" for the bus that they sent the wallet on. I would never trust this place again.
Great value for amenities. Wonderful owners. I was injured from motorbike accident and they helped me very much.
Business is boring, deposit room then cancel customer's room ???

-The price-performance ratio is poor.

-There were small insects everywhere in the room.

-The bathroom smelled very musty after showering.

-There was some mold.

-The bed was as hard as the floor.
Last April 30th holiday, I had a trip here with my family and had the opportunity to stay at this hotel. Good service, nice rooms, reasonable price.
is a newly built hotel in Yen Minh, with a system of high-class standard rooms. The rooms are clean, beautiful, fully equipped, but the price is reasonable like other hotels in the area. Very good
The hotel has fully equipped modern and comfortable rooms, reasonable prices and good service attitude of the staff. This will be a long-term and reliable place for everyone to stay.
Spacious, clean room. The hotel has many rooms that can accommodate large groups. Reasonable price. Opposite there is a super delicious horse hotpot restaurant.

It's clean and very nice. I stayed here for two days, one day each when I went there and came back, while traveling with a companion. They asked for 600k per day for two twin rooms, but I negotiated it down to 500k and rested. It's quiet and the water is warm. I recommend it. It's not noisy at all, probably because it's in a quiet rural area along the road. It's cheaper to pay on site than to make a reservation. However, there is no breakfast.

A very reasonable stop on the way to Dong Van. There are many restaurants around. Especially Pho Len Luan restaurant has fresh pho noodles made on the spot and a delicious mixed chicken and beef dish.
The hotel has a very beautiful location, always prioritizes customer service as number 1, everyone who travels should go to Kien Thao hotel in Yen Minh district.

I stayed with officials from the Ha Giang Province Labor Department on a business trip, and it was the worst budget hotel I've ever stayed in in Vietnam. The room was filthy, the bedding was full of holes, and the toilet and sink were plastic‚Äîa place where you could only sleep.
Newly built hotel, nice rooms, affordable price, too good for one of the difficult districts of Ha Giang
Clean hotel, reasonable price, enthusiastic and friendly hotel owner. Next time I come to HG, I will come back to stay at this hotel.
Good view, wake up early to see the children having breakfast and walking very far to school.
Clean, spacious hotel, reasonable price, weekdays 400k/3-bed room, that's ok
Cool, clean, enthusiastic, civilized and polite staff is a destination worth paying attention to and sharing widely.

Very tidy and clean.

- Reception staff lack enthusiasm
- No English skills
- No refrigerator in the room
- Limited beverages in the hotel
Water, Coke Diet, Coke Zero, etc. would be good.
If the hotel has 2-way air conditioning, it will be much better during the cold season.
Newly built hotel, spacious rooms, clean, very good price
Reasonably priced and clean, the area has nowhere to walk at night
Reasonable price, attentive and friendly service
Clean. Beautiful scenery. Preparing to install MBsolar solar power
The room was clean and spacious. The rent was reasonable.
Ksan is new, clean, and located at the beginning of Yen Minh district. It's a quiet place to stay.
The hotel is clean, friendly and enthusiastic.
The newest hotel in Yen Minh at the moment!
Rest stop on the way to Ha Giang

reviews.user_name: Cherry On The World - Travel blog

title: Sa M·ªôc Home
address: S√°n Tr·ªì, H√† Giang, 20508, Vietnam

reviews.content: The home is new so the rooms are clean and the owner is enthusiastic. I like to stay in quiet places like this, not crowded like Dong Van town.

I stumbled upon this place by chance and am thrilled (despite the winter cold): so peaceful and secluded, a great house made of wood and clay, I got a super fresh and delicious dinner, and the electric blanket in bed makes it very comfortable!
Small house hidden behind rows of cypress trees

title: PaVi Lodge
address: ƒê∆∞·ªùng H·∫°nh Ph√∫c, P·∫£ Vi, M√®o V·∫°c, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: Amazing stay! Perfect location with stunning mountain views, easy access, and cozy, clean bungalows with full amenities. Highly recommended!
Comfortable, clean, charming little bungalows. Sometimes party, happy water and good vibes included in the evening (with the Ha Giang loop riders and guests)
A great place to stay, very friendly and understanding staff

Not clean! We were offered several bungalows, but none were clean (the toilet was dirty with pee and poop), hair and buckets were used in the shower, and the bedspreads were covered in hair and stains! It makes you wonder if they even clean the place. Unfortunately, it was already so late that we didn't want to change hotels. When we asked who would clean the bathroom, the owner said she would... but she didn't.

The toilet is also not designed for taller people (you'd bang your knees on the wall).

I've often experienced bathrooms in hotels that weren't completely clean or the bedspreads had been reused, but for the 800,000 VND they were offering, it should be of a different standard! Because of these issues, we were able to negotiate the price down to 500,000. Still, I really don't recommend it!

The owner is enthusiastic and thoughtful. The room is clean, airy, and fully equipped. Rcm everyone come here and experience it here. T·ª•yttt
I went on a trip and chose a room with very high requirements, so when I arrived at Bungalo P·∫£ Vi, I was very satisfied.
