address: 147 ƒê∆∞·ªùng Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: Hotel ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn
address: S·ªë 127 t·ªï 2, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang 312600, Vietnam

reviews.content: Convenient location, amazing services, fast responses to all needs. They also have drinks served to your room if neeeded.
Downtown budget hotel, clean and quite quiet, no breakfast but restaurant just around. The plus is it's location far from the tourists "homestays" 200 m. so it's quiet!

Travelling in Vietnam is a unique experience - if you get off the beaten track and want to savor life closer to how the locals live.  We traveled 2,200 km in just three weeks on motorbikes around NW Vietnam in November 2011 at an average speed of just 38 kph - and had the BEST FUN EVER!  Hotels were great and Nha Nghi  (guest houses) equally good!
Good idea after long day of driving. You never treasure a hotel with simple essentials that much: hot water, air conditioner, kettle, hair dryer and a warm bed.

So good hotel with amazing staff |The view of hotel very far and large |Japan spring flowers come soon|They have a lot of information for motorcycle and trekking around dongvan loop |Funny boss with 420 |If you go to dongvan loop of Hagiang |I think best hotel for you choose |
Quiet, clean and a peaceful hotel away from the drunks and party hostels. Great value for money.
The perfect place. The most beautiful i have evr been. Everything is excellent :)!!!
Quite a nice room in a relatively central hotel

Rice field view
Clean hotel and delicious food.
Vietnamese rural atmosphere.
Worth getting up early and walking around the hotel.
We visited as part of the Hapki loop.
Dong Van is home to 23 ethnic groups living together.
Clean rooms, convenient location, the owner was very enthusiastic in suggesting places to eat and play for us during the trip.

This hotel offers great value for money, a popular stop for backpackers from north to south. It's an ideal destination for anyone who wants to visit Ha Giang once and for all. It boasts a diverse range of amenities and attentive, thoughtful service.
Too great. Nice view. Cheap price. Everything is very clean. When the car is dirty, the owner even helps to spray the car. Room has a kettle and hair dryer. TV has MyTV
Clean hotel, thoughtfully equipped with TV, 2-way air conditioning and heating. Friendly and cheerful hotel owner
Every time I go to Ha Giang, I come here. The hotel is very friendly, feels like home, clean, beautiful, warm, and affordable.

They modestly give it one star, but for me it's really worth two. Air conditioning and heating in the room, excellent bed and shower, clean. A hospitable welcome. Located in the town center, close to the entertainment district.
Acceptable 250000 relatively clean (not perfect) bedding always very firm clean sheets. Welcomed by a little boy who speaks English, quiet place...
Quite clean, convenient, reasonable price. Enthusiastic owner.
Beautiful, luxurious rooms at reasonable prices. Prices range from 250k to 450k.
Nice and clean room. Strong wifi. Price 200-250k for double room
The owner of the guesthouse is very nice and the price is reasonable.
The hotel owner was friendly and hospitable. Great.
Clean hotel and rooms - good value for money - highly recommended!
An ancient Vietnamese village that is hundreds of years old and still pristine
Convenient for night sightseeing with the old town.
The hotel is clean and the owner is friendly to the guests.
There's an elevator, and the owner is lovely.
The landlady is very friendly and funny.
Clean and safe but no view
Normal resting point in Dong Van

title: Nh√† Ngh·ªâ T·∫•n Ph√∫c
address: 120 ƒê∆∞·ªùng H·∫°nh Ph√∫c, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: Nh√† ngh·ªâ Ng·ªçc Kh√°nh
address: 75 ƒê∆∞·ªùng Tr·∫ßn Ph√∫, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: M√àO V·∫†C SKY HOMESTAY
address: ƒê∆∞·ªùng H·∫°nh Ph√∫c, P·∫£ Vi, M√®o V·∫°c, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: Old houses homestay
address: Ph·ªë C·ªï, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: Super kind owner who, upon hearing I worked in a museum, let me see a photo book of all 52 ethnic groups of Vietnam which was helpful for my work. He also played the flute that had hung as an ornament for me which was very cool! The bed was firm and the pillows were big! One of my best sleeps in Vietnam! Great view from the garden of the area! Beautifully decorated home.

7 am in the morning, on the first day of the year, there is a construction going on right behind our room. The owner did not warn us any thing about it. I told him that it was not reasonable to pay full price for this experience, especially on the first day of the year! Then he said he did not make his homestay for foreigners, only Vietnamese. He blamed me for not telling him that i had foreign friends. So, consider this place if you are not a Vietnamese. Such an uncomfortable experience.
Nice location to stay in Dong Van! Owner super nice!

It‚Äôs a pretty house, and only cost 150K (after negotiation) for private room. I had the worst sleep I‚Äôve had in awhile, because the bed is extremely hard, and the mosquito net isn‚Äôt big enough for the whole thing. There is no dinner/breakfast service. It‚Äôs also got a lot of noise and light leaking into room. Shower has hot water though.

We loved our stay at old houses homestay! A typical Vietnamese house full of charm, away from the main street so quiet. Rooms and bathrooms were petty clean. Right next to 2 easy walk : one that goes through the rice fields and the mountains, and one that takes you all the way up to the old castle with a great view on the city.

Really nice host, welcoming and helpful! Clean and comfy place in the historical centre, under the nice view of the peek next to the house and close to the cozy main square...it's just a pity it's not a "full immersion in Vietnam" because doesn't offer dinner, but it's nothing since the market square offers plenty of options

The house is pretty and there is hot water and quite clean restrooms. The dorm looks cozy and rooms for 2 are at very comfortable sizes, very near the cafes and reastaurants... so it's easy to find food, drinks whether it's day or night.

The place is dirty and it's not a homestay as described. Their customer service is HORRIBLE and the owner is EXTREMELY RUDE. ||My family and I ended up losing money and had to find a different place to stay that night because they checked ‚Ä¶

The landlord is not friendly as the previous reviews. Even if you pay a deposit, you still can be rejected since there are more valuable other tourisms coming. Simultaneously, he will become a rude man. Alongside the difficulty of getting back the deposit, you will lost plenty of your time to enjoy Ha Giang landscapes for the argument with him. üò°

This is an excellent place to stay.  If I ever return to Ha Giang in the future, and I hope to, I plan to spend another night or two here.  I didn't meet the owner, but Luang was very welcoming.  It's a very cozy home with beautiful architecture.  The blankets were thick and soft and the shower was hot!

Beautiful homestay.
They got a big yard inside and up the hill, u can enjoy tea or have a drink there.
Because the homestay is so famous, it is quite noisy early morning and around 6-7pm eve when all the tourists check in and check out.

I actually liked this house setting but not the cleanliness of the room. The floor and bed were dusty. However the bathroom shower, I guessed, recently installed was very much appreciated after a long riding day.

Weird service. I had made a phone call to book a room and an old man confirmed that he noted down our information and promised to save a room for us then did not reply our message or answer our phone calls on the day we came. We were in panic but still no answers.
I think they only want to welcome big groups of tourists that bring more benefits.
But please, be honest to individual customers from earlier.
Such a cruel reaction in busy Tet holidays.

Honestly, I was really disappointed because I was really looking forward to staying here after reading reviews and seeing pictures. Overall, it was an average experience: 1. No online booking service so had to send a bank transfer 2. No dinner or homestay service 3. Staff were not that friendly or helpful 4. Room was clean but nothing special.

I think if your'e looking for a homestay experience, you may want to look elsewhere. This place just felt like a local motel with average service.

Not exactly a 'Homestay', but somewhere to rest your  body.  Beds are comfortable.   You need a cut lunch and water bottle to get to the toilet, don't know what you do if its raining. You have to  take your shoes off to go upstairs, but the floor hasn't been cleaned since God knows  when   The manager did look after our bikes and put them out the back for security.
Amazing character home away from the busy main road. Option of private room (two beds was only 250k) or dorm. Not sure why some people pay so little for a room and still expect luxury.

If you are a traveler and really interested in local history, this is a place for you. The house itself is 200 years old, a real relic of old time. The owner is friendly and helpful. For westerners, please have it in mind this is a homestay, not a hostel.

We had booked a dorm for six by the messenger of this page, with the total price for one night is 600k, and the deposit is 10-15% so we had paid 100k.
But when we arrived the owner said that there's no booking of us, he didn‚Äôt even check the messages history. By the time we arrived there's a group of 20 people intended to stay but due to their old age and the dorm‚Äôs condition was unsuitable to them so they left. And the owner told us that we could stay here.
When we checked the room, this is a different room that he had sent us in the messenger, this room is an open area where people can go through, we felt uncomfortable about this and requested to change to the room in the picture that he sent. But he rejected , he said that we could choose to stay or left, whatever and his reason was our low deposit (this is his request when we asked, and at this moment he was acting like this was our fault, we can pay 50% or more for the deposit but the point is the attitude of the owner).
So we decided to leave and find another homestay to spent a night in Dong Van.
One of our favourite places to stay on the Ha Giang loop. The feel of old Vietnam. If you are into feeling a place and are not precious about your "comforts"...this is the place!
It is such a beautyful homestay at Dong Van town, near town center but it keep the traditional house of local people. the owner is kind and friendly, price is so cheap for good experiences.
Beautiful old house, very authentic experience. No family style dinner or breakfast. Beds quite comfortable compared to others we had on the loop :)

Becareful with your Accommodation!
Very bad!
They are scammers. they are willing to chase you away for a group of other people to enter for a small profit. Don't expect to reason with them.
Nice play, near old town Dong Van, good price, the architecture of home is really nice
Amazing place! Truly local. Very kind people. Highly recommended!
The place is really nice and we had a comfortable night of sleep.
Amazing atmosphere. The people are very kind helpfull and friendly. I really recommend it
Good  accommodation, affordable price (2usd per day)
An old beautiful H'mong house with very kind owner.
It is a nice place. Just 100,000vnd for one person
Good choice for all client. Quiet and clean!
Noisy ans dirty. It was impossible to sleep.
It is old fashioned and good
Good, the staff are enthusiastic and lovely, close to the Old Quarter and pedestrian street. The waitress, M∆°, is cute and gentle. Mr. Th√¢n knows how to play the guitar and is very helpful.
The accommodation is warm, the atmosphere is good, and it is comfortable.

I chose this homestay mainly to experience the story of the house‚Äôs history. The room price is cheap, there are enough blankets and mattresses so it is very warm, I did not expect more than a place to rest with full minimum services.

It is an old house, a traditional house of the Mong people. If you like to experience, staying for 1 night is also interesting. The toilet is very clean, but the room, due to bad luck or something, was given a room near the stairs which was very dark, the other rooms were brighter. A bit sad.

reviews.user_name: T√¢m ƒê·ª©c VƒÉn ph√≤ng lu·∫≠t s∆∞

reviews.content: The architectural style is very beautiful, imbued with the ethnic groups of the mountainous region of HG. Cheap price with full amenities, the owner is an artist.

The space is ancient, true to its name. Uncle Than's family is very hospitable. A small suggestion is that because the room is a family bedroom, the wooden walls and poor soundproofing will still be noisy if there are many guests, even if you rent a private room.

Just for a little profit, they chased away a group of 6 people who had booked a room in advance to take in a group of 20 people who had not booked. Luckily, the group of 20 people only took a quick look and did not stay. So disappointing.

Really frustrating. Thought it was a fun trip. Who would have thought it would be a frustrating trip. There were 6 people, paid a deposit and called in advance, then said there was no room because the owner booked a room for a group of 20 people without prior reservation.
Thank you, Uncle Quan and Baby May, for having 2 days here in such a far away place that made us feel like a second family. Your enthusiasm and thoughtfulness.

The house is over 200 years old, feels like going back in time to ancient times :)) The owner and his wife are very friendly, enthusiastically advising on places to go and eat in Dong Van. Cheap price 80k/person for a dorm room

The old house is very beautiful and spacious, with a kitchen for cooking or sitting and warming up.
The owner is also a professional photographer, very artistic :D
This is the house of Mr. Than, who works in the field of ethnic culture. The house retains the traditional features of the H'mong people. Clean and thoughtful.
The house has a strong local structure, a courtyard and a fire pit where you can cook and eat together. The hotel owner is very friendly.

I booked a group of 7 people to go on the 29th. Even though we called early the day before departure and the morning of the 29th to check in, we arrived in the evening. When we arrived, the landlord had already given another group to stay.

Beautiful, near the center of Dong Van. The room inside is a bit small, but clean and fully equipped! 
Our team went for 100k/person
Stayed here 3 times, the homestay is very quiet, reasonable price, right in the center of Dong Van town. The host is very kind, the house always has a beautiful vase of peach blossoms in spring.
The motel is fully equipped, clean and beautiful, has many places to take pictures, the price is quite affordable, and the service is enthusiastic and attentive.

The rooms are quite good, the big minus is that the bedrooms do not have heaters even though the temperature drops to 1 to 3¬∞C at night, the wifi is like there is no wifi, cannot be used even when there are no guests!
Quiet space, the host is very comfortable, even let me borrow clothes to take pictures.
THE HOME OWNER WILL ONLY GIVE YOU A ROOM UNTIL A BETTER GROUP ARRIVES. EVEN THOUGH YOU HAVE PAYED A DEPOSIT. DON'T EXPECT TO REASON WITH THE OWNER BECAUSE THEY ARE TERRIBLE.
Beautiful, old homestay, lovely host but the house has a black bug that jumps and bites extremely itchy. Went to Ha Giang and came back with a body full of scars. ü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æ ‚Ä¶
The view of the old house is extremely beautiful, I'm a bit lazy to upload photos for everyone to see. But the room is quite cheap, close to the center, and just a short walk to the market.
Price 80k, shared bathroom is a bit inconvenient, weak water flow suitable for backpackers and backpackers
Beautiful and suitable for those who like experiences such as trying on traditional costumes, making corn wine...
I'm going to Ha Giang soon and planning to book a room here, but I heard from friends that the homestay owner's service attitude is very bad, so I have to think again!
Traditional house; beautiful, shared toilet, a bit damp when it rains

They turned off the lights at 10:30 pm, making it impossible to charge my phone, and at 7 am they started talking loudly right outside the room, making it impossible to rest. The place itself is very beautiful, though.
I don't want you to experience the service of this homestay. Everyone goes to Ha Giang to review to find a better homestay
There is a private area for guests to relax, eat, and have fun.
I went with a group of friends. When I arrived at the homestay, they said we were delayed. I was very disappointed with the way the homestay owner worked.
A different and wonderful experience. Emotions expressed through photos, if you have the chance you should come and feel...
It's very quiet and nostalgic here. It's an ideal place to relax.
The host abandoned the guests who had booked in advance for profit. Bad manners.
Beautiful house, near the center, fair market, friendly and comfortable landlord
The old house is very beautiful. The uncle here is very friendly and enthusiastic...
Worth the experience... Sleep in a 200-year-old local house
The beautiful old rammed earth house has now been replaced by a wooden house. What a pity!
The motel is clean and nice. The rooms are close together so it's quite noisy.
I really like the garden of the star house, it is worth our dream.
The house is beautiful but the toilet is too inconvenient. Deteriorated.
Uncle Than is extremely kind and cute. If you come to Ha Giang, you should try staying at his homestay.
Homestay welcomes too many guests, not enough space for bathing, long waiting time
Disappointed with the landlord's work, will never come back
Beautiful. Should come here once during the trip to Ha Giang
Hundred-year-old house, clean, cool, affordable price
The price of the homestay is too high. Compared to other homestays, the price is double.
Nice room, reasonable price and quiet.
The landlord is very friendly and thoughtful.
The bedroom was spacious and clean. The host was friendly.
The room is clean and airy but there are a lot of mosquitoes
All I can say is it's terrible, dishonest, and truly disappointing.
I made a reservation but the owner cancelled my booking, very disappointing.
The owner and his wife are very enthusiastic.

Classic Northwest Style Homestay
Many virtual living views.
The homestay is cheap, beautiful, and the owner is very enthusiastic.
The owner of the house is very friendly and talented.
My uncle is very thoughtful and enthusiastic.
The ancient house homestay in Dong Van looks enchanting from the outside.
The night space is very peaceful
Ancient house with simple, peaceful beauty
Worth a visit and a stay.
House ok. Owner is very uncivilized.
I was here. It was great.üòöüòô ‚Ä¶
I miss this place so much
Honesty should try in Dong Van old village
The shower water is too cold
The old house is very beautiful.
The old homestay is very beautiful

reviews.user_name: Link chuy√™n xe du l·ªãch 4-7-16-45 Le

title: Khai Hoan Hotel
address: ƒë∆∞·ªùng 3/2/S·ªë 06 QL4C, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: Decent enough rooms, but was woken around midnight with the air conditioner cut off. With no fan in the room, this led to the really tiny room getting extremely stuffy and warm. We couldn't sleep. We tried to go to front desk to ask for help but nobody was around. After trying a bunch of other remotes they had laying around with no luck, we tried finding the main power breaker for the hotel. We found it, and someone had switched our air conditioner power off. Not cool. Terrible night's sleep when it was needed. Would not recommend this hotel.

Representative of hotel cheated us when we got our room. I booked a room for couple with double bed via Traveloka. But when we arrived, hotel told they have no vacancy room as I booked, they only had a room with 2 single beds. And then, he ‚Ä¶

Fancy looking hotel that fails to deliver.

Bad wifi connection
Frontdesk unmanned frequently, had to wait almost an hour so they could let my bike out the garage.
No room service.
TV in room didnt work.
AC is extremely weak and I would honestly prefered a fan.
Shower temperature hypersensitive.
Laundry impossible if you dont want enough washed (they also charge 30k dong/kilo)
Towels for showering has the size of hand towels.
Sheets for the bed gets messy all time cause it aint big enough to cover the whole bed.

I paid 300.000 dong per night and my experience might be worth half that.

You'll have better luck at a homestay or hostel.

Nothing was terrible, however a few small issues that made a difference to the overall quality of our stay. To sum up, the room was generally fine, however for the standard we got, it did not particularly feel like 4 star, especially compared to other hotels.

The place is very new. The customer service could be improved and the rooms could be more clean also the bed was very very hard for me and i normaly like firm mattress, but this is personal preference. Over all my stay was good.

A little more expensive, but the rooms are large and luxurious in comparison to most of the same price range. Also, the bathroom was a plus, since it was one of the nicest I had had up to that point in my travels to Vietnam
Nice place in the heart of town. 2 min walk from the market and main square. Rooms were very clean and good for the price. Hot water in the shower was boiling though
Hard bed but not as hard as others in the area, no hot water, got woke up at 5 am to drilling. Paid 500 for a night which is a lot more than others in the area.
There are plenty of hotels and home stays.  The one advantage of this hotel is the location. It is nearby bus station (private bus company go to Ha Giang)

*** you MUST WALK to the reception to get the laundry phone number, though the hotel says they have that service
****** the air-con keeps turning OFF several times in the middle of the night

Must pay 50k more for air-con in Economy room
Dripping water right above your head in the shower room
Very bad hotel. No shower or hot water. A lot of noise and unfriendly staff. Don't go there.
Very basic equipped hotel, New Facilities but not functioning well. Near the night market
Unprofessional staff, bad equipment and air-condition was not working at all even they had come twice to fix it
ok.. not as clean as expected. AC was weak.
Not like the Fotos, but it was clean and okay.
New, clean. Guy wlecomes at the front speaks English well.

Decent room, just a little noisy because the window faced the main road. Clean and in good condition. However, there's no elevator, so be careful if you're traveling with a lot of luggage and staying on a higher floor. It's in a great location, and there are plenty of places to have breakfast or lunch.
Rooms and prices are suitable for 2*, located right in the center (a few steps away) to the old town, market... however, the quality of service as well as hotel services need to be further improved.
The hotel is very clean, provides quite full facilities, the price is extremely cheap if you book through the traveloka app or booking ...

The hotel has reasonable prices, however there is no receptionist on duty at the lobby, the cleaning staff refuses to clean the rooms because they are busy preparing for other guests! Need to improve on the HUMAN issue to become a beautiful, luxurious hotel in Dong Van! Sincerely give your comments!
The hotel is run down. The hot water is broken, the air conditioner is one way so it doesn't heat up, and it sprays water all over. Can't shower, can't sleep because it's so cold.
Upgraded room quality to 1-star hotel standards. Reasonable price, attentive service.
The hotel owner has poor customer service. Only the facade is beautiful. The rooms are poor.
The room is in the center, clean and okay. I booked Traveloka for only 260K for a room with two single beds.
Clean, good furniture. Has underground parking, red invoice. Next to the old quarter, convenient for travel.
Clean, cheap but just a motel, not a hotel.
Stayed in a 5-person room here, clean, only blanket for 2 people, a bit short so it was cold

hotel like motel
cheating customers
grand on the outside, boring on the inside
Hotel right in the center, newly renovated so new interior, ok price
The room is old, has no windows, the bathroom floor is slippery, the air conditioner is leaking, and the staff cannot speak English.
The hotel is beautiful, clean, and well-equipped.
Small room. Air conditioner leaks water onto the floor. Price 300k.
Room is clean, nice, new. Receptionist is not professional.
It is our pleasure to welcome and serve our guests.
reviews.user_name: Cao Nguy√™n ƒê√° ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn Nguy·ªÖn

reviews.content: Near the old town. Accommodation is okay. One of the top hotels here.
Beautiful, convenient because it is near the old town and town center
Small room, not nice. Near the center, near the market
Beautiful location near the old town very convenient :v
Reasonable accommodation in the center, cheap price
Overnight in Dong Van ancient town.
The owner is not friendly and the hallways are very noisy.
Very central location, service and rooms nothing special.
Right in Dong Van old town...quite bustling.
A bit lacking in car parking space

reviews.user_name: Queentravel - Tour Du lich Nu Hoang

title: HOA CUONG HOTEL
address: ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn District, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
Overall not a bad stay on a packaged holiday deal. Drop off adjacent to entry with a few steps into hotel.

Checkin fairly quick & 2 lifts to rooms. We had a room on the front with a small balcony & nice views of town & scenery.

Breakfast was interesting adjoining building (maybe a functions building) but was very plain with not a lot of choice.

Location is good on the main road with cafes/restaurants everywhere so lots of choice  town square only 100m away as is old town.

No other facilities in hotel. An alright stay for the area.
Good location. Glasses in room are cracked. The floor at the entrance of the hotel a little bit slippery be careful.  The room sound isolation not quite good. Need to be improved.
Great three star hotel roo.s are.good size..showers are.hot and the staff are.fantastic

We really enjoyed our stay here! The owner and the staff are very sweet and were very hospitable. They ensured our stay was comfortable and for the price, it wasn‚Äôt too bad at all. Probably one of the cleanest and spacious hotels I‚Äôve been in a village in Vietnam. They are constantly cleaning and there‚Äôs never a trace of dirt or bugs anywhere. 10/10 would stay here again
Basic hotel, with very dated features. Toilet didn't flush properly. Good for price and location. Not so good mattress or breakfast.
The rooms were of good size,huge wardrobes, huge beds. Breakfast was good. Easy to walk other areas of town.

Excellent comfortable hotel ..breakfast not good. Location is excellent also. ||We arrived here after a lot of travelling and the room standard exceeded our expectations. The weather has been so cold and the heating in the room was so cosy ‚Ä¶

We spent a night in this large hotel which caters primarily for groups and is surrounded by beautiful scenery.  An ironing room is available on request.     We were allocated a nice comfortanle room with a large bed.  We also had an ‚Ä¶

Good clean rooms and comfortable beds. That is all good that I can say.

There was constant noise and yelling in the hallway, way past 23, and the management did not seem to care. Same thing early morning. And the doors are as solid as paper so you will hear everything.

The breakfast is another disappointment. At 7:30 most was gone, and what was left was cold. When asked, they said there was no replacement. Avoid if you want a carefree stay.

Location and the beds with airco are good, but that is it.

The breakfast there was literally only a piece of pineapple and some plain rice left. Everything else was gone around 07:15 and will not be filled up again.

The rooms are thin, a lot of yelling people in the hallway after 24h and before 6h.

Employees don't care at all.

This is our first time to be in Dong Van district and we haven‚Äôt booked the hotel in advance . When we arrived we found this hotel by chance as it located in the central of Dong Van and on a main road and it‚Äôs very closed to the Dong Van ‚Ä¶

In the centre of Dong Van by bars and restaurants. Clean comfortable large rooms with good wi-fi and air-conditioning. Lift through all floors. Reasonably quiet despite the location. A basic, or simple, breakfast provided in ‚Äòa cafe style‚Äô ‚Ä¶
‚ÄèTerrible hotel, bugs in the bed, terrible smell, just don't go near it. Terrible breakfast made me sick

Weve been traveling Vietnam for 2.5weeks now and this has been by far the worst experience.

Guy at the reception desk is laying with his feet on the desk while gaming. No greetings.

A lot of noise! Till way past 23:00 and the yelling and screaming started again at 6:00.

Worst breakfast experience. Everything cold. At least wat was there.. At 7:45 80% was gone. I had a boiled egg. 4pieces of friet potato. And a piece of pineapple. That was it.

Dont go here.
Unexpected stay here in Ha Giang. Lovely hotel and very clean. Great finishing on the toilets (Grohe brand) and solid tiles too.

Its a surprise to find such a comfy hotel in a small town in far north Vietnam. The only drawback is there is no place to put the soap/shampoo in the shower room. The beef noodle for breakfast is nice except the coffee cup size is a bit small.

Beautiful hotel and great service. We had a big nice room with a gorgeous view for 600.000 a night. The only thing is we had ants all over our bed so they gave us a new room that was smaller and we paid the same rate.. But otherwise the place is great and comfortable. Great location.  Breakfast was bad.

The room itself is large and clean, shower is fine, bed is a bit hard, which I personally kind of like, but my girlfriend a bit less. It was a bit noisy in the hotel, which happens, but due to the fact that the "window" in the bathroom was ‚Ä¶

Great value for the money. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, the beds soft and fresh. Bear in mind that this is still Vietnam! We paid 30 dollars for two people including breakfast and it was by far better than other hotels at a similar price point.

I have been here on December 6 and the staffs were very poor and specially the oldest person who said that he is manager of that hotel but I think he is not good as the staffs there and don‚Äôt have knowledgeable to work as hotel. The ‚Ä¶
It is a nice hotel in a small dusty Vietnamese city. The rooms were above average and the service really nonexistent I guess.  Breakfast was kind of weak. The pho needs lots of lime.

The hotel is quite new and rooms are large. Great view from the rooms at the top. Contrary to other reviews, I thought the breakfast was good. Located close to the town center. Beds are rock-hard which personally I like.

Everything is superb. Hotel is 3* standard for room service. Clean and tidy, with glass shower cabinet. Has 2 elevators, sufficient for the hotel.

My room has refrigerator, kettle, aircon and TV set.

The one thing could be improved is internet access. Very slow, to my experience.

This is a great hotel - probably the best in town. Luxury all round but let down badly by the breakfast in the restaurant that adjoins the hotel. We were issued with vouchers at reception the night before and wandered across the car park ‚Ä¶

Nice room and facilities but no bar and breakfast is across the street.  Don't use towels unless you are prepared to pay for the cleaning.  I got charged 10,000VD not a lot of cash, but the principle.....

Nice clean hotel. Right on the main Street near to a lot of eating options. Hotel Restaurant has good food as well. The only issue was with the in room bathrooms, you can literally hear everything from the room beside :). Staff was neutral, not friendly nor rude.

We did not expect finding a place like this in a remote city like Dong Van. It's a clean hotel with spacy and cozy rooms. The breakfast was also quite good. Felt more like a decent 3 star hotel than a 2 star

It's a really clean and comfortable hotel. Unfortunately I found the staff a little rude and indifferent. I wasn't feeling great so I came down to the concierge to ask about where I could buy some yogurt late at night and I got a shrug, probably because they didn't understand but it would have been nice if they tried to understand what I needed.

||The hotel is located at the end of the main street, very close to the tourist center which is full of bars and restaurants.|The room was very large, clean and comfortable.|Very good A/C.|Rather large bathroom.|2 fast elevators.|Breakfast ‚Ä¶

Excellent 3* hotel, probably the best in town. Not a standard you come across in this area.
The bed was extremely stiff and the hot water did not last for more than a consecutive 10-15 mins, but overall I would still stay there again.

Good price, awesome location, quietish, as we go to bed early and people were excited about the soccer game, but then it was quiet. Very clean, great facilities, friendly staff, working on their English communication.
The hotel is quite new and rooms are large. Great view from the rooms at the top. Contrary to other reviews, I thought the breakfast was good. Located close to the town center.
Excellent service, very clean rooms. Very big breakfast buffet. Easy walking to restaurants and shopping. Loved the big town square for night life

DO NOT STAY HERE. Awful staff, run by liars and scammers. Zero customer service. The staff repeatedly lied to us over and over again. We still had no hot water for hours after check in. Not worth the price, much better places to stay in town. I wish I had trusted my gut and left this place as soon as we stepped in.
Nice and comfortable hotel in a non-touristic region where you would not expect to find this kind of accommodation. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Breakfast could be better.

Was there for a night stay, the room was basic equipped with Air-con and also fan, clean toilet and balcony overlook the hotel restaurant which is on another building and carpark area... the downside is the mattress is super hard and at night it was so noisy..

If you want a real frontier old world accommodation experience (like in the days of complete control) then this is the place - it's about as far from "civilisation" as you can still get in Viet Nam - yes you WILL be woken early by the loud speakers telling you to plant trees, look after the old people and pick up rubbish - yes the beds are hard (unless you score the Presidential Suite which has a modern Memory Foam mattress) - you might get to see a bird fight on the nearby park, see officials in funny hats and uniforms, hear your duck being prepared for dinner (can't get it any fresher) - the list goes on. It was a highlight of our two weeks along the north east border. Clean and comfortable - barely any English spoken but who needs language to communicate!

I have been here on December 6, 2018 but the staffs here is not good in their way of servibg special the oldest person who the staff at their hotel said that he is manager of this hotel and his attitudes not as the manager person who have really knowledgeable to work as hotel manager and he was be as the unlearned when he deal with me at the reception and he said some sentence that no manager have ever said with clients. I have been in travel all Vietnam and I have understood they are the local and living in Dong Van, Ha Giang Province but with his atitudes I can‚Äôt said any words better than zero point please !
The hotel it's more than average, as it's referred, the rooms are clean, cozy, nice beds, delicious Viet soups and an astonishing peak, to have a walk, right on the back of the hotel
When you in North of Viet Nam. Most of the time it's darn and cloudy. This hotel finally feel clear and it breathable. Clear air.
nice and clean.  huge room.  good wifi.  lack of amenity stuffs.  overall great.
Breakfast was terrible and staff not particularly friendly.  The rooms were üëç ‚Ä¶
Good price, clean hotel. Soft beds. Standard breakfast. English speaking staff.
I like this hotel ... One of the good thing is there are parking space n guard ....And one of the best in town.

Right at the downtown.

Good food offer for dinner and breakfast.

Room is fine.
New Hotel ,its clean ,nice room everything fresh & good location helping staff
Truly the most uncomfortable bed, but it was clean.
Clean, spacious and like-new rooms with nice decoration. Great hotel!
Best choice in ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn town. Clean and Breakfast include. Quiet and Relax.
The best hotel in this town. Spacious room, friendly personal. Like it!
It's 3* standard. Good view, clean and friendly staff. I will come back
A good basic accommodation. Every thing is squeaky clean and the staff are always cleaning.
Spacious new room w reasonable price. 3mins walk to ancient town
Probably the best in town, big, clean, well equiped, comfortable room. Breakfast included.
WiFi was not working when we where there, but other than that it's a very good hotel
Hardly any English spoken. Room is nice.
the best hotel for your choice at Dong Van, Ha Giang province
Lovely place, nice room with good view
Very and spacious rooms. Staff are friendly.
It is a good hotel of this area. Clean
Very clean. Staff not to good in English but OK.
The best hotel in Dong Van currently!
Breakfast was too bad, but the rooms are good
Best service of Dong Van district.
Lovely Mountain View‚Äôs from the room
Very nice Hotel, come back again

One of the best hotels in the city. Perfectly adequate for two nights. Unfortunately, there wasn't always enough hot water without a wait. Breakfast and service were good. Parking was also available. Everything was clean. Wi-Fi and a smart TV were also provided.

The rooms are fine. But the funfair set up right outside the room windows, with music and an announcer on a microphone, is awful. If you're planning on going to bed early, forget it! Also, the breakfast is local/Chinese‚Ä¶
Please think of European guests too!!!

Last year, while touring the country on a motorcycle, I stayed at this hotel in the Dongban area for a night.
I remember checking in at the reception desk in the pouring rain.
There's a row of skewer restaurants next to the hotel, and they're delicious.
The hotel has a great view and breakfast is available.
Everything was great...except for one rude male employee. Overall, it was fine.

I was a little worried after reading the negative reviews in French, but in the end, it was fine.
Room 511 is very spacious, and the bathroom is clean (GROHE faucets, shower screen separating the shower from the toilet).

The only problem is that you can hear almost all the street noise, but that's quite typical in Vietnam, unless you're staying in a newer 5-star hotel with rooms on a high floor.
During our stay, there weren't many people in the city, so we weren't bothered by the noise.

My opinion might be a little biased because we spent the two nights in homestays, one of which didn't have air conditioning (early August 2025), where we suffered a bit! But for a 3-star Vietnamese hotel, it's very good for its category and as good as some I've stayed in in France or elsewhere in Europe.
Does anyone have the hotel's phone number? I can't reach them using the number on the map.
Quality hotel. Skilled staff with the highest level of service. Highly recommended.

Very noisy hotel. Room is OK but no soundproofing. It feels like you're sleeping on the street. If you're not Vietnamese, you'd better move on. The reception staff is not friendly at all. Furthermore, the town of Dong Van is nothing exciting except for Vietnamese tourists who party most of the night.

Second stay, and the pleasure continued! A very nice room on the 8th floor, two beds, excellent service, efficient and friendly staff. Excellent location.
Breakfast has more Vietnamese dishes than Western ones: we are in Vietnam... (the comments on this subject are deplorable). Excellent value for money.

2024/12 This is the largest hotel in Dong Van, Ha Giang. Located right next to the shopping district, within walking distance. The breakfast is decent, with freshly cooked pho noodles and a simple buffet. Some rooms have a dated feel, making it ideal for overnight stays. Don't expect fancy decor.

Courage, run away
Unless you feel like you're sleeping in a bed in the middle of the road that runs in front of the hotel, sleeping with groups of Vietnamese tourists singing at the foot of your bed all night!! Add to that, the terrible reception staff who make you feel like a foreigner and unwelcome, no effort made with the language, neither English nor French nor German, NOTHING!! I forgot to tell you that the city is of no interest whatsoever.

The hotel is fairly decent, except for the loud banging all night. | The bedding is alright. Surprisingly, the small window in the bathroom and toilet is only covered by a mosquito net, not glass, and opens onto the hallway leading to the ‚Ä¶
The room and shower room are clean. However, the instantaneous water heater has a small capacity, so the hot water runs out quickly.

March 2024, located right in the center so a bit noisy, the rooms are perfect. We didn't have dinner there. As for breakfast, you have to go outside and cross the courtyard to find the dining room. The buffet is mainly geared towards Chinese food; the sliced ‚Äã‚Äãbread was so-so, the jam so-so, and the tea is on the bar and not in the buffet room... in short, not convenient, not very good, and quickly emptied.

I've stayed at this hotel several times and will gladly return. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the price is more than fair. The staff is friendly, and the hotel is extremely conveniently located in the city center. | Of course, the ‚Ä¶
Very nice hotel, well located near shops, large rooms

I stayed here for one night during a Vietnam bike tour with Vietrider staff. It was clean and comfortable. It was a very satisfactory hotel for the price. There's a restaurant across from the hotel entrance, and the chicken was delicious. I highly recommend it.

Having already stayed here in 2014, the hotel hasn't deteriorated. It's very well located, on the main square, near the market, the town center, and a few lively streets. The rooms are large and clean, relatively well-equipped for this ‚Ä¶

The hotel has potential, as they say. It's beautiful and well-located. | The rooms are spacious, the bed is a bit firm but comfortable. The shower is adequate, but the bathroom/toilet ventilation comes through a fine mesh opening that leads ‚Ä¶

The hotel is very clean, and the ground-floor rooms have comfortable mattresses, much less hard than those found in this region. The bathroom is basic, although the shower is good, and the furnishings are a bit gloomy. The air conditioning ‚Ä¶
Perfect location, as the beautiful old houses, restaurants, and market are all nearby. Nice, clean rooms, comfortable mattresses, and modern bathrooms. A rich breakfast buffet.
The hotel is very good, but a word of advice: don't eat dinner or breakfast at the hotel. The service is terrible and the food is far from tasty. Move on and eat somewhere else!

First of all, this hotel is located in Dong Van, not Meo Vac. | The Pros:| Excellent location, just steps from the city center | The rooms are very large and clean | With air conditioning or a fan | Pleasant after nights spent backpacking ‚Ä¶

My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Meo Vac during a group trip. The accommodations are good, the rooms spacious and spotless, and the bed is very large. The bathroom has everything you need, including a floor-level shower. There are ‚Ä¶

This hotel welcomes guests with a large lobby. The rooms and bathroom are spacious, but as other guests have mentioned, the beds are rock hard. It seems to be the norm here, and the hotel seems to cater more to locals. We made do with the ‚Ä¶

The hotel is spacious and clean. It is very close to Dong Van market. There are many grilled dishes opposite the hotel. Each 3-star breakfast is only 1 bowl and 1 cup. Not a buffet like other 3-star hotels.

This is Hoa Cuong Hotel. I arrived on a cold day in the afternoon. The staff are grumpy and grumpy. You can park at 600,000 dong per night and have breakfast. I couldn't make a phone call while traveling north, but the wifi here is very good. I enter the room on the 3rd floor and it is clean and spacious. The window looks out onto Two Bay Road East. It's a cold day, so the thing I need most is heating, and the heater and air conditioner work very well to warm my frozen body. Breakfast is provided. The restaurant in the building next door serves beef rice noodles. The taste is the best as a warm soup on a cold day. First of all, I am very satisfied with Hoa Cuong Hotel for the price. However, as it is Vietnam, do not expect kindness from the staff. Stay well and prosper.

You wouldn't expect such a good hotel in this remote area! The value for money is excellent. The only downside is that the beds, like everywhere in the north, are rock hard. We asked for an extra blanket to put underneath them ‚Äì that made ‚Ä¶
The hotel is located right in the center of Cao Bang city, with full facilities and good service. Room rental includes breakfast but few dishes. Polite service.

The hotel has spacious rooms with a clean bathroom. The shower is close to the toilet, so be careful or everything will get wet. The beds felt like planks. We slept on the duvets from the wardrobe to get a few more hours of peace and quiet. ‚Ä¶

Very nice rooms, good location. Staff unfriendly, if not nonexistent.
The breakfast is very decent, but beware of the many local tourist buses, which makes it very noisy at times.

The rooms are large, beautiful, and clean. We also had air conditioning that also served as heating, which was necessary in the cold of December. However, the bed was rock hard, making it difficult for us to sleep well, hence the average ‚Ä¶
Clean bedroom, plus point has 2-way air conditioner (cooling and heating). Breakfast is okay. Minus point is unfriendly and unwelcoming staff (it seems the hotel staff are ethnic people)

A very good hotel located a 5-minute walk from the city center, with a spacious and comfortable room. The only downside is the restaurant. Our guide advised us against eating there, which we did anyway. However, the breakfast included in the room price consists of the bare minimum: coffee, other items are extra, etc.

The hotel is located in the center of the small community. A warm welcome awaits you in the beautiful entrance hall, but no English or other Western language is spoken. The room (608) was very spacious and attractive with two comfortable ‚Ä¶
The hotel is clean. The buffet is very delicious and the food is very rich. No need to go out. Eating in the hotel restaurant is also great.

No dogs or cats allowed. No place to park outside. When customers come in to bring their stuff down, they just ignore it and don't say where to put it or give a hand. The parking lot had to be asked 2-3 times before they answered. If service like that is rated 5*, then get rid of the * rating system.

Before our trip, when we read reviews, the comment about the hard mattresses came up frequently. We thought, "Let's give it a try, it can't be that bad," since we've already spent the night in several guesthouses in Southeast Asia. But we ‚Ä¶

Nice, spacious room with good air conditioning. The bathroom is small, and everything gets wet when you shower. The bed is hard, but that's normal in northern Vietnam. The staff is friendly, and the hotel is conveniently located in the city ‚Ä¶

Friendly staff. Spacious rooms, but very hard mattresses. No breakfast at the hotel. Plenty of food nearby. We were woken up at 6:30 by a vibratory drill; they were renovating a room. No consideration for the guests. Therefore, not recommended.

The room and bathroom were absolutely unacceptable; everything was very neglected, unkempt, and dirty. All the beds, like in most northern Vietnam, had rock-hard mattresses, which wouldn't be a problem if the rest of the place were clean. It's best to eat breakfast out.
Unhelpful staff; be warned, a towel dropped on the floor because it's so dirty will cost you 500,000 dong. | We were told off for using the towels as mops. Disgusting breakfast

The room facilities are quite complete
The hotel has a restaurant, dinner service is attentive, lots of food. Breakfast is also quite good, delicious food, hot tea to drink after meals

Supposedly the best hotel in town. It looks upscale, but it's dated. We had a very dark room. The Wi-Fi didn't work. The mattresses were incredibly hard. I had back pain the next day. The staff was unenthusiastic.

3 stars but too bad! Wifi is not usable, sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, no shower gel, only two packs of shampoo, no coffee, only two tea bags! Soundproofing is bad!! Overall, bad for the price of 3 stars!!
The most luxurious hotel in Dong Van but more expensive than other places (Compared to the same level of rooms and services). Breakfast is really bad. Stayed because there was no other choice.

Excellent hotel, very well located, lovely room with heating (a welcome addition this time of year), spotlessly clean, superb service. Laundry service available. Friendly and very efficient staff, including the owner.

The hotel is centrally located, near Dong Van ancient town. In the evening, we can stroll around the night market to eat banh cuon or enjoy dishes such as grilled sweet potatoes, thang den or grilled eggs... in the chilly weather. It will be an unforgettable experience!
The tallest hotel in Dong Van at the moment (December 2021). Near the night market, convenient for traveling. Room price 600k, Free breakfast at the spacious restaurant.

The hotel has very nice and clean rooms. However, there was one major drawback: we ended up paying significantly more than agreed upon! Suddenly, we were charged large sums for laundry and a taxi, and some drinks from the minibar (only soft ‚Ä¶

Decent rooms, but a deplorable welcome from a petty chef who was disrespectful of his guests.
The dining room was very cold, both literally and figuratively.

Beautiful, new, spotlessly clean hotel centrally located in Meo Vac, near a well-stocked supermarket. The room is spacious. In a hotel like this, you'd expect a restaurant and breakfast, but unfortunately...||The only downside is the annoying karaoke noise from the neighbors, which negatively impacted my rating of this hotel.
New, beautiful, clean hotel, good service, price 600k/double room and 800k/triple room, hotel is built on the foundation of the old Stone Plateau hotel so it has a prime location in Dong Van town.

Excellent and very clean hotel in Meo Vac, a one-minute walk from the Sunday market. Spacious rooms and bathroom. There's no breakfast option, but the adjacent supermarket is very well-stocked with plenty of choice. Tip: bring some extras. Wi-Fi is good in the lobby, but not in the rooms.
Probably the best hotel in Dong Van town. Warm reception. Car parking is arranged carefully. The downside is that the toilet has no exhaust fan.

The room was in good condition and spacious.
The air conditioning worked well, and the location was great.
The breakfast was disappointing.
You could choose between pho or Vietnamese baguette, but neither was great.

Perfect. The hotel has a bit of a 1990s/2000s feel to it, but it's very nice. The breakfast is actually quite good, contrary to what you might expect (two fried eggs, bread and honey, coffee and tea too). It's air-conditioned, centrally located, and a little noisy (depending on the room; mine was completely silent üòÅ). ‚Ä¶

The staff was extremely arrogant, especially the male receptionist, who didn't even have time to take a photo, as if he looked down on others, scrutinizing and guarding the guests. Extremely bad service attitude
Beautiful, clean. Good cooking. Suitable for families here. There is a large restaurant for large groups. Our group had 20 cars and 70 people, ok.
Room price is okay, suitable for the price. Staff is super enthusiastic
The hotel has many clean and beautiful rooms, but you have to go down early for breakfast to get better service.

The hotel is large, clean, and relatively nice, located right in the center of Dong Van town. However, the staff were not very enthusiastic and somewhat indifferent, bathroom amenities were lacking, and the breakfast was extremely poor, with only two dishes and no water served. The breakfast staff were also unfriendly.

Overall, everything at Hoa Cuong is better than other hotels in Dong Van. In addition, the hotel has a restaurant, which is quite convenient for those who don't know where to eat. It's centrally located, near an ATM, and next to Dong Van Old Town.

The rooms are nice, well-equipped, and clean. The view is beautiful. There are various room types: single, double, triple, etc. Prices are relatively reasonable (acceptable given the hotel's good service). During peak seasons, it's advisable to book 1-2 months in advance to secure a room.

The hotel is located right in the center of Dong Van town, big and beautiful, and is rated 3 stars by the tourism department. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and reasonably priced, making it a great place to relax.

A standard hotel where you can't expect too much. There's no restaurant or breakfast, basic, but clean rooms, and an entrance that lacks ambiance. The location is great for exploring the area, but don't expect anything more atmospheric.

Very large, clean rooms with a refrigerator, Wi-Fi, and a lockable wardrobe. The only drawbacks: the rock-hard mattresses and the propaganda music blaring from the loudspeakers from early morning. On the other hand, the supermarket with its beer tap and grill across the street is very nice.

The room was spacious and clean, though it was noisy. It was rather business-like, and the staff wasn't very helpful. The location was perfect, right next to the market. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby.
Big hotel, many rooms, central location next to the old town, normal price, staff attitude is a bit cold
This is an ideal place for those who visit, travel and explore Dong Van, a place to rest, eat and have good services of Dong Van stone plateau, located in the center of Dong Van district.

A beautiful mountain hotel with spacious, clean, and comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Breakfast is served in an adjoining room (dinner is also available). Good Wi-Fi. Located in the city center, close to the market. We had a very good night's sleep.
The most awesome hotel in Dong Van. The room is beautiful beyond reproach, better than the 3-star standard of Muong Thanh hotel. Breakfast is limited. Main course is served.
The service is not outstanding, the room price is higher than average. The breakfast is very bad, the waiter is grumpy with the customer.
Clean hotel, enthusiastic staff, good room price including breakfast, stopover on the stone plateauüëç ‚Ä¶

Our group stayed here for one night. The rooms were nice and well-equipped. The hotel's restaurant served delicious food. The grounds were spacious and airy. However, the reception staff weren't very friendly. Perhaps it was because we were solo travelers and didn't book a tour? But overall, we were quite satisfied.

We stayed at this hotel one night while touring Ha Giang province by motorbike. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are super spacious and comfortable, very clean, and the bathroom is perfect. Breakfast is not included. If I were to return to that area, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again.
Newly renovated, nice and clean rooms. The best in Dong Van town. Opposite Agribank with ATM.
Clean, okay everyone! Right in the center, there is a local food shop opposite, can have a few drinks!
The hotel is new, the rooms are quite spacious and clean. The location and views are beautiful. The only downsides are the lack of shaving equipment and the slightly high room rates.
The hotel is located near Dong Van Old Quarter, just a few minutes walk away. You can enjoy the local culture and rest to regain your strength for the next journey.
The hotel is nice and clean, the lowest price for a room for two is 600k, and there's a restaurant right next to the hotel.
This hotel can be said to be the largest in Dong Van. The room is clean and tidy, suitable for demanding guests.
The receptionist is so bad. They don't help guests park their cars to get their luggage and don't show them where to park their cars. Had to ask 2 or 3 times before they got an answer.

The hotel is very well located, the staff are friendly, but we had to show our passports for a $10 pass. The rooms are large, spacious, and very clean. The only downside is the mattress; it's like a plank. There's no breakfast at the hotel.
There was plenty of hot water and a ventilation fan.
The hotel is clean and the facilities are acceptable for such a mountainous location. The restaurant is also clean and spacious.
Dinner for 2 couples in the dining room (us). Unlimited breakfast (don't arrive too late or you'll run out of coffee)
Located in the middle of Dong Van town, convenient for going to the market, a fairly new hotel, nice rooms, average service staff
The best hotel in Dong Van, spacious and clean rooms, large car parking lot, reasonable price, very good choice for accommodation when coming to Dong Van
The hotel quality is quite ok. Rooms are spacious, clean, attentive service.
The hotel is very nice and comfortable with a very reasonable price. The location is very convenient, right in the center of Dong Van town.
Hotel right in the center, nice clean room, modern facilities, good and attentive staff
Clean room, air conditioning, hot and cold water. Breakfast with delicious beef pho.

Hotel located near the center. | Large, clean room with Vietnamese comfort. | Decent bathroom, but hot water is limited. | Mediocre breakfast: it's best to bring your own instant coffee. | A few local restaurants nearby. | Suitable for a stopover. | Reception limited to the essentials.

We spent one night in this hotel. The bed was hard, it felt like sleeping on a wooden floor. However, it was very clean. The room was basic, with an average bathroom considering the area. The Wi-Fi was good, sometimes only in the lobby. The hotel does not have a restaurant for breakfast or dinner.
The space and scenery are airy and majestic. The room is clean and has basic services. Overall good!

Very nice hotel, clean, polite staff.
Reasonable price
Free breakfast
Highly rated for its prime location right next to Dong Van ancient town, clean, good facilities, big hotel, many rooms
Bathing must be every 20 minutes for one person to have hot water.

Poorly soundproofed
Very clean, large room
Rather salty breakfast
Beautiful, comfortable, modern rooms, located in the center of Dong Van town. The most ideal stopover when visiting Lung Cu & Dong Van flagpole

Clean and pleasant hotel ||Breakfast isn't great, otherwise I give it 7/10 ||In 10 years the city has changed a lot and hotels are springing up everywhere, but this hotel remains the best despite its age ||Frank
Some staff's attitude is not good. Surcharge for breakfast with children but portion is smaller and not clear.
Good value room at 600k for 2 people including breakfast. Laundry service available. Convenient and luxurious. Breakfast included.
Nice hotel, clean, reasonable price, enthusiastic staff,
The hotel is spacious, the rooms are clean and beautiful, there is a restaurant serving food, however the breakfast is not very rich.
Beautiful, spacious, extremely nice space because surrounded by fresh air of Dong Van town.
Clean and tidy room, easy to find location, enthusiastic and attentive staff

Meo Vac is visited for the local market, but considering that you can find it in other places too, I don't know if it's worth it. You have to pay a tourist tax (one place only) of 300-330 dong. The bed is non-existent, like sleeping on the floor, it's made of wood with a blanket on top.
The hotel is in a fairly central location, nice rooms, breakfast is a bit bad.
The room is beautiful, luxurious and high-class.
The room is very clean, reasonable price. There is Tien Nhi restaurant near the hotel - delicious.
Run away! Noisy, city of no interest! Already useless!!!! Run away, too noisy!
Newly built hotel, clean and beautiful. The largest 3-star hotel in Dong Van town.

The biggest hotel in Dong Van.
Friendly staff.
Relatively clean room. Towels not new.
Very nice room but a bit of a factory hotel with towers and breakfasts, in a neighboring building, not great ("service" and food)
The floor tiles are too slippery, not only beautiful but not safe for human life.
Good, polite staff, enthusiastic in helping customers. Will come back and recommend friends to stay.
Good service quality, room is quite spacious, breakfast is not diverse.
The newly built hotel is clean and spacious, has ample parking, and is conveniently located near the city center!
The room was clean and spacious, which I was very happy with. However, there wasn't much hot water, and I was a little disappointed that there was no ventilation fan.
Nice room, good price. Bad staff, very bad restaurant. Terrible breakfast
Average room, be careful not to put towels on the floor under penalty of paying 500,000 dong, the floor is dirty and the linen is washed cold without detergent

A great value hotel in Dongban. Clean, friendly, warm, and refreshing... Breakfast wasn't that great...
There are plenty of places to visit and try nearby...
Affordable price, just a few steps to the market and Dong Van old town
Hoa Cuong Hotel is a large hotel in Dong Van Stone Plateau, with suitable facilities and clean.!
A good place to stay in Dong Van, clean and nice room, strong WiFi but weak water
reviews.user_name: Bach Khoa Lechi Dorje Dang (M√£ ƒêi√™u)

reviews.content: A place to stop after exploring the Dong Van stone plateau.
Spacious, clean, reputable. This is probably the best hotel in Dong Van.
The hotel is very clean and beautiful. Spacious. Two-way air conditioning. Good service.
No restaurant, but many small traditional restaurants nearby.
Rooms are clean, airy, quiet like a 5-star hotel
In this remote place, to have a good hotel like this is rare.
The best hotel on the rocky plateau, only the breakfast is poor.
Nice room, reasonable price. Right next to the market. Will come back again.
Large hotel in the center, with food service!
Hung Anh Gas Station has RON 95 gasoline. To serve everyone.
Nice room. But the minus point is no buffet breakfast.
Spacious, clean room, the best hotel in Dong Van town

The restaurant is also very big and spacious
There is also a large car park.
Good hotel, however the area around the hotel is quite deserted and there are not many services.
Clean hotel, nice room, delicious food
The most beautiful 3-star hotel in Ha Giang Highlands at Dong Van Town, Dong Van District, Ha Giang Province
Near Dong Van old town. Hoa Cuong is the biggest and cleanest in that area. You should stay here üòä ‚Ä¶
Clean, very good water system, nice parking, convenient location easy to find!
New hotel, nice and spacious rooms. Unfortunately the rules are a bit strict.
Central location, large scale in the district, suitable for large groups
The biggest hotel in Dong Van, rooms are quite polite
New hotel. Nice room. Reasonable price.
Luxurious and modern hotel, very suitable for VIP guests
Hotel with beautiful rooms, with brown, warm walnut cabinets and beds. Quite chic. Within walking distance of shops, bars, etc.
Clean hotel, very spacious room, reasonable price
Clean restaurant good food friendly staff
Hoa Cuong Hotel is the most prominent 3-star hotel in Dong Van town, Ha Giang.
Great hotel!! We took VIP for $100. Huge room. View 270¬∞C. Comfortable, convenient, free.

The most beautiful hotel in Dong Van‚ÄîHa Giang
3 star standard
Clean hotel, one of the biggest hotels in Dong Van
Clean and spacious hotel. Staff is attentive to guests.
Nice quality interior, but breakfast needs to be more varied
Good hotel. Number 1 in Ha Giang. Price is a bit high.
Looking at a room like this, I bet they don't have enough money to even sleep in it.
Clean rooms, reasonable layout and affordable price.
Hoa Cuong of Dong Van district! After a tiring journey. okay.
Spacious and clean room, breakfast sold out early
The only and best quality 3-star hotel in Dong Van
Many things meet the requirements, only the shower faucet is not installed properly and has to be held by hand.
The rooms were clean, and the food was delicious.
The staff called the guest who booked a double bed and led him to the single bed.
Nice room, clean, worth the experience.
Comfortable, pleasant atmosphere even in summer :D
Old hotel on Dong Van Stone Plateau, old, small rooms.

South next to the airport of the district of Van
The hotel which is currently called number 1 of the district of Van
Nice and spacious room. Good food.
Clean and comfortable rooms. Nothing more to say. Hotel to recommend as it is probably the best in the area.
Clean and beautiful hotel, good service, nothing to complain about
The hotel has nice, spacious, clean rooms and a pleasant view.
Staff that have nothing to do with the beautiful Vietnamese mentality!
A hotel in the border area, popular with Western backpackers.
The hotel and restaurant are spacious. Number 1
Also located right in the center of Dong Van, big hotel, but the room is a bit old
Clean and beautiful, will come back when coming to Dong Van
Very good hotel. Breakfast a little less so.
Nice hotel, spacious room, cheap price.
There is the biggest hotel in Dong Van!
Clean, beautiful, but hot water is not very good
Clean, beautiful, comfortable. Price is a bit high
Spacious, clean room. Very good quality!
The only 3 star hotel in Dong Van
The most beautiful hotel in Dong Van, price 600k.
Clean hotel, nice view, attentive staff.
Centrally located, clean, good staff, but breakfast only oriental
Guests must remember to check the room. Generally, there are limitations here.
Clean, spacious, ok price. Hot water is a bit slow.
K is a famous hotel in Meo Vac.
New hotel, right in the town center, near the night market.

The room smelled of cigarettes
But otherwise very luxurious and comfortable.
If you stain a towel you have to pay. Unacceptable.
Clean, enthusiastic at a reasonable price
Good place to stay at affordable price
I like the bathroom and the closet the best.

reviews.content:
Dont stay there! If there is an award in noise pollution this place for sure wins it in all hotels I stayed the last 5months: 1. subbass-sound of the AC & toilet from another room 2. you will hear people speaking in the other rooms/ in the reception, as the sound isolation is very bad and the corridors make it even louder 3. super annoying elevator sound even hearable 2 levels away, you hear each time somebody uses the elevator 4. opening/closing doors is superloud too as of the loudness effect of the corridor

Even with earplugs not possible, so sadly the nice ppl who work there cant make this circumstances bettter,¬† so under the line I cannot recommend this place!p I stayed in basic places the 2 days ago for the half price that were more comfy and more quiet, proper rest is very important if you drive many hours a day, in this hotel you will not find it so choose another place!

We stayed for one night while doing the Ha Giang loop. After a long day of riding in the wind and rain, Snow Hotel was an extremely welcome comfort. The rooms were warm, clean, had AC too, comfy beds, and private bathrooms ‚Äî all of which aren‚Äôt always easy to come by while doing the loop. There was a secure place to park our bikes as well. Literally around the corner from the market street in town and restaurants. It‚Äôs run by a lovely family who are very friendly and just opened a month ago, and helped us with all our requests. Would recommend to anyone passing through Meo Vac.
The hotel in center of Meo Vac town, overlooking the square. Clean room and friendly host. Parking available
Very hospitable staff and clean comfortable rooms

It's a clean motel that looks like it was built not too long ago. It's a family-run motel with a friendly service. Even though we left from Dongban and arrived around 10 o'clock, they prepared in advance and allowed us to check in early, so we could leave our luggage in the room and ride around the area comfortably. It was the only place that allowed early check-in during the 7-day Hajang, Dongban, Meo Vac, Bao Lac, Dujia itinerary. The daughter who usually works at the counter is pretty because she resembles her mother. Meo Vac is not that big, but it's near the main street where the Meo Vac market is, so we had a good stay for 2 days. If I go to Meo Vac again next time,,,, 1) The double room has a large window so it's good to see the Meo Vac street, and 2) The standard twin room is a little narrow, but the bathroom was bigger than the double room.

Visited November 5, 2025
I booked this solely because it had an elevator, but the room was clean and the bedding was excellent.
The location was also excellent.
I slept very quietly.
Thank you for your kind service.
New hotel right in the center, spacious rooms, extremely clean, with smart TV for watching

I had the chance to visit Meo Vac and stayed at Snow Hotel. The owners were very welcoming. The rooms were clean and offered panoramic views of the Meo Vac mountains. The hotel is located right in the center, making it very convenient for exploring the town. The price is reasonable. I highly recommend this place to everyone!

The hotel is very ok, clean, the bathroom mirror is beautiful, the owner is pretty and friendly, attentive to customers, I heard she is single
The location is right in the center, near the market, very convenient
New hotel, clean, comfortable. Central location, near the market, convenient for eating and entertainment. I will book here again when I return to Meo Vac.
The hotel is clean, the price is ok, near many places, nice view. The owner is easy to approach, replies to messages very enthusiastically, and also recommends many beautiful places to check in.

The hostess is cute, pretty and welcoming.

reviews.content: Ours group very excited when staying in the Tham Ma Retreat. Cozy rooms with the fabulous panorama mountains view. Foods are really good. We are planning to come back soon. Highly recommended.Thanks you for your hospitality.

We stayed at this beautiful lodge during our ha giang loop tour. The owner is very friendly, he put us in a beautiful corner room with 10/10 views. Thank you for the delicious food, the bonfire, and to the kids for their performance.

Stayed for one night and this was our favourite stay on our independent Ha Giang loop trip.   Corner room with gorgeous views in two directions, comfortable bed, and a very hot shower.   Perfect after a long day on the road.   Our host was friendly and welcoming....thank you for sharing tea with us!

Our guide took us for coffee at this hotel during our 3-day "Ha Giang Loop" in northern Vietnam. A stop not to be missed, very welcoming hosts, a magnificent view, and an overnight stay is highly recommended if the weather is good and you have time to admire the sunrise. Beautiful interior design.

A lovely place with a breathtaking view. The staff is helpful, kind and charming, they took care of us with dedication despite the language barrier.
They took care of us with a delicious vegetarian dinner, and went above and beyond to ask if we were avoiding any other foods to adjust the meals for us.
We had a great time!
The only thing that was a little complicated was the hot water in the room, which ran out after one shower and we were unable to heat it up again.
However, highly recommend! We sat and watched the sunset from the room's balcony, it was unforgettable.

A fantastic resort. Millions of beautiful views. The staff are incredibly friendly. The rooms are clean and beautiful, the architecture is impressive, and the food is fresh, delicious, and attractively prepared! The best place to experience in the Pho Bang - Dong Van area.
Stunning location with wonderful views, great rooms, feels like a 5 star hotel. One of the best dinners we had in Vietnam. Friendly and relaxed hospitality, fun
Beautiful scenery, amazing food, and a warm welcome!

reviews.content: Ok room but very tiny the host was welcoming. We had to change our plans and cancel one of the two nights we originally booked and at first the host said he‚Äôd refund us the one night but then changed his mind and did not
What a lovely place! Booked it last minute and the hosts are so welcoming. Room is huge with comfy beds and pillows and all quite new. Super stuff

If you book this hotel you will not be going wrong they are lovely people and are very welcoming they will do everything they can to help you to ensure you have a great stay it was very clean and the bed was so comfortable this is a new hotel so is very clean you can‚Äôt go wrong for the price üëçüèª
Clean and bright room in the center of Meo Vac, free and safe parking, very kind and helpful host - I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting!

A quiet hotel, quiet city. Many photos have been posted by others, so please refer to those. The hotel pays particular attention to cleanliness. The bed, blanket, and floor are clean. I tend to get itchy the next day if there's even a little hair on the bed after sleeping, but the cleanliness made for a great night's sleep. I stayed on the 4th floor, and the heater, hot water, and amenities were great. It was great value for the price. It's near a quiet city downtown, so it's easy to walk to restaurants, and the hotel owners are very helpful and helpful. This is a memorable hotel.

For the price, it's perfect. Room with everything you need, even an electric hand dryer. The room isn't very big, perfect for one person, maybe less for two. The staff is very discreet, so much so that there was no one there when I left. The establishment is located right in the heart of the Sunday market, which is definitely not to be missed.

This is the newest hotel in Meo Bac. It has elevator access and a TV. The interior is Vietnamese-inspired, making it one of the best in Meo Bac. It's conveniently located near a fruit shop, a supermarket, and restaurants. The owners were very welcoming and kind, even pampering my rain-soaked motorbike.

This is the perfect location for those who want to visit both the Dong Van and Meo Vac Sunday markets! 

The hotel is right in front of the markets, so I was able to drop off my luggage and start exploring right away. 

The hotel was very clean, and the towels and beds were clean and smelled great. 

I wanted to go to Ha Giang the next day, and the landlady even booked a bus to drop me off in front of the hotel. What a very accommodating hotel!
I rarely write reviews, but my experience here was truly impressive. The hotel is new, the rooms are beautiful and clean. The owners were very welcoming. At this price, it's definitely worth a visit!
Fully furnished room, clean, convenient location, super enthusiastic owners.

The guesthouse is clean, the beds are comfortable, and it has all the luxurious and modern amenities. The owner is friendly, and it's close to the market and tourist attractions ‚Äì a great place to stay! üëçüëç ‚Ä¶
The room is exactly as pictured and the people are very nice. If you come to Meovac, it's a good place to stay.

Thanks to the wonderful accommodations and friendly owner and staff, I had a great rest during this arduous journey. Thank you.
I appreciated the professionalism of the process, which was quick and straightforward, with no unexpected or confusing extra charges.
The hotel is clean and has an amazing view. I never imagined there would be such a beautiful hotel in the middle of the rocky mountains of Ha Giang.
Beautiful and concise, and there's nothing else like it in the area that's fairly good.

Also they don't speak English and they have no menu.

reviews.content: This hotel is fairly basic but is well located near the centre of town, next to the market & represents great value for money.  Our room was compact but the heater worked well, which was a bonus on a cold winter's day & the small shower ‚Ä¶

During our extended stay in Dong Van we stayed in a couple of very good hotels, the first of which was the Hotel Da Nho. Check in was quick and efficient and √êing (the receptionist) gave us advice on how to get the special permit that ‚Ä¶

This place was a relief after staying at a homestay! ||It's new, clean and the room have everything they need! A private clean bathroom, AC and the price is still ok! ||The personal is nice and they speak english for the most of them. ||We were supposed to stay one night but we made it 2 before going back on the scooter!!!

This hotel is new and it had the cleanest room I stayed in during my travel in Vietnam. It's located in the heart of Dong Van, with eateries, cafes and trails nearby. I liked that the towels were clean and smelled nice, the bedside lamp was also a nice touch to keep the lights dim at night or early morning.

Clean, affordable (350k for 2 bedroom room), and friendly staff. Central location, next to the market. The restaurant next door was delicious and turned into a bit of a party bar after we ate! I'd return here for another night in Dong Van. ‚Ä¶

New and clean hotel with friendly Englisch speaking staff. Beds only a little bit hard, but I guess that's quite normal in the north of Vietnam. Next to the hotel is a great restaurant/ bar for a good breakfast/ lunch and dinner

Friendly staffs. They service you many choices of tours around, safe and interesting. The rooms are clean and comfortable. It is a nice place to relax after a long day discovering outside.
There are good restaurants and a small store next to it.

Hotel is well located near to the centre and next to the market.||Nice and clean. Very simple. Bed was large and very comfortable.The hotel does not do breakfast but next door was ok. English speaking staff.
The hotel staff is smoking at the reception, and the smell is noticeable throughout the hotel, even up to the 4th floor.
Came with a tour group so don't know the price but front rooms have a balcony, friendly service and very nice clean room

Good hotel.  They have enough everything inside the room. Near a big local maket  so i can go to the maket with all the tradistional thing in the tradistional maket. On sunday . And a bar beside the hotel.    "   they have enough everything beside the hotel   so i like it

I can‚Äôt say enough good about the hosts, then were making us tea coffee, drying our bikes when they got wet, recommending amazing restaurants, giving us umbrellas for the rain. The service was perfect and above and beyond.
