One of the best stays I have had!!! 10/10 for sure. Staff was very helpful and friendly .Food was sooo good. The best part is it's location.

The room was clean, of course, and the owner was incredibly kind and friendly. Thanks to him, I had a delicious breakfast and lunch at a delicious restaurant. If you have time, you can also enjoy the nearby Dongbang Traditional Street.

That's right. The young lady owner is cool and tsundere. Her name is "Kawaii." And she's a scaredy-cat puppy named "Coco."

but when I offered her 300k, she said she didn't have change and gave me 20k.

Homestay is in a central location, near the market and the old town of DV. The rooms are neat and clean, the homestay always has a pleasant scent.

reviews.content: A lovely resort with spacious, well-equipped bungalows and a stunning morning view. Unfortunately, the breakfast was disappointing. We arrived around 7:30 AM and the place was deserted with nothing to eat. We were given a small printed menu to choose from a very limited selection. It‚Äôs a shame, because for a property of this standard one would expect more.

Spectacular Mountain view from bedroom window, interesting room design, a variety of room styles to choose from. Comfortable stay and value for money. Breakfast buffet has local ingredients such as Pho using corn flour noodles. Fresh air. Highly recommend.

Absolutely beautiful place, perfectly place on the Ha Giang Loop and great for a first day stop if you self drive. Everything is built with the intention of having little impact on the surrounding area, the bungalows and huts are inspired by local ethnic groups and the restaurant serves great food. Make sure to do the bath, so worth it!

What a lovely hotel, with the rooms nestled along the hillside. The rooms are like little stone houses furnished in a local h‚Äômong tribal style.|The bed was really comfy but the pillows were too big. The bathroom was built onto the side of ‚Ä¶

Imagine waking up to fresh air every morning, simply therapeutic. It was a truly memorable stay at the H'mong Village Resort offering a stunning view of the mountain range, truly living up to its name. Everything about it reflects the charm of village life. Whether it was the friendly security personnel, the attentive front desk or the hard-working restaurant staff, everyone played their role with true hospitality and flair.
The restaurant is a highlight on its own, the food was delicious and the ambience gives you that authentic village-living feel. It's rustic, calming, and truly immersive. H‚Äômong Village Resort is not just a place to stay, it‚Äôs an experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind and recharge.

This place is huge, the location is so great, high up to the hill with a stunning view in the morning. Staff at reception is very good at English speaking so you can communicate and understand which is very challenging for other hotel/hostel in Vietnam.
This is a very beautiful place in the mountains. Great infinite edge pool, excellent food at the restaurant and spacious private bungalows.at the end of a beautiful scenic ride from ha Giang.
The matress was very hard!!!! ...and the staff was not too reactive . BUT in general , we had a great stay and would like to return to this place !!

Beautiful resort with the cutest rooms. Location was lovely lots of view points and small paths to walk or buggies to take you around jf preferred. Great to visit as a couple or group. The little houses were lovely, especially with heat lamps in the shower. Dinner options were good especially the dried beef, breakfast was ok and huge portions but not amazing taste. Value for money was great overall.

Amazing Resort for Relaxing After the Loop Adventure

I stayed at Hmong Resort in Northern Thailand, and it was an incredible experience, especially for anyone planning to do the Loop. The Loop is quite a tough and adventurous multi-day motorbike trip, but staying at this resort really made it worth it. The resort itself is luxurious and perfect for resting after a long day of riding.

The staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming, and the resort had many great facilities, including a tennis court, a beautiful outdoor pool, and a stunning infinity pool that overlooks the gorgeous surrounding landscape. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to unwind and take in the views.

The wooden cabins are really cool and add a nice rustic touch to the experience, even though they‚Äôre a bit small and not the most functional. Still, they fit perfectly with the vibe of the place and definitely make the stay unique. The restaurant on-site serves excellent food, and I found it to be some of the best I had in the area.

Overall, Hmong Resort is a perfect blend of comfort and adventure. If you're doing the Loop, I highly recommend staying here ‚Äì it's the ideal place to relax and recharge before continuing your journey!

Super cool place to stay at while on the Ha Giang Loop. Staff was super friendly and they even helped us plan trees in the morning to help reforest the area that was cleared to build the resort. There was a really pretty pool as well that looked over the mountains.

We really enjoyed my stay here. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The landscape is beautiful and it took me half a day to take a lot of nice pictures . Especially the foods at the restaurant are so yummy. For breakfast, the bowl of Pho with corn noddle is highly recommended.

The resort has great view, sitting on the high of Qu·∫£n B·∫° District. The Qu·∫©y T·∫•u bungalow was a bit small, but was fully equipped. Food was excellent and has reasonable price. Quite expensive but enjoying stay.

We absolutely loved our two night stay here.  We were in one of the pods and it was so cute!  Downstairs was the bathroom and upstairs was the bed with an amazing view.  Got to gaze at the stars at night and wake up to the fog rolling in ‚Ä¶

H‚Äômong village resort is beautiful place in Qu·∫£n B·∫°, H√† Giang. You can have many choices for your stay here. Because they had 25 different houses with 25 local family name. You can swim at amazing swimming pool and enjoy stunning views. ‚Ä¶

Nice place with a great view. |Staff are very friendly. Upon arrival we parked in the car parking area and a buggy came. The driver loaded our bags on the buggy and drove us to reception to check in then drove us to the bungalow.|Super ‚Ä¶

A beautiful resort in Ha Giang. The staff are friendly and helpful with the food. Great view of the rice field and of the many mountains surrounding the resort. The basket-like room was so cute with a unique design and decor. The bed is very comfy with a good amount of amenities. The pool is well placed with another beautiful view on the mountain and Instagramable shots. They even rent swimsuits in case you didn't bring any. Lots of places to walk around. The freshly made breakfast buffet tasted great, especially the pho.

- Wonderful landscape & view|- Staffs are supportive & friendly|- The bungalow is impressively designed as a traditional basket of the local ethnic people. - The panoramic view from room window is really breath-taking.|- Food at the ‚Ä¶

1 and a half hours driving from Ha Giang City to H'mong Village

The only mountain resort in Ha Giang province which provides high quality accommodation for visitors. The resort has a beautiful pool with amazing view of the mountains. The price is quite high comparing to average price of this area but it was worthwhile. Our family stayed here for 1 last night during our 4-night roadtrip to Ha Giang for relaxation. We really enjoyed it. The ambience in the morning was wonderful, with fresh air and beautiful sounds. We had great time staying here! Thanks the team at H‚Äômong village for giving us your warm hospitality!

This is where I took a few hours of strolling on my way back from my trip to Ha Giang.
The mountain range is breathtakingly beautiful.
The lodging overlooks it, and horses graze picturesquely. The smoke from burning grass to eliminate pests repeatedly obscures the mountain peaks, creating a dreamlike landscape!
The traditional Hmong houses line the hills, the tallest grass reflecting the color of the sky. The layered peaks, reminiscent of Guilin's landscapes, were a backdrop. I was captivated by this dreamlike scenery that afternoon.
It's a very spacious and lofty resort. The staff are friendly.

The homestay is new, clean, and peaceful. I was lucky to find it while wandering around Dong Van asking for rooms and couldn't find any üòç. The owner is very enthusiastic ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Ä¶
This charming homestay features a wooden stilt house, spacious rooms, and a convenient location right near the center of the old town.
The unique landscapes of Ha Giang province in the highlands offer a hope for the cooperation of the local people in both developing and preserving their cultural identity.

The house retains its rustic, old-fashioned charm amidst the much-changed town of Dong Van. The owner, Mr. Than, is kind and friendly. The prices are reasonable. I always stay here whenever I visit Dong Van.

title: Meo Vac Valley
address: QL4C, P·∫£ Vi, M√®o V·∫°c, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
Meo vac valley is a wonderful place to spend your time.
Located in the tranquil tourist village. It's located in a scenic valley overlooking the mountains. The room was clean, warm and spacious and the beds are super comfortable to relax after a long bike ride from Ha Giang going thru the cold wind, rain and fog up in the mountains .

They even offered us to join the family dinner for a decent price where we spent an amazing Chinese new year with them. Unforgettable moments with Karaoke and drinks after dinner followed by fireworks.

Recommended among all the home stays in this beautiful well kept village.

Great spot! this side of the homestays is mostly Vietnamese tourists, rather than backpackers on the other side. Beds were clean and comfortable, on the firm side. Dinner was an amazing bbq set, corn wine was great, and breakfast was possibly the best pho ga I‚Äôve ever had.

This homestay is more quiet but the ones next door have karaoke and more of a party, and they are very fun and inviting. There‚Äôs a sound curfew of 10pm so it‚Äôs not too bad.

Homestay in touristy area. Clean, good furniture. Tasty dinner.
At weekend tourists sing karaoke a lot in multiple places in this area. You will not hide from it.
Dinner was great, breakfast was not great.

Thanks to the other reviews here which encouraged us to stay. We ended up extending an extra 3 nights in their King room with a private bathroom. There‚Äôs also a terrace and a wonderful lounge space.  This may look like the most simple house on the block, but it had the most magnificent views of all! This place is located in the ‚Äòtourist‚Äô village, about 10 mins from Meo Vac town but only a few minutes from the boat rides. It‚Äôs in the section where construction has been completed. We opted for dinner here almost very night and They were delicious. Breakfast was great too! And the family were so genuine and caring. They made our stay truly memorable and special. Sherry, the English communicator, made everything easy and possible.

Nice, clean and spacious room. The staff was friendly enough. Service and food are a little expensive for the place. Located inside a H'mong homestay complex, quite nice and beautiful. Fit for someone whom enjoy taking pictures
Beautiful cultural village in valley. Lots of homestay and restaurants available. Very popular spot in Ha Giang province. Worth to spend price and time here. Must recommended.
Everything good. Room is small but cozy and have a great view to the valley. Food is fresh, we eat too much but can finished it ü§£. Very good experience ‚ú®üëå
Good location, crowded and a little bit noisy because of people singing outside. Anyway the bed was good, i had a good sleep.

Great view in the morning, the electric power is week, often has power outage. As Meo Vac is in the highland so I could not expect them to be convenient as in the city. The feeling and the view in the morning is stunning and cannot be comparable.

Amazing Experience and people in this Hotel! :) Invited me for a dinner and let me try the local foods! üáªüá≥‚ù§Ô∏è Will comeback again.

100% Reccomend!
A very pleasant place! The rooms were clean and nicely decorated! The food was delicious and the portions were large, and the dinner was fantastic! I highly recommend it! üß°

Home is clean, owner is friendly and enthusiastic. Delicious food, clean room, cold air conditioner. Room 205 has a great balcony view. I stayed on May 31. If we have a chance, we will meet again ü•∞ü•∞ ‚Ä¶
Really love the black chicken hotpot here. The room is okay. Will come back if I go to Ha Giang.
Nice hotel, in front there is a very large park for children to play, the dining area is also spacious.

The cultural village is very beautiful, but it's very cold in winter. Rooms have electric blankets, and the air conditioner is only cold in one direction. No need to shower or wash. Attentive host, friendly neighbors
Chill space, beautiful view. Here I met and made some very interesting friends, at home there is also a very cute puppy named MongMong üòò ‚Ä¶
Beautiful location, attentive service, I ate hot pot at the homestay, very good quality, everyone should visit
Homestay is clean and quiet. The surrounding scenery is very beautiful. There is a cozy heater (if you request more)
Such a beautiful place in the middle of the mountain valley. It feels very peaceful in the early morning. Everyone should try it üëç ‚Ä¶
The landlord is very nice, his cooking is quite delicious. You can order rice to support him.
Very nice, enthusiastic service, good coffee and breakfast
Located in a beautiful, peaceful campus. Enthusiastic and kind host

Nice view, delicious food.
My little dog
Warm and welcoming. This area is also very fun at night.
Absolutely wonderful experience. The host Mr. Tuyen is extremely enthusiastic and funny.
Clean room. Comfortable bed, good sleep.
There are many homestays in this area. This model is excellent.
Beautiful, airy, good place to stop
The host is easy going. Overall great.
We were able to meet local people, eat well, and have a decent room.

title: Kh√°ch s·∫°n Ph√πng Thanh
address: 145 ƒê∆∞·ªùng H·∫°nh Ph√∫c, ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: Phung Thanh  hotel is run by a lady, named Hoa, who is super kind and caring helped my injured brother-in-law who fell off the bike the previous day and transported him from the other hotel to hers. She even arranged a bus to take his ‚Ä¶

This is a motel, not hotel and accommodation is very basic. But for the little money that we paid, we got a decent sized room with twin king sized beds and an en suite bath and toilet. Rooms have a kettle, meagre toiletry ammeties, but is ‚Ä¶
Great place to stay, very clean and modern! Would definitely recommend this place! Stayed here as part of the Ha Giang loop with a group from Cheers hostel HaNoi and could definitely recommend that!

Phung Thanh  hotel is run by a lady, named Hoa, who is super kind and caring helped my injured brother-in-law who fell off the bike the previous day and transported him from the other hotel to hers. She even arranged a bus to take his broken bike back to the rented place in Ha Giang while I was on the tour. She's really gone above and beyond the call of duty. I'm very grateful and glad to know her.
The hotel is overlooking the rice fields that will definitely give you a calm and pleasant feelings. Apart from the hotel, there is also a place for you to keep your bike as well as an eating area that can accommodate up to 50 people, and the homemade meals are cheap and very delicious. Our room had two double beds for a very reasonable price, and the restroom has a shower with hot water, a decent size TV and WIFI access, of course.
Next to the hotel is a motorbike rental shop.  The owner is named Hieu, she is very helpful and she also has a great deal of knowledge in a variety of motorbikes. Most of them are new but the rental prices are very reasonable . Basically, this hotel has all the amenities and various services that it provides to its guests to enhance their stay and provide most comfort and convenience. If you ever visit ƒê·ªìng VƒÉn, I strongly recommend you stay here. You won't be regret it
Fantastic place to stay. Stayed here as part of a trip. The scenery is incredible. The beds are very hard but other than that a great spot to stay.
The bed was very comfortable, and the food that they served was very good.
I have nothing to complain on. Good rooms, quick service and nice food.
Clean, spacious, great views, great service. A little difficult to find but highly recommend
Basic hotel. The food is excellent.

Great hotel for staying in the Loop. Very satisfying and tasty dinner. There is heating in the room (necessary after a long ride in the cold.) The owner is friendly and welcoming. Bonus, a stunning view from the window.
The host is enthusiastic. If breakfast is included in the room rate, it would be great.

New hotel with good facilities as described in the picture, not like other places, all with sparkling pictures but not as expected when arriving. Satisfied with the hotel. Will introduce to many people and come back to stay here.
Clean hotel. Super friendly host. Our group asked him to cook, make breakfast, make a fire...
Not here yet, but just parking the car already feels friendly.
Clean, airy hotel, enthusiastic and friendly host
Comfortable space, reasonable price. Blending in with the vast countryside.
New hotel, still covered with lime, paint, and putty. Water is a bit weak. Price is ok.
The newly built hotel is clean, beautiful, and fully equipped.

price range 280 and up.
large parking space
Quality 2+, room is a bit narrow

title: Little Yen's Homestay
address: P·∫£ Vi, M√®o V·∫°c District, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content: Little Yen‚Äôs was so welcoming and the location was great! It was part of a little complex in Meo Vac where other homestays were around, like a small village. We weren‚Äôt far from scenic viewpoints or restaurants outside of the area. Lively at night but rather quiet during the day because everyone is coming and going on motorbikes. The room we stayed in was small but full of character and the AC was a blessing. Bathroom was also clean. The staff were kind and helpful!

A very nice and comfortable place to stay with excellent hosts, Food was plentiful and very good. The room was very comfortable and cozy. The homestay is located between picturesque mountains. Within the area are some very good scenic locations.

I was expecting more of a homestay and less of a resort complex with Vietnamese travelers singing Karaoke at the enclave of bars and cafes in this "village" of homestays. The homestay itself was clean and well appointed. Had a heater in the ‚Ä¶

The artificial village it's in has a lot of different homestays which accommodate big groups, so in the evening it's quite noisy. Room itself looks cool, walls made from bamboo, but you can find so much better rooms for that price elsewhere. I guess we would have enjoyed our stay much more if we wouldn't have had awful dinner experience. We ordered chicken with ginger and got boiled chicken without any flavour and it was disgusting. If we told that there's no flavour, they grated raw ginger on top. It would have been okay if it was cheap, but the chicken cost 250 000VND.

A warm welcome here, very nice little homestay in bamboo, with comfy rooms and food showers, plus all you need there. Kevin was really concerned about making me feel well. Just be careful if you don't like loud music up to 10pm, they try to make it funky in the evening ; and it is not the most authentic, it is located with a group of homestays like a kind of center, a "village vacances"

The reviews are misleading they are from 2018/ /2020 and now untrue and out of date. One expects a homestay to be a place with a personal touch where you can enjoy the hospitality of a family‚Ä¶| The reviews say Yen herself is there, part of ‚Ä¶

Nice place to stay, probably the best one we stayed in during the loop (Motorbike trail in northern Vietnam close surrounding the border with China). Prices are cheap, breakfast included (at least it was included for me when I stayed) and the host is amazingly welcoming. Totally worth it. 3 showers/bathrooms and very clean. We loved our stance :) There is a nice restaurant just crossing the street.

I was there off season, so I might not be a good reference: we were 2 people in the dormitory and no staff spoke English. But they were really nice, it was really calm and the food is absolutely delicious. They also had no problem with me cancelling my second booking.
It is not a real village, but the houses are made by Hmong ethnic group in their traditional style and it is not to far from Meo Vac while being quiet.
And for the karaoke, they stop it at 10pm, in every homestay, so no worries about that :)

I brought a group of friends to tour Ha Giang again and wanted to pick the perfect place to stay to make them all happy. Little Yen's Homestay was just the right place for us. The host spoke perfect English and was very organised and accommodating of any specific changes we discussed. All the staff were competent and made everything very easy for us as well as being inviting and making us feel looked after. A laundry service is offered which returned my clothes dry the very next morning before my checkout. I told the host what times we wanted our meals to be ready and they were always perfectly on time. The cook created us and provided very tasty food which we all enjoyed. The host also took our dietary considerations seriously which meant we all had a good meal. The homestay is part of a larger complex but is on the quiet site. This is the best of both worlds as you can stay in the quiet or take a 5 minute walk to one of the other homestay rented by Jasmine Hostel tours and enjoy a fun party with western guests also doing the Ha Giang tour. There is a a bar serving drinks all night at the party.

the owner is very helpful and speaks english so well! she helped us a lot with planning our day. the breakfast options were great, I loved the crepes with homemade jam. we were also so happy about the dinner, which was completely vegetarian and definitely worth the price (although not really a family dinner, you're eating together with the other guests), the best we had on the loop! The rooms aren't very pretty and the location of the hostel is nothing special, but the rooms are clean, the mattress was comfy and there was a mosquito net. Another great thing: You can get free water refills, a great way to reduce plastic trash!

Great location: off the main road, so no street noise or exhaust - but still easy to get to and near the market. Fantastic (all vegetarian) dinner: multiple dishes served + hotpot - maybe the best one I had on the Loop. The private room was spotless clean. The bed was huge and comfortable with good pillows. Clean, spacious bathroom and HOT shower. A towel is provided, but bring your own toiletries. Bikes are parked indoors for the night.

I popped in to check this place out. I didn't stay as I was only passing.
Anyway, it's a really clean place and it looks great value. A good range of rooms from dorm beds to family suites.
The bathrooms, kitchen communal areas were all really clean which is saying something in a place that gets mouldy quickly.
I spoke a little with rhe owner and they seem to be really on the ball in terms of how to please customers. I got a very good vibe from them.
Overall, I give it a solid recommendation and I will try to stay here when I return with more people.

Nice homestay. The private room is really nice, it has a private bathroom with hot shower. It doesn‚Äôt have heater, so it can be cold but they provide electric blanket so you can warm up the bed before getting into it.
We had dinner and breakfast too and the food was delicious

The hostel is great. It's in Pa Vi village, which seems to attract more local people on cars and buses, rather than locals/foreigners doing the Ha Giang or Cao Bang loop.

I preferred Pa Vi village more than Dong Van and Mae Vac because Pa Vi has more upbeat vibes, despite being a resort-esque village and not exactly an authentic tribe village.

The hostel is good. The bathrooms were spacious, and although parking was limited, I could park my motorbike in front of the hostel. Their dinner (100k/person) was great, and the breakfast (included) was not bad either. Just like other "homestays", this is another commercialized homestay too, and I'm not being fuzzy about it.

Personally, during my particular stay, there was a large group of other guests in my dorm who were loud / playing card games and kept lights on until 2AM. They also woke up early to leave at around 5AM, followed by the staff loudly cleaning up the place, so my sleep wasn't particularly good. I understand it's probably just one unfortunate night, but the whole village indeed seems to attract those who enjoy a night with karaoke.

Well, the place is really big and is more a hostel than a real homestay. There are not enough toilets for the amount of people sleeping there, so sometimes you just run between the 3(4?) floors hoping one of the two per floor is free ... + ‚Ä¶

We stayed here for one night on the loop and it was the nicest place we stayed.
Yen's English is very good so it was a rare opportunity to learn about the way of life for locals and village people in Ha Giang.
The facilities are very good, the room is modern, clean, and has really nice couches to chill out on.
Good value for money especially the family meals with Yen's family. Her dad loves to share his rice wine with you!

This is not a home stay, more like a tourist trap.  This setup has a number of accommodation types in a village  setup.  Communist dining, no water with the meal.  Karaoke blearing so loudly with multiple people singing at the top.  No ‚Ä¶

The homestay is located in a quaint resort village in the middle of the mountains and not far from Meo Vac. The surrounding view is wonderful. They provide a family dinner which is served at 7 pm. The portions are huge and the food is really good. You get to eat and exchange with other travellers which is great. The room was fine. Nothing outstanding but nothing terrible either. The interior of the room is very cute though.

My motorcycle was all packed up, I was dressed and ready to leave- and then I had one more conversation with Yen- and decided I was didnt want to leave! She is so sweet, fun, and she cares about her community and her business.  Ask her about her education programs! I was lucky enough to have a few meals with her family as well.
The room was perfect for me- I had the upstairs balcony with the open air bedroom.  Yes - it can be a  tad loud in this room - but It didn‚Äôt bother me a bit.  I loved the sounds of the village, the animals, and the rain.  This was easily my favorite place on the loop and I stayed at several wonderful homestays.  Hi Yen!!

This homestay is located in very picturesque place. The views from the room at the top are outstanding. Yen and her family are the best!!! They are very helpful, always smiling. Meals are homemade and very delicious. Yen speaks fluently English and she helped a lot with planning next steps of our trip! I totally recommend going there

To be honest, our expectations of Meo Vac weren‚Äôt sky high. But when we were welcomed by the smiling, beautiful but above all: smart ‚Äòlittle‚Äô Yen, we couldn‚Äôt help getting really excited as well. The house actually reflects the personality ‚Ä¶

We stayed two nights at Yen in a private room with shared bathroom.||The room was big and clean. The bathrooms were also clean.||We had dinner with Yen, the staff and other guests each night and it was absolutely delicious.||We had Hot Pot ‚Ä¶

What a wonderful homestay! Yen is an amazing host -- kind, genuine, and full of knowledge about the area. The rooms are quite nice and the food is great too. In addition to creating a great environment for Ha Giang motorbike loop guests, she's dedicated to hosting volunteers who teach English at the nearby school. She is full of great ideas and determination; if you get the chance to stay here, ask her about it. She's a special person, and this is a special homestay, one I won't soon forget.

This was a great homestay! Yen is the sweetest, and she also speaks great English. She helped us out checking the weather to help us find the perfect time to leave and go through the pass- it was perfect! The food was also great. The hotpot for dinner was AWESOME! Make sure to ask her about eating with her for dinner.

Before coming to explore this village you should be aware of two things:
1. This Pa Vi village is a fake village made just for hosting tourism.
2. It is probably your best option between Meo Vac and Dong Vang, as there is not much nice offer in the valley.

Food was really good and fast service. Only issue is karaoke lasted a little bit longer than wanted for people who stay in the dorm and also vietnamese wake up very early and do not bother to speak quietly while the other guests are sleeping.
Overall good experience.
@Santiago

Beautiful place to stop while doing the loop. The family who takes care of the homestay is very lovely.
We recommend it

Can‚Äôt give it more than 2*. Because I don‚Äôt enjoy sleeping with mask on. Yes the bed sheets and the pillow cases smell that bad. Please change them out more often.
My room has no heater or electric blanket, makes the night rest pretty CHILLY.
One more thing, why do you charging us for 3 persons rate but give us only two set of towels???
Can‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone. Unless you enjoy hearing karaoke noises in your sleep. Definitely-2*

This place offers everything that is important to me: super clean, very social, nutritious delicious food, good coffee, friendly helpful staff, a guitar, areas to meet the other travelers, and an overall great vibe!

They even let me volunteer as a helper to the English teacher at the local school Yen supports.  What a meaningful experience - so fun too!

Private rooms + dorm available: restaurant serving a very social, fun family-style meal, healthy breakfast.

They will help coordinate motorbikes, busses, tours, and treks.

Good location. It's a gem I fee so lucky to have found.

[Please "like" if you find this review helpful]

If I could give 10/5 stars I would! Not only is the food and atmosphere great here, Yen is THE BEST! She gave us amazing recommendations for hikes and day trips, she helped us book a motorbike, AND she went hugely above and beyond helping send my passport to me after I left it behind. Anyone passing through Meo Vac on the loop, this is the place to stay! THANK YOU YEN ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

Such a great place to bunk up. Host is amazing! We ate a really nice meal (lots of food!) and ate together with the family. There are quite a few different room options, very spacious and very clean. I would stay here again for sure

We stayed there as two friends.
Very friendly staff, cool atmosphere and delicious breakfast. It has a very good price for what you get. All seems very well organised. Met very nice people there.
Highlight was the family hot pot dinner, where people from the homestay come together to eat delicious food.
Highly recommend.

Yen is a great host. She is very open minded and happy woman. Rooms are good and we had a great dinner that we enjoyed all together. I really recommend Little Yen‚Äôs if you are doing the Ha giang loop. You will be very satisfied.

Really nice homestay at "Little Yen's".

It's a bit more quit than other hostels which I prefer sometimes. Really clean as well and the dorm for a couple of bucks.

The city is also in walking distance, so if you want to go out for a beer (they have beer as well, no problem) it's just a little walk.

The place is ok for a night, but never worth the money. it is in a valley so the views are not so good. The room is ok but the bed was horrible, you could feel every spring in the mattress, one of the worst bed's I have slept in. The breakfast was not very nice either, I asked for a mushroom omelette and got very oily frid eggs and mushrooms.

We went there for a night. We had the opportunity to park our motorbikes inside the building for the night. The team is very great and Simon understand easily French, English and Spanish ! The team give us advices regarding the bars and ‚Ä¶

The price is good and the village is very much worth staying. The food is good but beware, locals people eat alot so 1 serving of theirs is equal 2 of normal people.
The owner is friendly.
The room is a common room though.

We stayed in Yen House homestay, which was spartan but clean and and quite, a great experience. Don‚Äôt go there if you are expecting hotel type creature comfort but if you want family type service and veges from the backyard, this is it. Sapa town is dusty and there is massive unplanned development. Not a quiet cool mountain resort.

Stay one night during the loop. We got the "balcony room" and it was prestine! Nothing for bad weather but when it's sunny I would always take this room again. We paid 100 k breakfast included. It wasn't really crowded so family dinner was a 5 person thing. It was still yummy. We paid the same price (70 k) for a vegetarian version which was ok. Breakfast was nice (pancakes). The daughter runs the homestay, speaks English very well and teaches little kids at home sometimes. Everything is very clean and tidy!
Recommended homestay!

Wonderful. The homestay is really nice, with very comfortable beds. The family dinner was my best after two month in Vietnam !! Delicious food, with a lot of different things and more than you need! Good breakfast too !
The Best for the end : Yen, my favorite vietnamese girl üòç she is a wonderwoman. Gorgeous, great cooker, funny and super helpful. She knows a lot of things and it's very interesting too talk with her.
You will definitely love her and her homestay <3

I loved this place! The people are very friendly and happy, the hostess speaks good English and the beds are good.

You are eating your lunch and dinner with the family and the food they are preparing is excellent and authentic. The homestay is very clean as well. This was my best homestay in the Ha Giang region.

I wasn't very happy with the accommodations of my 4 nights stay in Ha Giang but Little Yen's Homestay in the small town Meo Vac made the difference and is the highlight of my stay. Yen is a great host and she treated her guests like old friends instead of just another travellers. The communal dinner was great and it's a very good way to interact with other travelers. Yen and her staff speaks impeccable English, so you don't have to worry about language barrier. Little Yen's not a 5 star hotel but it scores 5 stars for a cosy homestay with great hospitality. Although I stayed for only one night, I wished I could stay longer.

Actually I just wanted to stay in Meo Vac for one night, but I enjoyed being at Little Yen's Homestay so much, that I decided to extend my stay to three nights.

I stayed at one of the private rooms on the second floor which has a big comfy bed.
For one night I slept outside, which is great if you are an early bird and want to be woken up by the sun. You also have a nice view over the town and the mountains there.
In the morning you can get a big and yummy breakfast and I also recomend joining Yen's family for dinner with lots of traditional local dishes in the evening!

Yen was a great host and without her advice I would probably have missed some of the most beautyful places of my trip. I really recomend to stay here for more than just one night because there are lots of hidden beautyful places to explore in the area and you can learn a lot about the local culture here. I also enjoy looking back to the wonderful evenings with interesting conversations and fun cooking :D

Thank you for hosting me at your place! I wish you all the best for your projects and hope to see you again soon!

Friendly staff and nice room and bathroom, but since the door from the neighboring room was purely made of metal, it was extremely noisy every time they opened and closed the door, which is why I woke up 3 or 4 times during the night. Also there are no proper walls which is why you hear every word from the neighbors.... Kind of annoying. Breakfast was really nice!

I stayed at Little Yen‚Äôs during my motocycle trip in the North of Vietnam with my sister and a friend, and we had a great time! Yen and her family are really friendly and they make you feel at home!
We stayed longer because it was raining a lot and my sister didnt feel well and Yen even made a meal for her.
Everything is really clean, you can dine at the Homestay which is really convenient at the end of the day after the trip!
There are cosy places to hang out and meet the travelers it‚Äôs so nice ! I highly recommand.

The hostel is nice and clean. The staff is very ftriendly.||Yenn speaks perfect English and knows everything about the loop. She gives amazing travel advice and can help you out to arrange anything you need.

Yen is an incredibly kind and generous host. So welcoming and friendly!! Her house was wonderful, airy, and very clean. Food was incredible! On top of an running an impecible homestay, Yen is so committed to her community and uses her homestay to support volunteers coming to teach English. I so enjoyed getting to know Yen and staying at her homestay- I would highly recommend to everyone!

We ve stayed in couple of homestays but this one was probably the worst. In a private room there is an actual hole in the wall as a "window". We had family dinner for 80k each and it was missing the most important part we paid for there was ‚Ä¶

Fantastic informative homestay. Y√™n is a super intelligent young woman who runs the homestay with her family. There was a young lady volunteering there who was teaching English at the local school and also kids at the homestay. Really refreshing. Basic simple rooms but fully functional, perfect for what we needed!! Make sure you have the family dinner, absolutely delicious. Also worth going for a stroll around the town, great market place and also sports ground full of adults and kids playing every sport under the sun. We loved M√®o Vac. One of our favourites on the H√† Giang loop!

This is the first review I have ever written but I just feel the need to write one. We had a great stay here, we joined the family dinner which I can definately recommend. In the morning we joined an English class with the local children there, which was awesome to experience.

I can‚Äôt be more thankful about this homestay. It was a casualty that I had to stay in Meo Vac, and I found Little Yen‚Äôs that have nice workers, the best food I tried doing the loop, and the homestay is super confortable, they have everything you need. The owner is really nice, she has a perfect english and does everything for you to have a perfect stay. I forgot my kindle there, and she was so helpful! I thought I couldn‚Äôt recover it, but she offers to send it to my next stop. If you go to Meo Vac your not gonna regret staying there üòå

We couldn‚Äôt sleep at Yen‚Äôs because she was fully booked but we came for all our breakfasts and dinners in Meo Vac to her place and had lovely chats and enjoyed great tourist tips.
Yen is incredibly helpful, kind and cool. Please also consider volunteering for her Hmong education project! You can become and English teacher and help the community.

I've had the most tremendous time here! I was cycling through and stayed here longer than I had intended, thanks to Yen and her beautiful family. I was also able to volunteer to teach english to the Ethnic H'mong kids in the village! Yen is an incredible host who is very ambitious and speaks amazing english, she started her homestay to fund her community where she started english classes and is in need of volunteers!! Don't even hesitate, visit her homestay and experience a more local stay in Meo Vac! Also I joined her river tour in Nho Que river and it's otherworldly!

Great clean hostel. All bunks have a privacy curtain. The friendly staff even helped organize the elusive bus to Cao Bang, of which there is no mention on the internet and most people will tell you that there is no such bus. Great working hot shower and you can preorder a very tasty breakfast.

For those of you who travel a lot, you'll know what I'm talking about. Once in a while you find a hostel/homestay/hotel that makes you feel like you're home. Little Yen's was just that for me. Her and her family are more than welcoming. Highly recommend. Thanks Yen!
It's definitely more of a hostel with a paid family dinner and breakfast included. The owner speaks perfect English. Karaoke at night was fun and the Happy Water was great.

I would recommend this hostel to any one that steps in Meo Vac. Cheap and clean. The staff make you feel like home from the very first moment. They are so kind and helpful. I stayed a couple of nights. They recommend me to go for a treeking route along different ethnic villages that was simply amazing. Don't miss this authentic place in Meo Vac!

Didnt really enjoy it. We had family dinner and out of 7 different items 2 were completely forgotten with one of them being bbq chicken which was really the main part of the dinner. Rooms were strange. There was an actual hole in the wall (instead of the window) in our double room which obviously lets insects like mosquitos straight to your room. At 8 o clock in the morning cleaners started being really loud hoovering running around and laughing playing radio which was very loud as one of the walls in the room is a glass door which made it sound even louder. Check out was at 11 o clock but from 8 you couldnt sleep in this noise. Constant lack of hot water. They tell everyone to turn hot water off after shower so when you want to shower you switch it on and it takes ages to warm up at the end we gave up and had a cold shower. So yeah I wouldnt reccomend..
Little Yen‚Äôs is a great homestay! Very clean and comfortable, it felt like home. Yen is super friendly and helpful in advising routes and hikes. I would definitely stay there again.

Y√™n, thank you very much for the amazing time I spent with you, with your parents and with Phuong.

My name is Francisco and I spent one month at little Y√™n's homestay doing volunteering.

I was teaching English to the local children and helping to run the homestay.

If you're doing the Ha Giang loop please make a stop in Meo Vac and stay at Y√™n's homestay.
Meo Vac is a beautiful place. The breathtaking views of the mountains within the sorroundings, the culture and way of living of these people really make you having to stop at Meo Vac.

Y√™n speaks fluent English which is very uncommon these days in Vietnam. She will help you by advising the best adventures around Meo Vac and by providing you a very comfortable and safe accomodation. I also recommend to stay for dinner. It's so delicious and always in abundance. I had several family dinners throughout many homestays in Vietnam and this one was definitely the best.

I wish all the success for the volunteering program that Y√™n is running at her homestay. I hope in the future many kids in Meo Vac can fluently speak English and thus improve their life quality by having way more opportunities than in the past. Phuong is an example of it.

I will definitely try to visit you guys in the near future!

Francisco

The boss Lady there needs to be aware that when she 'bags' her guests in Vietnamese to the motorbike tour guides - that some Foreigners may be able to speak a little Vietnamese and know what she just said. She is rude and nasty - place is underwhelming, false and extremely overpriced.

The rooms have beautiful views, the family is very kind and welcoming, it‚Äôs quiet and clean! I walked around town in the evening and saw everyone outside playing volleyball, soccer and exercising. I would definitely recommend:)
It was a very good stay. The owner has very good English. She is helpful, even even teach us how to order corn shot. Do not miss it. Thy sky path was very nice. Thank you Little Yen!
Little Yen, Big hearted girl who cares very much for her guests. No matter if you're staying 1 night or 1 week, you can feel the her great hospitality. Also karaoke is Da bomb here!
Little Y√™n homestay is the best choose for your destination to north west Vietnam. This Homestay is owner by A Hmong lady. She has a great passion to meet other people come from around the world!
Such a nice place to stay. Yen is very welcoming and helpfull. She even moved me to another room because other people where staying in the dorm. Great care and good discussions!

Fantastic location, really nice (but small) rooms. Good food and friendly staff. It‚Äôs a very cosy vibe and it‚Äôs evident that a lot of love and care has gone into it. The staff is caring and accommodating.
Brilliant Homestay! Staff are friendly and helpful. All vegetarian family dinner was delicious. Almost all dishes are vegan which was great for us. Definitely recommend.

Little yen homestay is a cosy place worth staying at. They are running an volunteering organisation teaching local kids english. Both dinner and breakfast is excellent although a little pricey. Would stay again

We loved our stay here! Excellent and intelligent staff who went out of their way to accommodate us with a very last minute easy rider and helped with any issues we had! Very friendly and social atmosphere- we definitely recommend !
Absolutely loved this homestay! The family are so kind and Ian is so helpful with everything! Her English is fab too! Would defiantly recommend if your passing by!
Decent beds and room. Standard shared washroom. The location is a bit loud with honking, early morning radio broadcast, and karaoke nearby.
Very nice stay! The dorm bed is really comfortable and big, everything was clean and there is enough space. Cozy and good atmosphere, definitely recommend!
Super service. Fluently speaking reception English/French/Dutch. Nice dinner and great selection of breakfasts. Everything was clean and great comfy beds

This was the best place I stayed on the ha giang loop. Yen and her family was super friendly and showed us around her village to some caves that were amazing.
Highly recommend this place Im going to try return one day
Yen is simply kind and adorable. Her homestay is cozy, comfortable and affordable. It‚Äôs clean, and the food is very good.
stayed here 1 night and it was amazing! went to te love festival and was a lot of fun! the food was also very good en especially the happy water oi oi oi
Great little home stay in Meo Vac, really nice dinner (vegetarian hotpot), friendly and extremely helpful staff, comfy beds and a great warm shower. Highly recommended!
I had a very pleasant stay here. The family are wonderful people. The price is very good and the facilities are good. If I return to the area I will definitely stay here again.

One of the best guests house I've been, excellent house and clean, the family was fabulous, great food and also we did a BBQ at the forest.
Yen thanks for everything!
Cozy little homestay, quiet, clean... I enjoyed my stay here, and the lady owner is very nice and helpful. I would come back for sure!!!
Super nice and clean. Staff very nice!! We loved our double bed in the dorm upstairs. Good views!
Friendly service, clean and comfortable dorm room and good shower. Breakfast was delicious.
Best homestay I've stayed. Little Yen (the owner) was so friendly and hospitable!
Yen is wonderful and the home is clean and comfortable! Recommend to anyone staying in meo vac.
Clean. Good location. Helpful staff. You can do volunteer work here as well. Recommended.
Nice homestay. The best: all foods they offer are vegetarian and realy tasty.
Little Yens was a really beutifull place with helpfull stuff and they have suuuuper huge couple beds ;)
Nice, clean,  friendly,  able to park your bike inside, hot water, nice set up
Great place ! More a hostel than a homestay but still 10/10
80k for a bed. Nice enviroment, really friendly staff. Totally recommendable
Nice place for a good price.... Very friendly family. Was a pleasure to stay
Great place to stay for a night. It could be a little cleaner but I would come back for sure!
Staff was very friendly and helpful. Cleanest of toilet and bathroom could be better.
Great place and great food. Cheap and the owner knows a lot about activities to do around
Amazing!!  Super nice hosts, a lot of food.  Perfect :)
Great atmosphere and the best staff I've met so far. Very helpful.
To cold, you can‚Äôt sleep in there
Nice hostel. Good food and comfortable beds.
Staff was great, hot shower, good price (80k)
Amazing place with lovely hosts and the best information about what to do around.
Super fine place in super sweet town with great hosts..
Best homestay we were at on the loop!
It was really nice to stay there!
Must stay during the Ha Giang loop.
Nice place good food and clean
The place to stay in M√®o V·∫°c!
Best place on the Ha Giang loop

We booked a double room with a private bathroom here during our Ha Giang Loop tour.

Despite the hotel being almost empty, we were given the only double room, which had a smell (presumably due to the typical humidity problem). We later discovered that the neighboring double rooms were open, and upon looking inside, we realized that they didn't have such unpleasant air.

There's a small selection for breakfast; see the menu in the photos.

Otherwise, the rooms were nicely furnished and clean. Overall, we found it a bit overpriced compared to the other hostels.

PS: The hostel is located in a whole complex, and groups are also accommodated here, so there's plenty of entertainment and noise in the neighborhood in the evenings. If that bothers you, you should consider a homestay further away.

We enjoyed our stay at Little Yen's and in the small village of Meo Vac so much that we stayed an extra day. Simon, the guy who I imagine is volunteering there, gave us a wonderful welcome. He gave us all sorts of information about the ‚Ä¶

A very nice tourist accommodation complex. Everything is made of wood and bamboo. A nice, small and charming room with a small shower, toilet, and sink. The bathroom gets quite wet when showering because there's no screen. Free Wi-Fi, but no refrigerator, but a kettle and water are provided. Fairly hard beds with a mosquito net. Dinner was delicious and flavorful, with a variety of meats, rice, fries, spring rolls, and pointed cabbage. Breakfast was delicious, with banana pancakes. The people are friendly and very helpful! A great place to stay in Meo Vac during the Ha Giang loop.

Very nice place üíì BUT clearly no insulation. I had to sleep in five layers; it was 5 degrees in the room. There are no windows, so it's directly outside. It's a bit expensive compared to the average rate in the area. ‚Ç¨8 for a dorm, whereas the average is ‚Ç¨4. I didn't notice any real difference in quality. On the other hand, the food is EXCELLENT ü§©

Clean shower too!

Yen and her family are very friendly. She speaks very good English, so you won't have any communication problems.
The facilities are clean.
We slept in a shared room downstairs. We felt uncomfortable because people were constantly coming and going (our bed was right in front of us, and two other rooms were accessed through it), and the door didn't close properly (so they left it open), making it very noisy.
Breakfast was delicious. We didn't like the mango jam, so we asked for condensed milk, and it was delivered without any problems.
We couldn't have dinner there because the cook wasn't working that day. It was a shame because we came to this homestay precisely because of the dinner recommendations.

We loved our stay at Little Yen's and the small village of Meo Vac so much that we stayed an extra day.
Simon, the guy who I imagine is volunteering there, welcomed us exquisitely. He gave us all kinds of directions about the hotel, where to eat in town, and some alternative routes we could take in the area. He was always super polite and even took the time to speak to us in our language.
The hostel itself is very nice. The private room is a good size, with a comfortable bed and a small table to put your things. The room, bathroom, and other facilities are always spotless. The shower is fantastic because it has hot water and perfect pressure.
The only negative is that we were a little cold inside the hotel, although truth be told, that's something we experienced throughout the entire loop. Nowhere has central heating or heating in the room, and sometimes you feel colder inside the hotel than outside.
It's worth noting that they have a parking lot where you can safely store your motorcycle at night, and the place closes around 10 p.m., so you can't come and go as you please.
The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast. The coffee was good, but the pho was from a packet (a packet of pho in Vietnam!!! :( )), and the crepes were quite bland and cold because they're prepared in advance.
Otherwise, we quite liked the place, and Meo Vac was one of our favorite places in the Loop.

We spent two nights at Yen's Homestay, and I wholeheartedly recommend this accommodation. The place is clean, functional, and the food is excellent. The biggest plus is Yen's personality; she's the incredible manager. She speaks excellent ‚Ä¶

Yen is a charming and very dynamic young woman. A former English teacher, she speaks it fluently. Her Homestay is very pleasant and very reasonably priced, with breakfast included. Yen also knows her region very well and gives good advice. I'm going back in a month and I'll be happy to!

A peaceful night at Yen's, a very clean private room and shared bathroom. Simon, with whom we shared dinner, gave us insights into local customs and a great tip for exploring the area; he's incredibly friendly. Delicious breakfast. A homestay to recommend!

Affordable hotel with good, clean rooms. The top-floor room has three king-size beds and a beautiful view of the mountains.
Extremely friendly staff, good dinner and breakfast. Excellent value.

If you're doing the Ha Giang Loop, Little Yen's Homestay is a must-see. Set in an incredible setting, you'll find 10/10 service from Yen and his family.
They'll provide you with all kinds of information about trekking routes, nearby attractions, restaurants, and more. However, you can't go to a restaurant for dinner because the hot pot prepared here is SPECTACULAR! Plus, the cozy atmosphere at dinner is sure to make you want to stay.
Don't forget to have breakfast here either, as it has plenty of options and all are carefully prepared with great care.
Regarding volunteer opportunities, if you're interested, ask about them because it's a unique experience.
I spent an incredible month both with the school children and at the homestay reception. Yen's initiative is to offer children this opportunity so they can continue their studies and find good jobs in the future, or want to continue their studies.
So, thank you so much for this whole month, to you and your whole family, because you're all amazing, you've made me feel like one of you.

A friend and I did the Ha Giang loop, and this homestay was by far the best we found. The place is very clean and comfortable, and Yen and his family are lovely people; we felt right at home. His English is very good, so you won't have any communication problems. He also sings fantastic karaoke, haha. Thanks for everything, Yen, miss you!

Yen is wonderful, funny, kind, and very hospitable. The family dinner is delicious. The rooms and bathrooms are spotless and clean. She gives great advice on things to do in the surrounding area and is always there to help. I recommend them 100%.

We spent two nights here instead of one. It has everything your heart desires. Clean rooms, friendly people, and Yen is always helpful. Pancakes are served for breakfast, and tea, coffee, and egg coffee can be ordered separately. In the evening, there's a vegetable hot pot for 80k, which is amazing. And the area is also perfect for hiking. The motorbikes are secure and are brought in and locked at night. There's one catch: there's a shared bathroom on every floor. Everything worked out perfectly for us.

Definitely recommended!

Fantastic stay at this family-run homestay! Reasonable price, delicious dinner, and incredibly helpful staff who speak fluent English. If you're passing through Meo Vac, this is the place to stay! They're also looking for volunteers to teach English to local children!

Excellent food and breakfast! Comfortable beds, perfect welcome, and invaluable advice from Simon regarding the loop trail. French and English spoken. A calm and pleasant family! Excellent value for money :-)

Highly recommended stay in Meo Vac. Inexpensive, 100k in a dorm or 200k in a private room, breakfast included. Comfortable and clean. ||Professional staff who speak English and are attentive to guests (help with booking a bus, renting a ‚Ä¶

The welcome was very pleasant and friendly, but the double room doesn't have proper walls; you get light and noise whenever a guest goes to the toilet, and the window overlooks the triple room. You might as well stay in the dormitory, which at least has a nicer view.
Small homestay, has private rooms and clean dorm rooms, shared toilet and bathroom but clean. The hostess and family are friendly and hospitable, and give full instructions.

Yen is a charming and very dynamic young woman. A former English teacher, she speaks it fluently. Her Homestay is very pleasant and very reasonably priced, with breakfast included. Yen also knows her region very well and gives good advice. I'm going back in a month and I'll be happy to!

An absolutely fantastic homestay... The room, the dinner, and the host were all amazing!

This is the best place I've stayed in Vietnam so far!!!

Highly recommend it! üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Unfortunately, the beds were very dirty, and the breakfast for 50,000 was very meager, no more than a snack. The showers, however, were nice and hot, and the staff were friendly.

Beautiful house, clean, reasonable price, attentive service, friendly and lovely hostess, enthusiastic in guiding, especially communicating with European people is smooth. Thank you very much, when I come back to Meo Vac I will come back here!
Nice accommodation, but a bit more expensive. There's usually karaoke everywhere in the evenings, but after 10 PM, it's quiet time ‚ò∫Ô∏è
The surrounding scenery is quite impressive, the space is reasonably arranged. The room is beautifully designed and clean. The staff is attentive.
Very friendly staff. We all sat together for dinner and ate hotpot. The rooms were clean and there was nothing to complain about.
I stayed at the unique and unusual Golden Bee homestay. The people here are very honest and friendly. I really love this place...
Homestay in Hmong village, small shopping center with 24 homestays

Very comfortable and clean room
Delicious food
Everyone in the family is friendly and enthusiastic
Lots of noise because the walls are open at the top. Lovely bed and delicious breakfast.
Cheap hotel, right in the center of Meo Vac.
Not very well insulated against the cold in the double room, but pleasant. Friendly staff.
The best home stage I've ever been to.

reviews.user_name: M√≠ X√Å H√Ä GiANG TV channel

reviews.content: I recommend it, nice Vietnamese atmosphere
Homestay is quite new and clean

title: Homestay N√†ng L√®ng
address: Th√¥n B·ª•c B·∫£n, Y√™n Minh, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: Tien Dat Hotel
address: T·ªï 2, M√®o V·∫°c District, H√† Giang 310000, Vietnam

reviews.content: Its new hotel. Room is very big and clean and also Very quiet. Matress is super comfortable for deep sleep. I think,its the best choice to stay around Ha Giang loop. Strongly recommend !!

Probably the best price-value stay I had in all my trip. Booked the night on Booking (270VND) and was very impressed upon arrival. The place is new, the rooms feel very complete and the bed is soft and comfortable. There is a TV (with Netflix), aircon, and fan which all work great. I did get a room on the south side, so when I arrived it was extremely hot, but not much of a problem. Water (small bottles) and a kettle are also provided. The owner was also very nice and helpful, even though he doesn‚Äôt speak English.

Very clean, good location, and quiet. Definitely worth staying here!
I have stayed in more than 30 hotels in Vietnam over the last few months and this was the best hotel by far, not to mention that it was one of the least expensive. I can definitely recommend it!

Came here as part of a tour (no choice in where we stayed) a few days ago. Food was fine, the dinner was good. The happy water tasted watered down quite a bit. Very strict enforcing of arbitrary curfew. Might have been lost in translation, but one hostel worker was disrespectful about letting someone step out to get air. Shower hose pipe was not long enough and had a kink in it, making there have pretty much no water pressure.
Nice,clean & a new hotel. Phuc the manager is really helpful. Best location & awesome view from the balcony.

Fantastic value hotel.
Clean and comfortable
Friendly and helpful staff
Highly recommend üëå üëçüèº üëè
Great location on the Ha Giang Loop for a nights stay. The room was spacious and clean and in a good location to go and get some dinner on the evening.

Terrible experience. If it wasn't mandatory for the tour group I would have left. Churlish, disinterested staff, cold dining room. Ruder and less service than anywhere I've been in Vietnam. Absolutely not recommended.

family dinner was nice, with good spring rolls and tofu. staff super nice and attentive and welcoming.
however, room quite unclean. hairs and stains in bedsheets. bathroom floor sticky with hairs too, and the shower went cold after 2 mins. didnt heat up after even an hour of waiting. wifi doesnt work in rooms. we called staff to investigate the wifi. He came to the room, fiddled with the remote and said he would return. He did not return.
Spacy rooms with a nice view. Very clean too. Would recommend for a stay while doing the Ha Giang loop.

The shower lever was faulty and fell off at no fault of our own. We informed reception in the morning. They threatened to call the police on us unless 500,000 dong was paid as ‚Äúdamages‚Äù. The staff were rude and spoke no English. Avoid this establishment.
It's fine. The dorms were in decent shape. The happy water is good. The food was pretty good also

Is there another place in this mountainous area with such great facilities, complete with hygiene measures, that even turns on the air conditioning and heating before guests arrive, and even helps them with their luggage? It's truly commendable that you can have a private room for the price of a hostel. Koreans, especially, don't bother looking elsewhere. As someone who has traveled to Vietnam hundreds of times, this place is by far the best.

This hotel is the Tien Dat Hotel.
Impeccable rooms. Clean. Modern. Next to the main square. The reception staff can help you with your arrangements... One of the best places in Meo Vac.

The price and facilities are all great. The male owner may seem a bit blunt, but he's actually very friendly. The first floor is great for motorcycle parking, and there's an elevator. Since Meo Park is so small, the location is the same no matter where you stay. I highly recommend it.

Nice, new hotel. Clean. Friendly owner. Hot shower. Good parking. Unfortunately, the room is a bit noisy; you can hear the guests next door quite well. The toilet flush and the shower are especially loud. The shower is very close to the toilet, and the wastewater from the sink runs from a pipe towards the drain in the bathroom. The bathroom is always a bit damp. The bed is comfortable. Pillows are a bit high. Great value for money and really good for one night. The balcony was nice too.
Nice new hotel, comfortable beds, pillows. There is constant hot water, good pressure. Friendly owner. Thank you very much! I will recommend to friends ü§ó
There's no hotel like this in Meo Park. Koreans, please stay here. It's newly built and reasonably priced.

Great hotel, excellent value for money!
The bed was really comfortable, there is everything you need with the small balcony, it's in the center so easy to go to the restaurant. The man at the reception was adorable and took great care of us.
There is space to park your motorbike
Thank you very much ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Of all the hotels I've stayed at in Vietnam, this one has the best facilities and is the most comfortable, with prices comparable to hostels. I didn't expect this level of facilities and amenities for $10-$15, but I was pleasantly surprised.

A very nice, comfortable, and new hotel. The room has everything you need, from a balcony and a hairdryer to a TV. The owner is always ready to help. I'll definitely keep this address in mind for when I return to the wonderful Meo Vac market.
A hotel located near the center, with a beautiful view, convenient for sightseeing or surrounding services such as the market.
The hotel is newly built, the rooms are nice and clean. The owner is very friendly. There are car washes available on-site.
The room is neat, quite clean, fully equipped with necessary amenities. The space inside the room is reasonably arranged, with a nice view window.

The new hotel rooms are clean. However, I find the arrangement of electrical outlets unreasonable for guests to use. Although there are many electrical panels in the rooms, they are not used for convenient use by guests.
The room is very clean and spacious, as if it was newly built. The owner is also very kind, and even though I did my laundry after 8 PM, he finished it and gave it to me by 7 AM.
Room rate for one night is 300k. OK furniture. 2-way air conditioner. Hair dryer available. Weak hot water.

In one word - perfect!
The hotel is brand new!!
The room was excellent, well equipped with everything you need!
Air conditioner and fan both worked great.
Soft and cozy bed, boiling water in the shower and strong current
The wifi was the best in the east, fast and stable!
And the place is very quiet.
The owner was amazing, smiling and eager to help,
And the price was so cheap, that it is definitely worth it!
I recommend everyone to come here, great place!!
10/10‚ù§Ô∏èüôè
Excellent. Very nice, very clean room. Great location. Great value for the price.
Room is ok. Bathroom is not clean. Trash can not be emptied. Floor is still squeaky. Shower is too dirty. Hotel owner's attitude is ok. Hope to improve.
Perfect hotel. New rooms and everything you need in the room. Excellent location. Nice owners. And an excellent price. Recommend.

The room price is 450k. 3 beds, 2 single beds and 1 double bed because there are 4 of us. But the owner said the price is 300k. Booked the room on Sunday, September 22, 2019. The room is very ok and convenient. Everyone please support it.
Very clean, price suitable for tourists. Near town center convenient for traveling to participate in local tourist activities.

My last night's lodging at Hajangseong Loop...
The bedding had a strong musty smell, so I asked the desk for some washed bedding. They exchanged it for a smaller, cleaned room. The next morning, I checked out and was charged the full price for my original room.
Other services (shower amenities, etc.) were also very poor.
I truly felt like I got what I paid for.

We had booked a room through the booking app and received a reservation confirmation. When we arrived, a woman (who came out of a room 10 minutes after our arrival) told us that we didn't have a room. She spoke NO English, and we communicated using a translator app. She said she worked there and there were no online reservations. We tried to communicate with her for another 10 minutes and at one point asked via the app if we should leave. She confirmed this, and we left without a room. Very poor communication.
Comfortable stay, spacious and airy room, the manager and staff are very enthusiastic and cheerful. Very good to keep, recommend every time I come here
Booked a room on agoda, arrived at the place to check in but the motel said the motel was not in the app
The hotel was okay. The rooms were nice, clean, and cheap. I'm lowering my rating because the bed was very uncomfortable and it was noisy downstairs at the reception.
The temperature is very low, guests sleep without blankets, the hostess's service attitude is very bad.
Service quality is quite good. Amenities.

reviews.reservation_recommended:
Hotel highlights
Luxury, Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Kid-friendly, Great value, High-tech

reviews.content: This is a great value accommodation. The manager is friendly, and I'm overall satisfied with the room condition.

title: Thien Son Hotel
address: S·ªë 85 T·ªï 2, TT. Y√™n Minh, Y√™n Minh, H√† Giang, Vietnam

title: Lo Lo Guesthouse
address: TT. M√®o V·∫°c, M√®o V·∫°c District, H√† Giang, Vietnam

reviews.content:
We visited Lo Lo guesthouse during our stay in Meo Vac (family of 4 including 2 teenagers).

Ms. Cuc warmly welcomed us. Since the booking call, she paid attention to our expectations and then prepared everything for us.

The rooms are much better than the average homestays you can find in H√† Giang. Simple but well-thought. The bathrooms are well-designed and bring comfort you wouldn‚Äôt expect in Meo Vac.

Above all, Ms. Cuc made us feel at home, by preparing grilled food, discussing with us, giving advice on our trip, and truly caring with her smile.

I cannot recommend this place enough. Suitable for solo travelers, families, and even bigger groups (we came with our 4 drivers, so 8 persons in total).

Great experience ^ stumbled on my google photos / maps and thought I would leave a review for this homestay. Def would come back- cozy place with friendly staff - walking distance to convenience store / food etc. Im wanting to go back a second time in Ha Giang and i would definitely come back here as a stop but it seems like recently cleanliness/maintenance went down. Hopefully things improve üôè

Locations is good if you‚Äôre doing the Ha Giang loop but that‚Äôs all about it. The rooms are so small and the bedding felt like it hasn‚Äôt been changed as it smelt of smoke. The towels were dirty and the toilet stank.
Service could be a lot better, we didn‚Äôt feel welcomed.
It was cheap but I‚Äôve stayed in much nicer places for the same price on the loop.

Great location, great breakfast and super relaxed, seems like from previous reviews there can be loud noise (the house is made of wood), but completely depends on other guests. Was very quiet all night for us. It‚Äôs also next to a community centre and all the kids from the town came to play badminton in the afternoon, was a really lovely experience :))

Lovely traditional typical Vietnamese ethnic house. Quiet and chill and v·∫ªy good location. A place to come chill, heal and relax. However they need to clean a bit blanket and bed sheets. Also, you will be visited by a couple of kittens at night

This was the worst guesthouse/sleeping service we have ever been to. The staff was very mediocre and not welcoming, in their defense they were not mean either. The room is extremely small, the bed is very hard and the blankets were not very clean. The worst part is that we were attacked by a rodent in the middle of the night. He ate and broke my backpack, as well as one of my t shirt. After that he was running crazy inside of our room, under the bed, on the walls and (no joke) on the ceiling. We spent the rest of our night waiting in the lobby in order to check out. Please go somewhere else, this place is not equipped for the service they propose.

TO AVOID ! a dirty hotel, tiny rooms, no sheets, very uncomfortable beds, bugs, the food is ok but excessively expensive for the quality. the woman who served us pretended not to understand anything when I explained to her in Vietnamese that I was disappointed and that I wanted a discount. I just feel scamed, no compromise possible. 24‚Ç¨ for one night and a meal for two... run away, we didn't feel welcome at all. This is the most expensive night I have paid in Vietnam for the poorest service.

Lovely potential, everything was fine apart from late night karaoke that started at 10pm ( not guests) and were not planning on stopping. Then host was to tired to make breakfast in the morning. My suggestion if you want to have a party then don't accept guests that night! Plenty of other places to stay. Otherwise everything else is very comfortable! Did give a very good reccommnedation for eating.

Good homestay while on the Ha Giang Loop. Paid 300.000 for a private room for 2. The beds were very hard and the rooms were not soundproof.

I believe the homestay is also a local restaurant, where people share their meals. It‚Äôs very nice to see, but can be very loud when you want to relax in your room. ;)

For sure stay for dinner here, because the food was incredible!

The worst homestay we stayed during Ha Giang loop. The room is so small, the bathroom is so old and smells bad. The lady was annoyed from the first second we came.  As they said, they are only english speaker in village, but the lady does not speak english at all. During the night something bite my  hair brush and purse, lucky for me,  ruind only the purse and sun cream and not the documents I had inside. The breakfast was included, the lady accidently put it on bill, after I told her it should be included, she remove the food, but left the cofee and tee( persume it should be part of breakfast, but not want to argue and left place asap). So not recomended to stay!

The lady who ran this place was very nice but that‚Äôs where anything good ends.||I‚Äôm used to firm mattresses in South East Asia and actually like them, but the mattress here was like sleeping on concrete ! This was compounded by a dog ‚Ä¶

My partner and me slept here one night during the Ha Giang loop and was the worst decision ever. The place has potential but it is very badly maintained. Just entering the room we spotted a big cockroach and it was full of spiders and other bugs that bit us. We could not sleep and the service was also bad, no one taking care of anything, dogs around, etc. Definately not a place to stop by.

After 15 hours on motor from Hanoi. I stop at this house. Light from the moon and bulbs make this house was so beautiful. And even better in the morning, when you can see the mountains and passes, in front of the house.||The bed was so ‚Ä¶
Unlucky enough to stay when there was a group of 20 people doing an easy rider tour. Karaoke and noise until 2am and then from 6am. Rooms are tiny for 300k.

It's near Lung Cu flag-hole, 25km far from ancient Dong Van. Here is boring atmosphere because located in remote village. Sometimes water run out, don't waste it. If you go to Ha Giang for the first time or big group, should stay at Dong ‚Ä¶

We‚Äôve stuck in the city with nothing to do and places where you don‚Äôt want to stay. Lolo guesthouse was like oasis for us. Clean (which is rare to find) and with very friendly english speaking host. We had only few drinks here, but we felt really comfortable and happy to be there.

I must say that it was the worst and most expensive accomodation we stayed in Vietnam. They ask 150 dong per person without any food. They don't provide the food at all even you want pay for it. In bathroom there were no toilet paper no hot water (only text "hot water" on doors). One shower was damaged and not possible to use. We slept in one big room on very hard and uncomfortable mattresses. They have a kitten which was screeming almost all the night. Owners are nice, but little lazy to care any care about guests. In comparison with the same accommodation type in other places in Ha Giang province, this was a bit sad.

Love it, was lucky to have had the owner come find me and bring me back here, "do you like stilts?, house on stilts?"  Er OK...
Beautifull place for a night in Meo Vac after a long bike ride.

We got so lucky with this homestay! We were freezing when we got to Meo Vac (did the Ha Giang loop in Dec. 7¬∞C), And none of the other homestays had fire. Not only does Lo Lo have fire, they have a fireplace inside! So warm and cozy. The room is nice, the view spectacular, and they sell craft beer and fruit schnapps. The young lady who works here speaks (almost) perfect English, and is friendly and helpful. The best homestay in Meo Vac. We're super happy we found it.
This was our cheapest stay on the Ha Giang Loop and was certainly great value. They lit us a fire and it has a very communal vibe.

This is a good place to stay in Meo Vac. There are few obstacles though, which are worth paying attention. 1) If you do not posess permit, you would not be allowed to stay there. 2) A bit pricey, 100K per bed. 3) No food, you better look for it in the city. (Beware, some restaurants explicitly offer dog meat, so if you are not fans, pay attention) On the bright side - you are supporting the local Lolo community, which is allegedly the most impoverished in the whole Vietnam. The change in Sang Pa A is visible. The "traditional Lolo houses" were replaced by the concrete ones, bit the peoples' lives obviously got better. The staff do not speak English, but they are incredibly helpful, the Google Translate will do the job. So don't be shy, ask about everything you are interested, the locals will appreciate it. Do not miss.the Sunday market and also the Night Market!
The ‚Äúbed‚Äù is very hard, wouldn‚Äôt recommend staying here if you do the loop if you want a good nights sleep after driving a whole day!
Amazing and newly renovated Homestay. Super clean and wonderful hospitality. Perfect stop if you are doing the Ha Giang loop.
Better as a coffee place for the vibes than the homestay. We stayed in a private room but it‚Äôs quite small and right next to the community area.
Amazing experience, unique dinner and night, incredible vibe, cold but cosy night, kind staff. I highly recommend you are a bit adventurous.
Cuc and bac hi were super helpful. After the planned renovation this will be a great spot for a stay
Quite a nice ethic house. But the hot water was so weak and the weather was really cold out there. It's near town center so I should get a hotel room instead.
Very clean and cosy stay, with nice and friendly hosts! (Good karaoke as well)
Great location and very helpful staff. Rooms were rustic but nice.
This is the most warm hearted place to stay and meet up with some new kind friends when you come to Meo Vac.
Such a beautiful spot! Staff are very friendly and the BBQ was great!
Really good stay, the people are very hospitable. I can recommend this to everyone!!
a lovely family home stay in ha giang! thank you so much ü•∞‚ò∫Ô∏è ‚Ä¶
vintage guesthouse, nice garden, good atmosphere of the place
Beautiful view and field quiet in Meo Vac town!
Such a cute little home stay with a lovely host

Great place
Lovely and kind staff
High recommendation
Simple ethic house with moderate service. Not enough hot water
So clean and beautiful, I love this place so much
Great house, good food, best experience
Great guesthouse at Meo Vac dist.
So beautiful and peaceful this place
Nice place, nice owner, nice atmosphere!
Nice place to stay at Meo Vac
